Tom saved the day (and the Tres Primos reputation) by pouring us an extra taste, but instructing us to first chew a chocolate-covered coffee bean before pouring the wine across that bean in our mouths. This somehow transformed the flavour into something amazingly pleasing for us both!  We also ordered chicken empanadas, which were surprisingly delicious! For some reason we did not expect such flavor and complexity from a wine bar's kitchen. The empanada crust was crispy and flaky, with a filling of chopped chicken, onions and seasonings that burst into the mouth with each bite. This was no Tex-Mex kitchen empanada. Hats off Barons! Hats off!

reviews.author: Meghan A.
reviews.description: Visiting Georgetown...Was on a search for a search for a romantic day date and ran into this place. I am more than grateful to have walked into this place.   Chris was behind the bar and he welcomed us right away! The place provided social distancing and comfortability. Hubby and I just absolutely loved the service and feeling of what a wine tasting is meant to feel. Chris was so wonderful with the wine process.   Will be back for sure!

reviews.author: A H.
reviews.description: I'm so glad we chose Barons Creek over all the competition on the area. Anthony truly rolled out the red carpet and made our experience rememberal . Seven of us had the pleasure of tasting six different house made wines and delicious appetizers.

reviews.author: Anna-Maria C.
reviews.description: This place is a must-go on The Square. Not only are their wines delicious, the staff working there are amicable and knowledgeable. Chris especially helpful as he knows a lot about their wines and brings charisma to the already-inviting atmosphere. Definitely have to stop by for some vino!

reviews.author: Kim D.
reviews.description: We called ahead to see if they were open before driving an hour. They said they were open but neglected to tell us that their services were limited without reservations because of it being Valentine's weekend. We are new wine club members and felt like we were treated very rudely when we arrived. We loved our experience at Barons in Fredericksburg but would not recommend the Georgetown location. Our plan was to buy a case of the Boots wine but after they way were treated, we left our Boots behind.

reviews.author: J. S.
reviews.description: We spent an hour of fun here tasting wine but did not much care for their selection of provided wines. Barons had more of an uppity vibe to it, so maybe I wasn't picking up what they were putting down from the jump as I tend gravitate toward a more casual atmosphere... especially when it comes to wine tasting.   They were nice and helpful here and poured us a cup of Tempranillo and Crazy Train on our way out, to drink while we walked around the square. Both good wines but did not justify the price tag for us.

reviews.author: Josh O.
reviews.description: We love Barons Creek. Anthony is amazing and constantly ensuring guest have a great experience.  Thankful to have this in Georgetown.

reviews.author: T R.
reviews.description: Absolutely delightful service and atmosphere. It's so great to have a place on the square to enjoy wine. The bottles are a little pricier than expected (I think maybe you need to join the wine club?) but if you are looking for a solid enjoyable afternoon or evening out with friends, a nice cheese plate or a bite from the restaurant next door, and knowledgeable sommeliers who can find you something you will enjoy - you can't go wrong.

reviews.author: A. J.
reviews.description: Awesome place to have some wine.  Friendly and knowledgeable staff.  Ask all the questions about wine you want and they will have the answer.   Has piano in back.   Decor is nice and the place is super clean.   It's definitely a fun stop around the square.  Go have a glass or two!!!

reviews.author: Elizabeth K.
reviews.description: I don't know what I was expecting when I walked in, but I was blown away. It's beautiful inside. The wine counter/bar is long. There was live music. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. We did a wine tasting and then sat down with a glass. I'm really glad this is here. It's perfect.

reviews.author: Bailey B.
reviews.description: This place is super cozy and perfect to go to on a cooler rainy day, and not crowded at all; the server was polite and made a good choice when I asked him to surprise me after informing him I preferred drier spicier reds.

reviews.author: Kelly O.
reviews.description: Chris is amazing. He made our very first wine tasting experience incredible. We went as two couples and had a great time conversing with Chris and learning about the wines we were introduced to. 100% recommend.

reviews.author: Marco Antonio G.
reviews.description: Love the new location and all the wine hosts. Friendly, kind and eager to share their knowledge of wine. If you happen to stop by say hi to Anthony, he's an awesome person who knows a lot. And lets not forget the wine! So far we love all the wines and location and will keep coming back. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Blane W.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere. Cool vibe walking in. Presumptuous personality behind the bar. Extravagant prices. $15.16 for what looked like maybe 6 oz.  Wine was decent, yet no desire to return.

reviews.author: Travis H.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere.     However the wine was terrible.   The first red flag should be when the bartender says "we tell all our customers not to smell the wine".     Who says that?    Now I know why.    It smelt like, well I just cannot describe it.  I am a member of 6 wine clubs and have tasted my share of wines.   Definitely would not recommend this place especially when most of their wine is significantly overpriced at $40+ per bottle.

reviews.author: Mindy W.
reviews.description: We loved this winery! Chris hosted our tasting and was knowledgeable, friendly, and fun. He even made recommendations for local hot spots and wines to order at each restaurant. The wine was delicious and ambience was fantastic. They had live music when we went that really added to the atmosphere. I recommend and will go back!

reviews.author: Reynaldo B.
reviews.description: Wonderful atmosphere! Great wine! Keri was amazing at explaining all the tasting and we realized we had a very similar palate. Very friendly staff and welcoming. I'm enjoying it here!

reviews.author: Gary G.
reviews.description: Classy space, nice location and excellent wine.  Had the distinct pleasure of being served by waitress Jennie Tedesco while drinking an excellent red wine blend.  Jennie's ability to know exactly what we wanted before we did was truly enjoyable and her knowledge of wine and friendly professionalism made for a great Saturday outing.  Have been to both the Grape Creek Vineyards near Fredericksburg and to the Georgetown tasting room.  Each are excellent, but the Georgetown location with its wonderful staff are the reason we keep our coming back.

reviews.author: Natalia R.
reviews.description: Covid review 12/2020 No seating for non-members and I suppose no kindness for them either. I went to the front and was rudely "greeted". We left because why would I purchase wine from someone who seems to treat me without professionalism since I'm not a member? Hmm not a way to acquire new members!

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: This was an amazing experience. The food was just as good as the wine !! The pizzas were amazing. The charcuterie board was to die for, meatballs were okay, and garlic hummus was a winner.

reviews.author: William B.
reviews.description: Conveniently located on the Georgetown Square, Grape Creek Vineyards tasting room is a welcoming oasis of great wines and friendly "tasting ambassadors". You know Grape Creek's wine is good: they earned almost 2 dozen medals, including three Double Golds, this year at the prestigious San Francisco Wine Competition. And their wins encompass all styles, with Double Gold wins for red, white and Port. My Tasting Ambassador, Sandy, was exceptional! As we talked, she discerned my tastes and made a couple of recommendations that turned out to be spot on. She was knowledgeable and responsive, and a delight to talk with. Having been to many tasting rooms and wineries in the Texas Hill Country as well as from the California wine regions to the New York Finger Lakes, my experience at Grape Creek exceeded my expectations. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Phillip H.
reviews.description: These guys are extremely rude. We all purchased memberships and wanted to enjoy our wine on the patio which was mostly empty. Since they made us split up our party of six we got two tables that were close together. Apparently management had a problem with my girlfriend and I orienting our chairs towards our friends table so we could all talk to each other and came and got in our faces to tell us we have to turn our chairs around and face forward. What is this kindergarten? The wine was alright, but definitely not good enough to justify the $40 per bottle price tag. I've found better bottles at HEB for under $20. Don't waste your time or money. There are plenty of other wineries in the area of the same quality that are more affordable and less rude

reviews.author: Erica G.
reviews.description: Grape Creek is my official go to for Georgetown vino. After signing up in Fredericksburg, I've quickly come to LOVE their red wines...particularly Bellisimo. It is absolutely delish and my go to red for my collection and for gifting to friends.   While the main building itself is somewhat small and doesnt offer the option to sit downstairs (GC....this is overdue), there is a members only room available upstaird with views of the Gtown Square.  The patio however is the reason people gravitate towards this winery. There is live music, nice fans to keep you cool in summer and heaters for the winter.  My only dislike is the changes hours...it closes at 6:30. Far too early and down the street are alternatives that stay open til 9 or later.

reviews.author: Angela P.
reviews.description: This was the second stop during my Saturday night wine bender. I've never been here before. My friend is a wine club member and invited us to accompany her and her significant other to a tasting. We ended up enjoying a bottle! It was delicious. We sat in the reserved section on the second floor and finished the bottle and relaxed. Grape Creek has a nice selection of local wines to choose. Although the facility is small, the atmosphere is friendly and quaint.

reviews.author: Shelley F.
reviews.description: Visited during a recent trip and was delighted.  EVE WAS AMAZING - she explained things so well on our tasting!

reviews.author: Russ V.
reviews.description: Good wine, fun old/down town feels, great staff, what more do you want? We signed up for the membership cuz yum!

reviews.author: J. S.
reviews.description: Could not love this winery more. Although... standing in line when you first walk-in did seem a bit off, it was merely just a way to help usher traffic through more efficiently. Luckily, the line went quickly or this would probably be a different type of review, as someone * wink wink* who doesn't do well with lines for absolutely anything, except that one Prince concert 30 years ago.   Needless to say, we came, we tasted, we joined the wine club and now we are big fans. Especially of their Rose of Malbec. That deliciously tasting watermelon jolly rancher (without the sugar) wine has changed wine drinking for me and completely justifies the $30 price tag.

reviews.author: Kami S.
reviews.description: We were sharing a couple bottles on the patio (my friend is a member) when an employee (who was drinking a glass of wine herself) came out and told us extremely rudely that they were closed and we needed to get out. She started jerking things away from the table while we were still sitting there. We had previously been sitting there calmly, not being loud or offensive in any way - it felt very abrupt and extremely rude. We realized after we were booted out that closing was at 5 and this intrusion happened at 5:10, it wasn't like they were waiting on us for an hour. Even though my friend is a member we won't be coming back.

reviews.author: Joey G.
reviews.description: We bought our membership in Fredericksburg, but we live in Round Rock. When you join the club, you get two glasses a day, and we are regulars at the Georgetown square. Everyone there is very friendly. We do miss the live music in the back. But it's nice to grab our glasses and sit on the square.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Fantastic service and wonderful atmosphere. This place does it right. It is very comfortable, the staff is welcoming and just an overall great place to spend some time and relax on the square in Georgetown. Whether in the members only room upstairs or out on the private patio, this is a very nice place.

reviews.author: Emily M.
reviews.description: I'm really unsure what to say about this place. I've only been here a couple of times and the staff member that helped us was amazing. I decided to join the wine club because of her level of service. However, it's hard to get a hold of someone on the phone. I have a simple question to ask but no one will ever pick up the phone. When select the button to speak to the tasting room, their automated service starts all over again. Yes, I can email, but for a simple question, picking up the phone should be an easy option as well.  Also, the times on yelp versus their times on the phone are inconsistent. That needs to be updated.  Bottomline, they lack communication.  It's really annoying and frustrating. I plan on canceling my wine club membership and going elsewhere due to the experience that I've had.

reviews.author: Kenneth B.
reviews.description: This winery is smack downtown Georgetown and has a really great feel. It has a great assortment of wine that is reasonably priced. I really like this winery, with the exclusive access to seating upstairs. I love the live entertainment outside lounge area. I really like this winery! I also like how EVERY time you come to the winery, you get a complimentary glass of wine! Of course, you need a membership.  I don't live in the area so I have a trek to make to receive my complimentary glass of wine for me and a guest. However, when I am in the area you better believe I am here. I just started my membership last visit but failed to write a review after a couple of bottles. My apologies. I was informed that my three bottles qill be mailed to my residence in Harker Heights, Texas. I will be sure to post how that goes. You can cancel the membership at anytime. More to follow after I really get a chance to experience this establishment.

reviews.author: Pamela M.
reviews.description: Grape Creek Vineyards is about 2 miles from my best friend's house in downtown Georgetown. We had so much fun there!  My sorority sisters came to Georgetown for Austin's ACL Fest and added on extra days to sightsee.   Grape Creek was a wonderful respite.  You stand in line, describe your likes to the salesperson, and taste. Then, you get wine by the glass (I think it was 10$/glass) to enjoy on their relaxing patio, and bottles to go.   My BF is a frequent member and has a card to get 2 free glasses of wine a month.   A very nice spot to relax and enjoy good wine and good conversation.   Thank you Grape Creek Vineyards!

reviews.author: Adam H.
reviews.description: After joining the wine club on our visit to the Main Street location in Fredericksburg, we picked up our June 2018 shipment in Georgetown and had a fun day on the square. It's going to be a quarterly experience for my wife and I, which includes a 6-sample tasting or half glass each visit and access to the upstairs member only area. We went on a Saturday around 5:00 and it was busy! The wait for the tasting was only a few minutes since they fully staffed the counter. I think I saw them doing 5 couples or groups at a time.  She told us that we can order delivery from Gumbo's around the corner or bring in any food that we want! The offer live music on the weekends on the patio and dogs are welcome out there. The member only area was packed with people, so it was a bit hot, but had comfortable couches and chairs, many windows overlooking the courthouse and town square, and some salespeople offering tastes of the Owner's Club wines. I only took off a star because the member's area was hot and could use some more seating and a server would be great since it takes a while to get another glass or make a purchase by standing in line more than once.  The had quite a bit of wine related merchandise, cheese, olive oils and vinegars, and cookbooks downstairs.

reviews.author: Zane G.
reviews.description: Elizabeth, Julie, Kelly, Jenn and crew always take care of us when we come in.  We love being able to come in after work and get a glass of wine. Being part of the members club is certainly worth it.   My favorite wine is the Cab Blanc.

reviews.author: Nina H.
reviews.description: Stopped by here because I am a member and had never been to this location and was in the neighborhood.  It is a nice storefront on the square in Georgetown, which is a terribly cute area if you haven't been.  Got my free member glass and took it out on the back patio to enjoy.  Plenty of tables and shade there and some light classic rock, which made for a nice relaxing atmosphere.  Also I went upstairs to check out the members only lounge.  There was nothing free being handed out there food or sipping wise, but it was a comfortable place with lots of leather chairs, and if the winery was crowded, I could see escaping up here.  The wine itself is very good, something for every palate, even the dry red drinkers like myself.  If you are into wine at all, stop by and do a tasting, and I think you will be happy you did.  I plan to come back anytime I'm in the Georgetown area again.

reviews.author: Josh O.
reviews.description: Been members for a while now.  Finally got a chance to come to the Georgetown location on a Sunday around 4pm.   Place was a mess. People everywhere with no special lines for members Or any direction other than a sign that said everyone get in line.  Not sure the value of paying to be a member for this space.  Also a 21 and over rule in the tasting room. Most serious wine folks have kids.  Seriously reconsidering our membership and if it's with it. My suggestion would be to expand as quick as possible if you're that popular. Otherwise, do away with memberships benefits and just open to the public.  4 stars because the wine is amazing.

reviews.author: Jason C.
reviews.description: We often stop here for a glass or 2 of wine.  The people here are always welcoming and kind.  The wine selection and good and prices are reasonable.  If your hungry they don't have a full menu but they do at least sell finger food snack items. They also sell great local spices, maple syrup, olive oil, and other great items.  Great stop at Georgetown square!!

reviews.author: Vandesha L.
reviews.description: My sister came to visit so we were on a little adventure. She wanted a souvenir so we stopped into some of the shops downtown. We landed in this wine room and ended up sitting for a wine flight, good conversation, and lots of laughs. While we didn't get a wine membership we did buy 2 bottles and cigars for Dad. The staff was lovely and their COVID practices made us feel safe.

reviews.author: Stacy L.
reviews.description: I left Grape Creek and now I come here. They are always friendly, and their wine is very unique. Forget California and embrace Texas here! Their holiday cranberry wine was a huge hit with family, and there are so many wonderful wines. You will love it here.

reviews.author: Sarah F.
reviews.description: Fun place to stop in, grab a glass, and walk around the square. The lady we spoke to said the owner is going to add more seating in the future. You can do the wine tasting but have to be seated. I had a red blend and my husband had cranberry. They both were sweet and light, which is just what we were in the mood for. I didn't want to carry bottles around the square but next time I'll take a few home.

reviews.author: Christina G.
reviews.description: First time here on a Saturday during Market Days. I love this place and look forward to becoming a member when I move to Georgetown this summer!  Super friendly staff! My friend and I were greeted promptly and given an overview of the wines for our flight-sampler. We scored a small table. This was a huge win as there are limited seats, I believe up to 25 seats. The staff checked in on us as we tasted our way thru the wines. When we finished tasting, we bought a glass of our fave wine and continued to walk through market days on the square.  Anywho, if your walking the Georgetown Square, stop in for a tasting and or a glass or 2. Cheers.

reviews.author: Vaughn O.
reviews.description: The wife and I visited Georgetown Winery for our second tasting of the day on the square. After a more upscale experience in a different tasting room on the square, it was pleasant to ease into this more relaxed space. We were promptly greeted by the hostess, who became our server, and perused the menu of wines. $10 each for a sampling of 4 wines. Nice price, and fitting to the setting which would have been appropriate for beer as well. Neither of us remembers which wines we ordered, except for my two port samplings, but neither of us was overly impressed either. My ports were good, if extremely sweet and fruity, and the wife liked 2 of hers. She was disappointed in her first choice, which was the most expensive wine on the menu as priced by the bottle.  We didn't buy a bottle, nor would we return if we ever visit Georgetown again, but the ambience and carefree environment did add to an overall relaxing day on the square.

reviews.author: Angela P.
reviews.description: I love the ambience. Had a glass of cabernet Sauvignon and walked around. The shop is quaint and the service outstanding. In addition to tasty wines, they sell fabulous trinkets. I can't remember the last time I laughed so hard!  I took photos of the towels and signs that made me laugh. Check them out. BTW, I'll be back.

reviews.author: Nicole E.
reviews.description: Nice chilled laidback spot for a spot or two to wine tasting. Room and tables to seat 1 at the bar to larger groups in the back. Lots of fun wine related plaques, signs, wine toppers, shelves full of bottles and every imaginable gift item for wine lovers. Nice indoor garden feel from the string lights lining above your head. Very rustic and cozy feel with all of the wood from wall to wall shelves to tables and chairs and floors. They serve wine in plastic cups. In the back there are olive oils to try out.

reviews.author: Julia G.
reviews.description: Georgetown Winery is an adorable little handout in the heart of Georgetown. This is a great spot for a date night, girls night, or just an afternoon with a small group of friends or family. The actual vineyard is located in Rockdale Texas- this is just a small tasting room right on the Georgetown Square.   For $10, you can taste 4 wines. My spouse also got 4 tasting, so in total- I got to sample 8 wines. My favorite was the Big Tex which is aged for 9 months in oak. A full bottle will set you back only $24. Create price for the quality.  I also love their Viognier, I love white wines- and this was so light. I would casually sip this on any warm summer day. One thing I didn't love their fruity wines. The Blueberry and Blackberry wines tasted like they used artificial flavoring. The couple next to use was absolutely loving the blackberry, so maybe it just wasn't for me. Totally fair.   They also have cheese and crackers available. I feel like any wine tasting isn't complete without a good cheese plate. Unfortunately, we had dinner plans right after, so I enjoyed my wine cheese-free.   I absolutely plan on coming back here soon for some wine + cheese.

reviews.author: Denis A.
reviews.description: Laurie and Heather were wonderful today! Even in quarantine, they managed to provide a wonderful (socially distanced) experience. We are wine club members and LOVE this place ($50 per quarter gets you 2 tastings, 6 full glasses, and 2 whole bottles of wine). The perfect spot to enjoy some quality wine and some quality time with friends and family. We always bring cards or a board game and have a blast.

reviews.author: Bonnie G.
reviews.description: Went here on day trip on our way to Austin. Stopped into the winery and the two ladies were not helpful. We had to ask all the questions about the winery and their response was short and curt. We we the only people in the winery and yet they felt as if it was an inconvenience to talk to us. Will not return. Will continue to visit  the other Georgetown in South Carolina where people are more welcoming to all.

reviews.author: Joey G.
reviews.description: We are club members, and we love going to get our wines. The peach wine is amazing. They also have a lot of very good reds. We love all the little knickknacks in the store also.

reviews.author: Littledebbie9959 N.
reviews.description: This winery is awesome! Friendly ladies, very personable, you feel like they're your friend and they are!  Prices are more than reasonable and membership even better! They observe the rules over and beyond! Owners are great! The music is wonderful!

reviews.author: Erin T.
reviews.description: The best winery for friends.  My friends and I have only been members of this winery for about a year, but this is honestly one of our favorite locations to consistently come and visit when we're all together. They have sweeter drinks and wineritas for people who aren't fond of dry wines and their wine club memberships are literally built to be shared. There is table seating inside where you can sit for hours and catch up. Laurie and Heather in particular are so sweet with their service and their recommendations. I can't think of where else I would rather spend my weekend.

reviews.author: Kimberly G.
reviews.description: My favorite winery!  I feel like family every time I walk in the door.  Chelsea and Lori give the absolute best service, and I love bringing friends in to try their wine.  Chelsea and Lori can describe every wine and recommend tastings, glass, or a bottle.  Always a fun time at Georgetown Winery!  Thank you for making my family, friends, and me feel so special.

reviews.author: Roxanne T.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a second visit during a crowded weekend event, and thoroughly enjoyed both the service and our wine-tasting. My partner liked two of the reds so much she bought a bottle of each.  This is a long narrow shop that has lots of knick-knack items displayed so we did not move around much, but it was fun to read all the funny quotes on the signs and towels and glasses, etc. The folks at the bar were helpful and friendly, and we enjoyed this visit much more than our first.

reviews.author: Kristen V.
reviews.description: This is the perfect meet up spot with your girlfriends. That's not to say that I don't see plenty of men in here, too. It's a great spot for day drinking. Any day of the week. And I know from experience.   I don't bother doing the tastings here - I know exactly what I like. Their unoaked chardonnay is butter and smooth. After that I move over to their pinot noir - which isn't too sweet but not so dry that I need to carry in my own water bottle. I do not drink fruit wines but my sweet lil granny does and she swears by the pomegranate and blueberry.   You can buy gifts and chochskies here. I always like to pick up a few bottles of wine before I had home to visit family. Their wine club is probably the best you can be apart of in terms of benefits.   I would really like if they would provide bread so that we can try the olive oils. Probably smart that they don't do that or else all of us winos would use that as food. :)

reviews.author: Robert P.
reviews.description: This is hands down the best winery in Texas. From the amazing staff to the wonderful owners, they are top notch when it comes to customer service, wine knowledge and selection. One of the things we love about Georgetown Texas. Georgetown Winery. Thanks for all the fun times.

reviews.author: Becky K.
reviews.description: This review is for the tasting room in Georgetown Square. The location closes at 6 and wine tastings end at 5:30. The room is quaint with many cork decorations and tables made from wine barrels. There is a good selections of whites as well as reds. My favorite was the peach wine. Staff was knowledgeable and friendly.

reviews.author: Itsabout T.
reviews.description: Well my accidental tourist day continues and I ended up here, alcohol y'all!  Never knew anything about Georgetown except that it was an annoying mile marker on Interstate Hell-35 indicating after driving north for an hour you have gone nowhere.  Low and behold there is actually an ancient town square buried in there somewhere. So what else to do but gravitate like a bee to flower and find the alcohol. It's here and it's called wine.  The place is filled full on a steamy June Saturday afternoon. Saddle up to the bar and start in on the tasting. I was in a red mood and took 4 tastes.  The chambourcin was an interesting new grape for me and it was deeply dark in color yet light on the tannins. It was nice but I like tannin and the Tempranillo delivered on all counts.  It was a nice pit stop and I recommend it if you accidentally end up touring the square of Georgetown.

reviews.author: Annie T.
reviews.description: My family rode the North Pole Flyer, not so much for the Santa stuff since we have no children under 10, it was more for family fun. And it was a fantastic experience. The train was actually pretty cool, I've never been in a proper train before, I mean, it was old fashioned but still just a really really cool experience. We paid for the private suite and it was worth it, we also walked throughout the train which was a bit old west feeling. My favorite part was walking between cars to see the view unencumbered by windows.   We walked through all the cars (like most people on the train did) to see what the other cars were like. The giftshop car was the nicestest with big windows and plenty of room to walk around while balancing yourself on a rocking and rolling moving train.   Some of the private rooms give you an idea of what is was really like to ride a train across country with a sleeper car, teeny tiny shower, and narrow hallways. It was such a great experience.   Not sure why people complain about the views because mine were fantastic! I mean, c'mon. We live in Texas not Denver. I know what the hill country looks like. There's no mountains but where the hills meet the sky is expansive. It was beautiful.

reviews.author: Christina O.
reviews.description: Booked a sunset train ride for my husband and I and it was such a fun experience! We loved all the fun facts the volunteers had to share about the train cars and lifestyles of some of the riders back 100+ years. The sunset was magical and the night portion of the ride was really neat, having the moonlight illuminate the tracks in front of us. One of the cars is a dedicated gift shop/concession stand with a variety of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages to choose from. Everyone we came in contact with was so kind and made the experience that much more memorable. Overall such a great time - we would definitely book this experience again!

reviews.author: Roman H.
reviews.description: Their North Pole Flyer is like a joke. Don't waste your time and money, it is not worth it. Dirty cars, dirty seats, dirty windows with bleak scenery outside and Santa who gives a broken whistle. That is all for 2 hours trip. Even an obsessed with trains 4 years old was bored.  If you decide to go don't forget to take a mask or a respirator, it's hard to breathe inside because of dust.

reviews.author: Candice D.
reviews.description: We had a great time on the Beer Train last night that was advertised as a sunset tour that was 2.5 hours long.  Note that you have about 45 mins moving time, then 40 mins stopped for the engine to be brought from the back to the front and then 45 mins back again. You don't really see much of the sunset, and you aren't moving for 2.5 hours. They also assign seats ahead of time, some of the cars were nicer and louder than others, so just depends what you're looking for. The association was responsive on social media when I had questions, staff and crew on board were all very friendly. They dont really follow any of their own posted rules about masks, no personal coolers, etc. so just something to be aware of- but I think this also varied by car. Overall we had a great time and would go again!

reviews.author: Daniel P.
reviews.description: I'm pretty sure this is the tourism equivalent of chicken-and-waffles: another empty promise meant to separate me from my hard earned monies. Fortunately for me the plague was in top form. Was in the area looking for sustenance and 'Steam Train Association' showed on the map so I figured to pop in for a quick viddy before lunch. pulled up on a nearly empty lot, a shackled gate, and a locked door, the sign had the now common 'Closed for Plague' message which softened the blow of discovering "...that the train and rail yard are not open for public tours or photography" which meant the entirety of the museum was contained in the double-wide corner space in the strip. There's nothing inherently wrong with scenic train rides on vintage rolling stock, I've done it before and it's OK but that's just not my cup of meat. I was here for a bit of museuming but there was no museum to be had - nor postcarding nor touchable cars nor engines :-( sad face

reviews.author: Krystal S.
reviews.description: My husband and I went on the Hill Country Flyer for our anniversary weekend and we were in the "Rippling Stream" train car. The Train itself is quite impressive and was my first time on a real train not subway. The First Class Coach option was really nice and the seats were spread out along with social distancing, we felt really comfortable. My only complaint was it was VERY cold outside and though they are climate controlled, it was really cold the first half of the ride - coming back was much more comfortable. I also wished the lay over time perhaps had been 3 hours to provide a little more browsing time in Burnet. It would be cute to do music in each train car from the era the train was made. Ours was built in the late 30's so it would be a nice little touch that's simple to do! They had complimentary snacks and drinks which was a plus. Can't wait to do it again in a private suite!

reviews.author: Rebecca O.
reviews.description: Was a waste of money from Cedar Park to Burnet....was suppose to be Hill Country Flyer...saw no Hill Country...just a lot of brush blocking scenery....but not much of that either...Burnet was quaint...but will drive next time...big disappointment..

reviews.author: Allegre N.
reviews.description: This was an excellent experience. We took the train from Bertram to Burnet for one of the special events (Wedding Oaks wine trip). The staff was friendly and seemed very knowledgeable about the history of each train car. If you have a chance to walk to the very last car and look out the back, I definitely recommend taking in that view. I would have loved to take a longer trip and will look for other chances to ride.  The website is a little hard to use. We would have really liked a private cabin for our trip but didn't see how to book that on the website.   I wish the volunteer in our car would have been a little less Chatty Cathy when we weren't talking about the ride. It was a bit of a distraction from our enjoyment of the ride. Also, riding during COVID was a bit out of our comfort zone already so we were sad to see at least two volunteers wearing their masks covering only their mouth, not their mouth and nose. The website goes into great detail about precautions and that is a basic one not being taken. (That being said, they did a great job with social distancing and I felt like the train was very clean.)

reviews.author: Mike H.
reviews.description: Enjoyed my first ASTA experience today.  Here's my recap:  - Purchased a First Class Lounge ticket so I had my own room in Rippling Stream  - Train left the station on time, arrived at Burnet on time, and left for Cedar Park on time.   We were only an hour late reaching Cedar Park because a car thought it could outrun the train, but it could not.  Once the accident reporting was complete the train resumed.   - Personal note:  I am a train nerd and love riding trains, so my threshold of being annoyed on a train is higher than most.  This will affect my review below.    THE GOOD:  - clean cars, fun to walk in between them, and if you're without children, the adults only first class cars are a must - Rippling Stream and Nambe.   Otherwise with kids, I would recommend the Maurice Beckham or Eagle Cliff.    - the trip itself is smooth and the volunteers are friendly and helpful.  You can tell they enjoy being there, informing and helping others.     - Burnet has an abundance of antique shops if that's you're thing.  Also the soups at the downtown coffee shop are wonderful.     - The shootout show in Burnet, while not having a worry about winning any acting awards, is fun for the kids and has a good ending.  They could trim some of the fat from it, and make it a more concise / engaging story - there were a few too many awkward pauses.  But I applaud the folks who are likely doing this for free.  And the kids loved it.     THE NOT SO GOOD  - The scenic ride - if you're from the area this should not come as a shocker - is not that scenic.  There's a great bridge over the San Gab river but otherwise it's unremarkable trees, backyards, roads, and strip malls.    But again, none of this bothers me that much because I'm on a train relaxing.    - Burnet:  This is a sleepy, very conservative town.  One sign to deter thieves in a store said, "We got an alarm.  We got video.  We got guns.  DON'T BE DUMB."    While the downtown is a short walk from the train station, 2.5 hours here is way too much time unless you love antiques.   There isn't much else.   And as far as lunch goes, I highly recommend walking a bit farther past the first couple restaurants or else you'll have long wait times.   I went to a deli just a couple blocks away and it had no line.      - Announcements:  there are few.  Nothing along the way to alert you to landmarks or scenic opportunities (there is really just one, the bridge over the river).   But it would be nice to hear more than the pre recorded departure / arrival ones.    - The warm soft drinks:  no one wants green tea or apple juice at room temp.  There was literally an ice bucket next to these (but for scoping ice).  A second one to put these beverages on ice would go a long way.    - Lack of variety in snacks:  for a first class experience, at least more than the mini lemon cakes and mini cinnamon rolls would be nice.  Some savory, perhaps?   - chairs in the RS lounge car are what you'd find at your local dentist's waiting room.  I expected something that would at least remain comfy for 1.5 hours at a time.      OVERALL. - for the price I paid, it's 4/5 stars.  I knew the scenery wasn't going to awe, so most of my ranking is based on the train experience inside.  The quibbles above are all minor; chill the drinks, add some pretzels, get someone to donate an old leather chair or 2, and be a bit more chatty with us.    Those who really ranked their train ride low usually fall into the following categories, so please take them with a grain of salt:  - a/c sucked because it was Austin in the summer (hopefully fixable but not all that surprising) - solution is to go when it's not hot, the 60 days out of the year it's under 99 degrees.  I also think they have ironed out most of the a/c issues by now.    - Burnet was terrible, Burnet food was terrible, etc.  It's Burnet.  There's a reason it's not as well known as Fredericksburg.  You walk a bit father to get away from the crowds, you cross check their list of lunch spots they give you when you board  with a quick glance of Yelp reviews and you roll the dice.    - scenery sucked, super ghetto, etc.   Maybe because I grew up in St Louis, but using the word ghetto here is laughable at best.  It's junky, yes.  Unkempt, sure.   And truly, if you live in the region, you should know better than to expect breathtaking views.  You've driven on 183 east of 35?.  Same views.   If you're from out of town I could see valid point here since the website pushes it hard that it's scenic - but us locals know how much lipstick you can put on this pig.   So go check it out!  But go First Class if possible.  And be flexible about being home on time; like with any train, delays can happen.

reviews.author: Lori Ann L.
reviews.description: We rode the Hill Country Flyer which departs from the Cedar Park station and goes to Burnet, Texas,  where there is a two-hour layover so that passengers can disembark, do some shopping or grab some lunch or both.   Before leaving, the Burnet Gunfighters put on a show which is free to passengers, although they do accept donations.   The scenery leaves a lot to be desired, however that is not something that the Steam Train Foundation can control, they have a designated track and can not control who builds subdivisions or places gravel pits along the route.   If you are looking for a beautiful scenic ride, this probably isn't for you.  However, if you want to experience riding on a passenger train, and learning about the history of the railroads, it is a great experience.     They are very careful with social distancing and we felt completely safe riding the train.  I spoke with a couple of families that had young children and they loved it!   All in all, I would recommend it as a very enjoyable way to spend the day.

reviews.author: Peter D.
reviews.description: I rode the Sunset Express on 5-29-21 with my family, while on a trip to visit Austin. I'm from Southern California (this is important later). The scenery was certainly nice in some spots, but not enough. The sunset was awesome, but the experience wasn't that great. We paid for first class and rode aboard Eagle Cliff. Some basic drinks and snacks were provided, but the train was understaffed. No attendant for our car. One very sweet elderly volunteer was doing her best to handle two cars at once. I decided to offer to help, which she was very appreciative of. She said it was great that I wanted to help and so I did. I helped stock drinks and snacks as well as stocked ice to keep the drinks cold. Later on, a female volunteer who looked to be in her 40s came up to the counter said "Sir, you cannot be back there, what do you need?" I explained the situation, and she kind of had an attitude. I was informed in a rude tone that I had to be a member to help, and was given no thank you. Being that I live in Southern California, there's no way I could really be a member. While all this was happening, the AC in the car was doing a very poor job at keeping the car cold. It was unbearably hot in there, and everyone in the car was complaining. The excuse given was that the car is vintage and has a lot of runtime. The car was very original, and you could tell. That roughly translates to "we don't have the money or people to keep this car in tip top shape, and we don't have the money to upgrade it".  Eventually, my family was re-seated to the Rippling Stream. That was much better, but it didn't change the overall experience. Cherry on top was we were over an hour late returning to the Cedar Park station.   Not worth the money.

reviews.author: john g.
reviews.description: We also did the Xmas Polar Express train ride. Tickets were about $50 each. We also went with a friend and their kids too.   I'll give this train ride 4 stars. The kids were excited to see Santa and the ride was slow at times.   To start, one of the first things was a balloon guy. Ours was awesome. He was funny and overall entertaining. He had me laughing my @ss off.   Next came hot chocolate... it's hot chocolate.   After that was, singing Christmas Carols. They had 2 girls from McNeil high school. I felt sorry for them. They were nice, but they couldn't just get our car interested in singing.  A few of us sang, but overall it was a failure. I'm sure adult beverages if allowed/served would help the spirit. Great job to them but our car was mostly interested. It probably didn't help that they gave us a cookie just before they arrived so everyone was stuffing their face.   After that was story time, the lady reading the Story was animated and funny. Kudos to her.   She visited just before Santa.   Then Santa came. We were in one of the last cars so his visit was a bit rushed. He was nice and gave everyone a wooden train whistle.   ***********The entire operation is run by volunteers. So I'd like to thank all of them for their time!*******  This was he first time my son was not afraid of Santa:-)

reviews.author: John M.
reviews.description: This was a great little adventure from Cedar Park to Burnet Texas. Super We stayed in the Turquoise Room, which consisted of 2 tables, 8 chairs and two smaller windows. Staff was super friendly and knowledgeable...Once the train started the conductor came in to room to announce that there we several open seats in the main car...everyone got up and left leaving the wife and I in peace...Not that we are anti social, but it was peaceful to say the least...Good to catch up with each other, as we both work different hours...Truly not much to see on the way up...but it was a great ride....AC did work, not great but tolerable...I see in other reviews there were issues...You have freedom to roam Car to Car once the train gets rolling...and the train does turn around in Burnet...hard to explain, but it does...and we were able to see the other side of the tracks on the way home...Plenty to see and eat in Burnet...Our Car/cabin also came with free snacks and drinks...which is a great perk..as the snacks in the concession stand were quit expensive...The trip was worth it for us and will do it again next year with the granddaughter..

reviews.author: Liz I.
reviews.description: This review is based on my customer service experience with Zena, not the train ride itself (although I may come back and give an update!)  Zena is a lifesaver. Not literally, but she has made my train experience 2x as good. I bought a Groupon because I didn't even realize there was a train experience in Austin. After the headache of scheduling, our trip got canceled. Zena came in to save the day. She mailed me another gift certificate that expired in a year (vs the next week per my Groupon) AND she gifted us a little extra!  Sounds great, right? Unfortunately, the GC could not be redeemed online. After multiple tries of calling in (and getting a forever ring - no pick up), I was getting irritated.   I emailed Zena back asking for her advice. She wrote back in 24 hours and apologized for their phone service. She even offered to reserve me herself. After a few back-and-forth emails, she answered all my questions and got us all squared away.  Our train ride happens this weekend and I can only hope that the experience is similar to Zena's customer service.

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: It's such an adorable idea - volunteers running a historic train line on weekends to give people an authentic experience. But the train is slow - really really slow. The view is simple and unmemorable. The FandB in the first class is simply a cinnamon roll and lemon cake with tea. They do have apples and oranges as well. The trip back was painful - we stood in the concession cart the entire time because the A/Cs didn't work and it was triple-digit hot on a September Saturday. Even my 5-year-old nephew, who is obsessed with trains and knows all there is to know about them, wasn't engaged in this ride much. Thankfully, we had carried board games and our own food so the ride to Burnet was okay but the ride back was really terrible.

reviews.author: James A.
reviews.description: I organized a group from Meetup.com to try this excursion and it was fun!  It's a laid-back trip to the Hill Country. My friends and I were in an Adults-Only car, the Rippling Stream, and we had a great time with each other and looking at the scenery.  I highly recommend this trip!

reviews.author: Katherine V.
reviews.description: The most horrible rip off of an experience I have ever had. I bought 4 tickets for the VIP lounge which included treats and drinks and a nicer car, it was none of those things. The food offered were store bought generic cookies and the drinks were either warm apple juice or water. The car lost the A.C. capacity on the return from the small town with nothing to offer and did not even have the gun fight reenactment due to the extreme heat, now imagine that extreme heat inside a metal sardine box. I invited my 72 year old father and I was genuinely worried we would have to rush him to the emergency room upon arrival. I chewed the place out for their false advertisement and putting the elderly and children at risk in the extreme heat without AC.   In summation, do not buy tickets to any of the events this was a horrible experience. I got my money almost a month later, and I will never return and I will warn anyone thinking about ever going to one of these fiascos.

reviews.author: Tim H.
reviews.description: As recent residents to the Austin area our 15 y/o son wanted to experience a classic train. We fortunately found the Austin Steam Train Association. We booked tickets on the Sunset Express trip. The Staff was all very friendly and knowledgeable.   You are able to bring your own drinks (non alcoholic) and snacks which is a plus. They do have a concessions car which is nice.   To us the trip was not as much about the scenery as it was the experience of a mode of travel long since gone.

reviews.author: Umeko V.
reviews.description: If you are going to the BlueBonnet festival, this is the way to go. Sit back, relax and enjoy the scenery, and when you get to the festival, no looking for parking.  Just jump off the train, and there you are.  Each train car has it's own characteristics, but take my word, spend the extra money for the air conditioned cars.  We had a chance to walk through the other cars, and even on a beautiful spring day, you can tell a big difference walking into the cars without A/C.  We rode on the City of Chicago, in a table for two, which had great views.  There was complimentary water, tea and snacks on our car.  The volunteer, Barbara, was informative about the train, wildflowers, and announced points of interest on the route.

reviews.author: Matthew H.
reviews.description: My family and I took a ride on the Hill Country Flyer and this a brief overview of our experience and I recommend you heed this review well.  ----------------------------  I visited and rode the September 7th 10:00 am to 5:00 pm ride to Burnett going out of Cedar Park Wirth the Austin Steam Train Association and I'd like to share my experience that day.   To begin the train left 20 minutes late from the terminal when it was communicated the train would be leaving promptly and on time consistently. Which is fine although it did negatively impact the quality of time spent in Burnett and exploring the town which was a key experience in the advertised outing. Another large disappointment was the lack of the advertised western gun fight. We saw no mention of it, nor display of it. Apparently that was another misrepresentation of the trip. It was advertised we would have two hours to explore downtown Burnett and have lunch. This was barely enough time to visit a local restaurant flooding with business from both local lunchtime and other passengers. With barely an hour in Burnett without enough time to eat we actually had to leave the restaurant we were at in a manic frenzy without eating, apologize to the staff at the restaurant for our rush due to this,and return to the train. Then upon returning at the specified time we still not even begin the process of departing until nearly 30 minutes past the time we were told to return! The. On the return trip we didn't even get above 10 mph on the speed making for a grueling and arduous journey back creating an atmosphere on complete misery on the entire train. On top of all of that the trains expected time to return was 5:00 we did not return until after 5:30! This is insane it officially help derail our entire vacation plan and helped out more of a strain on our time off. Meaning we had to rush and adjust our original plans.   Another issue with the experience was there little to no a/c in rear car named Rippling Stream on a day with temperatures rising above 95 degrees! Although the next car over had perfect a/c with a lower priced ticket. Paying for six tickets @55 dollars to sit in the heat in pool of our own sweat was not the idea of a luxury car provided by marketing materials. We actually had to use the pamphlets provided to make fans in order to be comfortable during the ride and continuously go into the other cars for refuge from the sweltering heat. Upon informing staff of the issue we were told once the train is moving we can go to other cars and stand in the cool air to gain some reprise from the heat.This is insane as we bought out the entire private room to have a bonding family experience we certainly were unable to enjoy. Also this car represented itself as a purchase of an adults only car ticket and children were running through the car. We wanted an experience that would supply with a relaxing adult atmosphere that was negatively impacted by this not being enforced.   Another major concern of mine is lack of communication from staff with the private areas of the train. Announcements regarding safety, departure time, arrival, landmarks etc were unheard in the private room and no effort was made by train personnel to inform us of anything. We were left alone with no information about anything given without having to seek out an attendant regularly. To mention with sound there was also an almost constant excessively loud screeching noise as we moved along at a slugs pace that I feel each passenger will hear in their nightmares of this ride for years to come.   This experience wound up being more stressful due to the previously mentioned circumstances causing our trip to be unenjoyable. Due to the dishonest representation of a truly climate controlled car, and times for departure misrepresented. Unfortunately this is not an outing that we would attended again or recommend to others visiting the Austin/Hill Country area. This is not something we would recommend for anyone trying to relax or enjoy a vacation.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: I wish I had discovered Rentsch brewery sooner. This is a great place to sit outside and enjoy the weather while sampling one of their many craft beers. They also have different visiting food trucks which makes it fun and interesting. We went for Oktoberfest and really enjoyed the German food truck and had BBQ another day. Rentsch has plenty of outdoor, shaded seating and the beer selection is impressive with lots of interesting seasonal offerings - I really enjoyed the apple streusel seasonal beer. We'll absolutely be back.

reviews.author: Eva Maria T.
reviews.description: Great local craft beer. Super friendly and knowledgeable staff. The grounds are family friendly with plenty of covered outdoor seating. There is usually a guest food truck and if you follow their Facebook page they post who's coming.

reviews.author: Mary B.
reviews.description: We love visiting local breweries and can't believe that we overlooked this gem in Georgetown for so long!  They have a good variety of beer on the menu and have a really nice, relaxing outdoor space. the service is fast and friendly. They rotate food trucks so there is always something available to munch on.  We had such a good experience that we decided to join the 2021 mug club. Ask about it!

reviews.author: Mando D.
reviews.description: Probably one of my new favorite spots. Friendly and professional staff, great ambiance, and family friendly; but most importantly they have GREAT beer! Very unique seasonal selection and a solid selection over all. Two thumbs up!

reviews.author: Haley F.
reviews.description: The BEST place ever. Husband and I are here every week having beers and eating from the different food trucks. We always bring games to play or invite friends to spend a few hours with. They have great seating inside and outside, with covered areas and fans. A beautiful garden with trees and a nice country view surrounding the brewery. Husband and I even had a small, intimate wedding here last fall! The staff are also very kind and always put a smile on our faces. 10/10 recommend if you're just visiting or a local looking for a new spot.

reviews.author: Monica W.
reviews.description: We came here on  Sunday to try some German beers. They have some really great beers! My favorite was the Hefeweizen. The blonde was really good also and my husband had the one up from the Hefeweizen, "hef's  big brother", and it was also tasty but too heavy for me. I'm more of a wine drinker but if you like beer you'd love it. We took our two kids and they had fun being outdoors with us. We ate at the food truck and had a family Sunday funday. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Brittany N.
reviews.description: I can't believe it took us this long to head out to Rentsch! It's a great spot for a family outing. Recommend it!

reviews.author: Clayton S.
reviews.description: I will preface this review with three biases.  1. I love beer 2. I love outdoor setups in Texas rural areas 3. I am a Red Raider  This is was our first trip out and loved it!  The beers were delicious.  I had the IPA, the double IPA, and the Amber.  Wife had the blonde and the Hefe.    My favorite was the IPA then the Hefe and then the Double.  Can't wait to go back and try more.  I missed the details on the mug club,  but like the concept and will have to check it out.  A little far from my house so not sure if the bang is worth the buck based on my frequency.  The atmosphere was fantastic.  Great patio and open space areas.  There was a Youngman playing cover music but there was enough space to where he didn't seem loud.  There was plenty of games and we brought some toys and our kid and others had a blast running around.  It was beautiful and spacious, yet plenty of space inside for when it it gets to crazy Texas temps in the summer.  Only bummer was the food truck was broke down so we just ordered Dominos instead! How easy is that?!  Looking forward to the next visit and recommend you check it out too

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Cool little brewpub in Georgetown. They have two IPAs that caught my attention. Their Rentsch IPA is quite malty east coast style. Plus one had her usual lite Blonde ale and she was OK with it. She was not thrilled with the crisp finish but she did empty her pint. There is a cozy bar area with TVs and with the Temps reaching 100 degrees we chilled out there. There is also a nice beer garden with fans on the deck but even with the abundance of shade trees, it was too darn hot to be outside.  Lastly, the bartenders are pleasant and knowledgeable and will provide excellent guidance if you are a newbie. They do have some interesting specialty/seasonal beers that I must go back and try. Solid 4 stars!

reviews.author: Ally H.
reviews.description: This place would be PERFECT on a nice day! unfortunately we went on a bit of a Rainey day, but it was still great outside (they turned the heaters on for us). Staff was helpful in picking a beer that suited our taste, and it was delicious! Wish they had their own food, but there are food trucks during certain hours!

reviews.author: Terry M.
reviews.description: Beer was very cold and tasted well. Nice outdoor setting. Seemed to be practicing social distancing well.

reviews.author: Melanie J.
reviews.description: Beautiful hill country views and delicious beer. I love the outdoor space here! The patio is dog friendly.

reviews.author: Chris D.
reviews.description: First time at the tap room. I got turned on to this brewery at Hopdoddys with their Heffe. They don't have it anymore. I was able to get a six pack at specs. Had a great time, mother's day specials. Tried the Poppy Fest Red Ale. Right down my alley. Great place, great beer. I was a little disappointed w Pat's BBQ. Seemed to be over cooked. It was later in day and they were running out. I would give them another go. Can't  bash Rentsch for food truck.

reviews.author: Babs G.
reviews.description: Great way to spend some time with a terrific cold beer, relaxing on the patio with friends.  Predictably enjoyable opportunity to just "be".

reviews.author: Megan P.
reviews.description: Beer and board games are the catch here . Our bartender was knowledgeable and helpful with selecting beer choices. Especially since I'm not the biggest "craft-beer drinker" he suggested the blonde which was just what I was looking for.  My friends had the doublerumtoberfest and rate it 10/10!!  I love the open concept that makes the space seem larger than it is. We came at 1pm on A Saturday, not too many people just A few family's enjoying their day. Their patio area looks super cozy but it's too cold today so I'll be back!

reviews.author: Chuck G.
reviews.description: Great beer and even greater staff.  Kid friendly and even have snacks and drinks for the kids.  What more could you want!!  Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Lee B.
reviews.description: We love this place. The people are very friendly. However, we will not be going back. It is a dog friendly place which we are very supportive of. When you are going to have a dog friendly place then the establishment should make sure that dog poop is not laying around.  We went there when it opened on a Wednesday at 4 pm and when we went to sit down there were 3 Piles of dog poop and the flies were terrible.

reviews.author: Jim B.
reviews.description: I was recently in Georgetown for the 20th Anniversary Annual Meeting of the Texas Master Naturalists. I stayed in my camper at Cedar Breaks and commuted daily to the conference at the Sheraton. I was at the Sheraton from dark to dark attending classes every day but the last. The conference ended at noon, and I headed straight to Rentsch.  I got a flight of beers and went outside to drink them. I was the only one there for the first twenty minutes or so. That gave me the freedom to move around from place to place. The outside area is really nice. I tried full sun areas and shaded areas. There were several bees in the area that pestered me, adding to my moves. The wind chimes were also a nice touch.  I liked all of the beers I tried. But two of them were amazing. They were the Bourbon Barrel Double Oktoberfest (2017) and the Double Rumtoberfest. Believe me, if I weren't alone and responsible for my own transportation back to camp, I would have stayed and had a few more Rumtoberfests. It was everything I like in a craft beer.  Georgetown was such a great to visit. I know I will be back to camp at Cedar Breaks. That obviously means that I will be back to the brewery. I only hope they have another beer as awesome as the Oktoberfest and Rumtoberfest. I am sure they are seasonal, and probably won't be on tap next time.

reviews.author: Matt D.
reviews.description: Beer: Amazing! Location: Beautiful! Staff: Knowledgeable! Food: Different food trucks on various days of the week giving you fantastic variety.  Overall, a very impressive place!

reviews.author: Krystal W.
reviews.description: Love the outdoor area soooo much. Disappointed that the tap selection is all the heavier and high abv beers instead of always including core light beers. Had to buy a 6pk to go just to enjoy the standard options. Not very personable staff either, but I guess that's just the covid design of grab a beer and gtfo of the building haha

reviews.author: Travis C.
reviews.description: I had been wanting to visit this place for a while. It was worth the wait! Everyone there was very nice and knowledgeable about beer. Two things that I always look for in a brewery. The Chocolate Bourbon Pecan Porter was amazing! Bold, chocolately, crafted beautifully! My wife had the Blackberry Mead which was also a treat! Definitely is going to be a place I visit more often!

reviews.author: Sarah F.
reviews.description: I love that Georgetown has a brewery on the West side of 1-35!!! This place is great!  Service is five stars Atmosphere is five stars + a happy dog paw for being dog-friendly Cleanliness is five stars Selection is 4.5 stars but that's probably on me...  I am a picky beer drinker so I didn't quite find one I liked this time, but the flight and tasting options are great so I'm sure I'll get there eventually. Just need to try some more beer!   They had a food truck on the day we went, with giant tacos and nachos, which made for a perfect Sunday Funday with my partner. Can't wait to do it again.

reviews.author: Lucas E.
reviews.description: Awesome brewery with a cool indoor/outdoor space. Staff and service were excellent, friendly and efficient on a busy afternoon. Beers are solid, with a good selection to choose from. Wine also if you dislike beer (lame). Food truck schedule is easily accessible on their website. Drink local!

reviews.author: Eva Maria T.
reviews.description: Great local brewery with excellent beers. They also have a selection of wine for the non beer drinkers. Very friendly and welcoming staff. They have live music and guest food trucks. Follow them on Facebook as they post the food truck lineup for the entire month.

reviews.author: old d.
reviews.description: Nice family atmosphere, very good beers!  ButNobody wore masks 8/30/21.  Friendly folks , the schnitzel food truck was authentic German fare.   They shouldn't say they practice masks if they don't.

reviews.author: Kimberly S.
reviews.description: I absolutely loved the Barking Armadillo! They had a wonderful assortment on tap. The Meridian Hive Blackberry Mead was my favorite, but the other three choices in the flight including Hefeweizen, Strawberry Limeade Ale, and Magonada with a tajin rim were delicious as well! The seating area was comfortable and well shaded. The on-site food truck served up an amazing chipotle steak quesadilla; it had the right blend of savory and spice. Together, the beverages at BA and the lineup at the food truck were a great pairing! We are on vacation here in Texas and we're hoping to return to the Barking Armadillo before we head home!

reviews.author: Leticia G.
reviews.description: After a long morning hike Colorado Bend SP, I hit the road to this small, craft-beer brewery. With rotating food trucks, and an avid-unorganized-extrovert that enjoys surprises, I found this idea pretty cool. With their seasonal beer specials, I never get bored of visiting this amazing brewery! Highly recommend it

reviews.author: Teresa B.
reviews.description: My fiance and I visited this brewery on a Sunday afternoon and it was just perfect! They have a great patio area with comfy chairs and tables. I had the Hefeweizen and my fiance had the strawberry famadillo. Both were fantastic. Service was amazing. The bartender was extremely attentive and intelligently spoke of all their offerings. He even allowed my fiance to sample some before choosing. They also had a taco truck there which was just perfect for a snack. We will certainly be returning.

reviews.author: Simon S.
reviews.description: Lots of seating. Knowledgeable and friendly staff. Trivia night is a blast esp w the food trucks. Beer is above average esp the red ale. I would like to see more wheatier options but that's not a knock against this wonderful local spot.

reviews.author: Mildred A.
reviews.description: Great staff and very helpful if you don't know the type of beer you like! They fo have mead and wine for non beer drinkers   The taco food truck was great!! Food was yummy and the the staff were friendly and helpful.  All in all a great place to stop by in Georgetown!  I promise to take pictures next time! :)

reviews.author: Jennifer K.
reviews.description: 4 very solid stars for a new brewery in Georgetown. We visited 9/5 and enjoyed the beers we had there. Husband had the Witbier (one of his go to styles) and I had the Hefe and (limited) strawberry farmadillo.  We ordered chips and queso and tacos from the taco truck onsite. We enjoyed those as well. Very solid meat in those tacos and very filling!  We will return, but try to come earlier so we can sit on the patio instead of inside. Some of the guests inside were not vigilant about masking when leaving their table. I would suggest some signage on the interior tables (at least) reminding them of this request.  There are dogs allowed inside which did not bother us at all (we have 2 at home). But, some people are not as comfortable with dogs inside so I feel it needs to be mentioned.  Looking forward to trying more beers in the future!

reviews.author: Heath N.
reviews.description: Great little space just off Williams Drive. They have different food trucks, last time it was a pie truck, Takovron is often there.   There is nice shaded outdoor seating. Inside has a few video games and pinball. There is plenty of seating insight with high tops and tables. There is a nice couch and a couple of comfy chairs.   The bartenders are great. The beer selection changes with a handful or regular lagers and IPAs. The stout is coffee based. The Belgian heavy is fantastic, better than Devil's Backbone. Prices are fair. People might argue about the single kind of glassware, but I'm unbothered.  Would be good to have a few more interesting board games their for more of a social atmosphere, but hard to argue with success.

reviews.author: Rigo G.
reviews.description: New Brewery in Gtown and just down the road from our house... excellent choice of brews, including one guest tap. To top it off, they have an on-site taco truck "Takavron - Tacos Regios" Irish Red is rich and tasty Hefeweizen is delicious and smooth (wife favorite) Add a Gringa from the taco truck and BOOM!!!

reviews.author: A. J.
reviews.description: Excellent local brewery.   Decent selection of beers and some wine.   They have a large indoor area with multiple rooms for seating.   Outdoor seating is pretty big as well.  This place is dog friendly and kid friendly.    Staff were nice and knowledgeable of the beers, they were very accommodating in trying their different beers.   It's clean and everyone seemed to be adhering to the COVID guidelines etc.      I will definitely be going back and would certainly recommend this place to anyone.  Cheers!!

reviews.author: Sammy B.
reviews.description: All of their beers are great. If you don't find one you like,  you might want to stop drinking!  The owners and crew are even better!!

reviews.author: Steven H.
reviews.description: Good beer and you can try them all with a 4oz glass in one night with a friend. We will be back for sure

reviews.author: Terry M.
reviews.description: First time visiting BAB great tasting beer. Service was outstanding. Outdoor seating with string lights

reviews.author: Ally H.
reviews.description: Amazing brewery when I went. Dog friendly. Great live music. Food truck out back. Beer is delicious and they have great staff. Definitely will be back when I can

reviews.author: Anna B.
reviews.description: Wear your mask and come safely have some of the better beer around. We particularly enjoyed this brewery and we visit breweries quite regularly. The beer was nicely fizzy, not flat, and there was spaces out seating. The DDH IPA and Hefeweizen here were my favorites. Everything tasted fresh, not flat. It was pretty great. We will be back!

reviews.author: Tara D.
reviews.description: Laid back vibes and friendly staff. Great hangout spot for a date or go out to the patio for a large group of friends

reviews.author: A S.
reviews.description: Super cute place, dog friendly. When we went there was a delicious Korean food truck. Met some very nice people. Can't wait to visit again!

reviews.author: Karen K.
reviews.description: Great place. They are in the same building as Rentsch. So yes pull into Rentach parking lot. Inside is big but with a bigger outside. Really great outdoor space with a big tree to shade and plenty of seating. Their food truck hadn't opened yet so I got a taco. My husband liked the beer here but the boys and I liked the pop and taco. It was just like a beef and bean md cheese burrito.

reviews.author: Thomas C.
reviews.description: I went to this Gastro pub while visiting a friend in the Austin Texas area. I think it's really cool that they have merchandise and a fully running bar and restaurant in the same space. I felt it was very cozy and interesting aesthetically with all of the taxidermy on the walls. I really enjoyed grabbing a drink here with a friend and I would definitely come back to shop or drink in the future.

reviews.author: Jacob C.
reviews.description: We became members here about four months ago. It's perfect because my wife and I will grab two beers to go, drop a tip, and walk the square/walking trail up the street to get our steps in on our Fitbit. It's always exciting because the beers change daily to weekly. We've hung out inside on occasion which is perfect for card games and relaxing. The apparel for sale is typical of a REI/Bass Pro Shop. Expensive but quality.   Bar: rotating beer, wine, white claws  Bonus: Very dog friendly! And one of the only places open late.

reviews.author: Justine R.
reviews.description: I have had mostly positive experiences here. I like the beer selection and the bartenders are always happy to suggest something that fits the profile I want.  I have been here about 5 times and am likely to return.

reviews.author: Mike S.
reviews.description: Always great beer, great service, great people watching outside. A favorite.  Also check out the fine sportswear.

reviews.author: Shannon H.
reviews.description: Awesome little place in the square! Very knowledgeable and friendly staff! They have some great beers on tap, some that I would have otherwise never tried! The Eastciders blood orange is awesome! They also have great apparel and accessories. Also, we got a small hint that they love our military and veterans!

reviews.author: Sarah F.
reviews.description: While many businesses have found ways to make shopping, eating, and drinking safer and in line with state guidelines, there are places that have found their niche catering to the denial or anti-mask crowd. You can make up your own mind based on the trolling I've received from their clientele from my previous review, and the continued crowding on their sidewalk outside with unmasked folks not socially distanced.

reviews.author: Kiva C.
reviews.description: This place has a great atmosphere. They are family and dog friendly. The merchandise is high quality (outdoor gear) and they are open late. They usually have sports on their TVs. Whether you're shopping during the day or stopping in for a drink in the evening. The crowd range is vast. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and the taps are rotating. They even have water bowls outside for your dog. They serve beer, wine, and select seltzer's in cans. It's a great place to kill a few hours in the heart of downtown Georgetown.

reviews.author: Kacey C.
reviews.description: This place is always SUPER packed on weekends, it can be near impossible to find a seat. Luckily there are a few outdoor tables and chairs for overflow but even the sidewalks get crowded with people just standing around drinking. One evening we managed to make it in and see what all the excitement was about and it's a cute little beer and wine bar/outdoors gear store. Cute merchandise but pretty pricey. The bartender told us occasionally a food truck will park behind their store so you can enjoy yummy eats with your drinks, otherwise no food menu. I liked the atmosphere of this place... cute little date night drink spot on the square. But I am a little confused by why it's so crowded all the time. The beer and wine list is good, but not anything spectacular. I don't get it. I'm sure we'll be back at some point if we can find a place to sit.

reviews.author: Jamie W.
reviews.description: Had a great time here. Beer and atmosphere was great. Would love to come back to shop around sometime.

reviews.author: John M.
reviews.description: I never feel welcomed at MSO. The workers are borderline rude and  act put out with each order. I'll spend my dough elsewhere.

reviews.author: Greg W.
reviews.description: Short review time kids!  A close friend and local resident dragged us here and promised we would enjoy ourselves! He was so spot on the get a coveted 5 star review!   Atmosphere is casual, relaxed and inviting. Great selection of beers on tap.  Go for a brew,meet some cool people, and get a shirt before you depart!

reviews.author: Mark D.
reviews.description: Good selection of outdoor/fishing clothes combined with a great selection of beer. Live music  on certain nights. Very nice staff.  Excellent place to go on the square.

reviews.author: Archie L.
reviews.description: Spent the Sunday afternoon on the square. This is a must stop when visiting the shops on the square in Georgetown. Great selection of beer, wine, cider. Nice clothing. The selection is somewhat limited but quality. Friendly staff!

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Sunday night in the  square. Strolled in and got a tasty brew and some pimento cheese. Then bought a shirt and some shoes. What a great space and friendly service. Thanks!

reviews.author: Joey G.
reviews.description: Went there on Saturday to watch the UT game. Not a sports bar, but they did have it on one TV. Lots of fans watching, so the atmosphere was great. They have a good selection of draft beer that changes from time to time. Mostly local. I went back the very next day for the Dallas Cowboys game. Very friendly staff. The next day I sat in a comfortable leather chair. They also have a lot of nice clothing for men. A little too pricey for me, but I understand they have some deals from time to time. I will definitely be going there every time I'm in downtown Georgetown.

reviews.author: MICHELE V.
reviews.description: Love this place!! So, for food offerings, you can order online. The dudes 2doors down will deliver. Lots of awesome beers and wine available here. Those of you who  follow the mask rules (which effectiveness is anecdotal at best....and not scientific), you will be comfortable here. High ceilings, fans, etc.  Tables far apart.  Or drink outside. I'm here for the beer. The people are cool and the staff AWESOME!!

reviews.author: Regine M.
reviews.description: An interesting spot in the Georgetown square. Mesquite Creek is half bar, half clothing and apparel shop. They've got a good selection of beers and wines and are one of the only places around here that stays open late. There's a variety of clothes for men and women however many of their items are overpriced, but I assume most people come here to drink, not shop.

reviews.author: Faith B.
