reviews.description: Nice seating area outside. Got the blueberry blonde beer and super good! Bartenders all super friendly as well. :)

reviews.author: Zoe T.
reviews.description: Stopped in yesterday to buy a hat for me and walked out with a hat and two shirts for my teenage sons. I didn't try the beer, so I can't comment on that, but the clothing selection was good. They carry Howler Brothers apparel, which is a company out of Austin that my fisherman husband likes, and Texas Standard clothing, which is a TX-based brand with cool (not kitschy) Texas-themed clothing that gives back to Texas non-profs. They also carry another local brand - Kermode Outdoors - which is new to me, but evidently founded by Georgetown residents. The store has a great vibe and the bar is a place I could see spending a few hours on a Saturday afternoon. Stores like this are what I look for whenever I shop local - a place that sells unique, cool stuff that someone has spent time thinking about.   4 not 5 stars because I didn't try the beer. Next time....

reviews.author: Jordyn T.
reviews.description: Great place to have a beer/wine in beautiful downtown Georgetown! Very friendly staff and great selection of drinks.

reviews.author: Andy S.
reviews.description: We make it a point to stop for either lunch or dinner at 600 Degrees on our regular travels between Bryan/College Station and Lake LBJ. Good pizza and a great selection of draft beer is why we stop. But tonight, Sunday evening, January 2, was a disappointment. We agreed to the 30 minute wait that we were told it would take for our group of five to be seated. What we were not told after we were seated was that we would have to wait more than an hour to receive our two-pizza order. An hour and twenty minutes to be exact. It seemed a great number of take-out orders were being filled that night and after an hour our waiter assured us our order had not been lost but there was a long line ahead of us. The staff knew of the pending delay when we were seated and we should have been informed so we could decide if we wanted to invent that amount of time. The bill was $88 and some change. I left a $5 tip and a note expressing my disappointment. I signed my name and left my phone number on the ticket should the owners like a more detailed explanation of our experience. We will go back to 600 Degrees but we know now to ask what the wait time will be after we are seated.

reviews.author: Joel T.
reviews.description: It wasn't pizza.  It was something very surprising and I had to share.  I don't know what happened.  I went downtown to pay my tax bill.  I thought about a nearby place that has a great beer selection and pizza.  So, I went there.  But I went in a different direction. Hot wings.  I asked about them.  The servers were attentive and described everything.  Even the bartender came over to check and make sure I was OK after I ordered and suggested beers and said it will be worth the wait.    Then the wings came to my table. They glistened in sauce and fat and were luscious.  Even the shiny foil underneath made them look like a gift   And then I ate.    Tender, juicy, the perfect spice.  The heat and meat!  Sooo good!!  The perfect chili/orange/Buffalo sauce color was gorgeous but tasted even better.  My palate was singing! My hands were messy. But, I ignored napkins, my friends!  I licked my fingers instead.  I don't regret it!   I thought at first the size of the wings order would be too much. It. Was. Not.   The server asked if I wanted a pizza. But, no, I ordered another beer and wings.  I don't want the pizza. I want the wings!!!!

reviews.author: Mark C.
reviews.description: This place was recommended by a family member. The interior was small And packed so we sat outside on a brisk night. They should have some outdoor heaters and covering from the on/off drizzle.  We ordered a pizza and wings. The pizza names were curious as I'm from the area these towns are located in. I ordered my birthplace pizza (San Jose). The Lemmon pepper wings came out about 20 minutes before the pizza. The wings were PERFECT! I mean damn they were good! The pizza came out and it's a spicy one. The pizza was bigger than I expected and is made for at least two people. Flavor was good but it had a bit too much of some sort of creamy white sauce on top. The beers were on point as I tried out several local ones.  I will definitely come back and try more of their delicious menu!

reviews.author: Natalie R.
reviews.description: Best pizza ever!  If they weren't always so busy and if parking was easier, we'd probably make the trek from Round Rock to eat there more often.   I always get a slice of the basil pesto and it is absolutely delicious. And very filling. My husband and daughter like the pepperoni, and we usually get a side salad that's good too.

reviews.author: Braden J.
reviews.description: That's not a slice..This is a slice! References aside if you want giant slices of pizza this is the place. Think as large a slice that you have to fold like a sandwich to eat. Perfect for any pizza or cheese cravings.   Atmosphere: Had the chance to dine outside of here. Given the location within Georgetown, you get the feeling of a family pizzeria. A place one would bring their friends for a casual dine out. Complete with patio.  Food: As mentioned above, big big slices. Perfect for any pizza lover of all sorts. I ended up going with the Pirate which is one of their speciality slices that comes as pictured below with a pickle too. The only complaint I'd have is that since the pizza's come out so fresh they also come out very hot. I unashamedly had to eat the pizza with a knife and fork as I just couldn't wait for such a prize to just sit there.   Service: Friendly service, given the significant amount of speciality slices I had a few questions and the server was happily able to answer any I had. Especially if you are unsure of what pizza slice you may want.  Overall: Now that I've tasted whenever I have pizza cravings I just want to return here to try all their other speciality slices. Give this place a try, and have a slice day!

reviews.author: Tammy A.
reviews.description: The extra cheese pizza was delicious and we loved the garlic barbecue chicken wings!!

reviews.author: Courtney T.
reviews.description: Eating my way through Austin and the suburbs.  Pizza I love it.  My go to.    Interesting spot!   You can do pizza by the slice and customize it with your own toppings much like a whole pizza except it's a slice, a slice that is the size of a small pizza or Texas? Go figure.   Everything is bigger.   Just cheese pizza would be rather bland here add your toppings and go with it.  Everyone gets what they want and it's fast.   Good stuff.  The garlic knots need some more garlic too them that's just me.   Definite unique spot to get that pizza fix.

reviews.author: Tim L.
reviews.description: Drove up to Georgetown with my girlfriend to take some pictures with the Christmas lights and explore the square. We popped in to 600 degrees after talking about needing to try it for months and it did NOT disappoint.  We were going to try a traditional pie, but ended up branching out to try the Royale with Cheese and we are so glad we did! The pizza was incredible, we split it and still had a few slices left over. We did it with the additional mustard and pickles, which is an absolute must.  The crust was to die for, and I say this as a person who normally throws crust away. It was so fluffy and soft, truly a 10/10 dough experience.  They had Maine Root soda on the fountain and a ton of beers on tap that they are more than willing to let you sample.   It isn't a big place and it can get pretty packed. There was a 25 minute wait when we arrived, but we ended up just sitting at the bar.  The service was great, the food was phenomenal, and the atmosphere was fun and friendly.

reviews.author: Kenny G.
reviews.description: You wait 20 minutes plus for a single slice. Can it really be that good??? I think not keep it. I'll pay for my drink and leave.

reviews.author: Hilary S.
reviews.description: Tried out for a later lunch/early dinner so got here about 330.  (Passing through to San Antonio but was starving)   It's in downtown/on the square so has the old build vibe. The side we sat on was little and faced the bar.   Definitely has the college town feel.   ***Didn't see any actual menus so be prepared to use your camera on your phone to look at the menu.   Service: Food was slow to come out. I didn't time it but we were there about an hour.  Our waitress was nice and did come by and check on us a couple times.   Food: Ordered the Caesar salad to start and it was tasty. The size for the salad was big enough you could share if you are looking for a smaller side salad.   I will say if the time it took to get our slices it was worth no sharing.  We ordered #6 pirate and #23 number 23 as slices and shared them.  Oh my!! They were both delicious and honestly for us worth the wait.   Even with the little bit of the wait I think still worth the 5 stars.   ** please forgive my pictures, I got so excited about them I ate the point of the slices. And we sliced them in half after we got them so they would be entire piece if when you get them.    ENJOY

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: First time trying out this place, almost no wait on a Sunday around 445p, so that was nice. We tried the garlic knots and each had a slice of pizza. The slices are very big and one was plenty, hand in pic for reference of size. We didn't try any of the craft beers but their selection is quite large if that's your thing. Easy to find parking and a nice chill vibe.

reviews.author: Jaclyn A.
reviews.description: I have always loved coming here. Service is hit or miss but such is life. I've told so many people about this place because they have a decent beer selection and decent pizza.   I'm a simple girl. I love a hoppy beer and a slice of cheese pizza, so that's generally what I come here for.  I'm always respectful, nice, I tip well and have a cheerful disposition. That's just my vibe. I've also been a server for many many years so I'm generally pretty patient with bad/moody service or off experiences.  I loved this place so much that I used to always go to the one in N. Austin slash Cedar park for lunch because it was close to my work and I'm a loyal customer. At that location, I always order a slice of cheese pizza. One time I asked for a bit of seasoning, chef's choice, and it was so damn good I never ordered regular cheese pizza again. It's a beautiful thing and I was so thankful.  I can drink a beer and make something tasty at home; all day every day, but tonight I decided to come to 600 degrees because I love supporting local businesses and servers in general.   I order my go to; the hoppiest beer and a slice of cheese pizza with any seasoning.   She said "we only offer cheese pizza or pepperoni"  I was like, "cool, I just want a slice of cheese pizza but with a touch of seasoning, any seasoning really, chef's choice."  She appears to be really put out, not the least bit subtle and perhaps internalizing this because she's outwardly angry. "I can give you Parmesan or red peppers as seasoning." She picks up both and throws them like I've hit a nerve.   Sips beer. Ok, fine, whatever. ‍   It's a slow Sunday night, there's 3 other people at the bar. It's approx 8:30pm and apparently seasoning is a touchy subject around here so I let it go for now, but the fear of my slice lacking flavor was making me rethink my dinner choices. I hadn't had a proper meal all day, just scraps of snacky stuff. I was really hungry, but not so hungry I would eat something just shy of delicious.   I take a few sips of my beer and the bad vibes are so thick I could cut right through them.  Being steps away from the BOH, I ask, "hey can I get a little bit of seasoning on my slice of cheese pizza?"  To which he responds; "you have to ask your server. Its up to them, if they order it I'll make it. I can't make it if they don't order it". The loyalty coupled with toxicity was blowing my mind.   Apparently it's a whole thing, because the staff starts gathering to watch the showdown. Girl who wants a slice of seasoned cheese pizza against the world. It's riveting.   OMG you guys, this woman wants seasoning!!! Can you believe it!!!?   It's to a point that it's kinda hilarious and I'm just like, these people have big feelings about seasoning.   She steps in, heroically in her eyes I'm sure and says "I'll do it for you but just this one time." I mean, total saint right?   Oh my! I'm touched. Thank you! My cup runneth over!   I go back to my seat and watch the drama unfold over a bit of seasoning on a slice of cheese pizza. It's something to behold folks.   At this point I don't like my tasty beer so much that I'm willing to subject myself to this level of toxicity so I left because I prefer my pizza sans the needless drama and hostility.   I kinda think this has nothing to do with seasoning.

reviews.author: Oliver W.
reviews.description: We mostly only do takeout from 600. I upped the rating to 5 star from 3 star because takeout pizza is all about timing. 600 has taken steps to separate the "I just want a beer" line from the "hey, I'm here to pick up an order" line. Getting home with a hot pizza = a great pizza. Getting stuck in a long checkout line and ending up with a cold pizza = a horrible pizza.   Great job 600 on stepping up and making the takeout experience better for all.

reviews.author: Kassidy D.
reviews.description: Super delicious. The crust was perfectly crisp but not too chewy. The table shared the Thai wings. The wings were really crispy and not too spicy. Really solid pizza place. Only issue was one item didn't make it to the table and had to be taken off of the bill and there was a bit of a wait for the food, other than that everything was great.

reviews.author: Ross P.
reviews.description: So I was across the street at the new Austin Title office picking something up.   The pizzeria across the street looked good (and smelled good) so I dropped in.  Their pizza was made-to-order, and their staff is friendly and communicative.   Let me tell ya...it was the best pizza I've had in Texas.  My wife loved it so much she told me to hide it from her :)  So good.  Next time I get pizza, I might just drive all the way to Georgetown just to get it.  So good.

reviews.author: Alexis B.
reviews.description: We drive from Austin to come here - it is highly recommended and great pizza, with local craft beer on tap. Be ready for a wait, probably any hour they are open. They do have a local market around the corner that offers Togo only.   If they don't have a pizza you like you Dan make your own. They also offer wings, knots and salads. Honestly you cannot go wrong and it's all locally owned.

reviews.author: Sarah F.
reviews.description: We came to this place on a Saturday night and it was busy. We put our name on the list and were told it was a 50 minute wait. We walked around the quaint shops of the square while we waited. When it was our turn, we were really hungry! Our friendly  server was Michael and he was really friendly. He brought us a few samples of local beer and my husband and I were happy to get to choose our favorites. I can't remember what we got but it was good. We ordered garlic knots but they were out. We choose cheesy bread for our 2nd choice appetizer. We ordered one city pie, one margarita pizza, and one cheese pizza. Michael recommended the gluten free, which made our portions a little smaller and also less of that bloated feeling. The hubby and I are trying to eat healthier so I said yes to gluten free. We ate almost all of our pizzas, while sitting on the patio enjoying our beer.  This restaurant is just one more reason that I'm falling in love with Georgetown. We will be back.

reviews.author: Shelli S.
reviews.description: Love this place!  We always go when we are in the area!  We have slices of pizza and Caesar salad!  All great! Service is always in point also! We will return!

reviews.author: S. F.
reviews.description: I'm sad to update my review for the worst. This is the only place we would go for pizza. Not sure if there's a new chef or what's up, but the last several times the pizza was not good. The very last time, the pizza was burned so badly we couldn't eat it. So we're sadly looking for another pizza place. The wings are still very good here, but overall the food quality has definitely declined.

reviews.author: Marissa T.
reviews.description: Stopped by for lunch on a gloomy Saturday and surprised that the wait time was relatively short for a packed restaurant! Since its located downtown Georgetown there is a bunch of street parking and a few lots located a block or two away so not too terrible of a walk.  After reading a few reviews I was sold on the pizza by the slice especially if you are able to customize it however you want or from their list at dinner (5PM) it is only cheese or pepperoni. To start we had the sweet chili wings and they were delicious, had a nice crisp/crunch! Pizza was amazing and worth the wait, I had the pirate and the garlic on top just made the pizza even more amazing.  Service lacked a bit, but I can understand everyone has their off days and with the pandemic contact should be at a minimum. All in all, I will be back especially during lunch hours for more pizza by the slice.

reviews.author: Wanda C.
reviews.description: I spent my Christmas Eve here. I did not feel lonely for one moment because Yvonne was my bartender and she was so much fun to talk with! Hi Yvonne! She helped me with the menu and was very knowledgeable on all the choices.  I had the Cuban Nachos and Mionetto Prosecco during the 3pm to 6pm happy hour and both were absolutely delish at a great price! I will be going back.

reviews.author: Delia S.
reviews.description: On a particularly busy day at another nearby restaurant, we opted to forego the hour long wait and wound up at Hard Count. My boyfriend was pleased with the abundance of sports on the many large screen TVs.   The food was good, especially his chicken enchiladas, which had a nice little bite. I opted for the seared salmon Caesar which was recommended by our server. The salmon was fresh, they have seafood shipped in fresh never frozen, but was a little bland. I enjoyed the salad all the same. It was a nice alternative on a day where we were unwilling to wait.

reviews.author: Mary O.
reviews.description: This is one of the newer Georgetown spots and we finally made it out for a late lunch. I've been craving fish and chips - which I've heard is one of their specialties.    We started with the Calamari Diablo - it wasn't as spicy as I expected, but it was delish! The calamari pieces were sliced thinner and crispy.  Peppered thru the dish were fried pickles and shaved Parmesan that complemented the appetizer nicely!  The dip was "marinara-ish" with sliced onions - Yummy!   The menu had plenty of great options but we both got fish and chips.  The plate was loaded with 3 large battered/fried cod pieces.   The crunch to fish ratio was on point!  The dish came with a unique slaw made from cabbage, apple slices and apple cider Vinegar- I couldn't place my finger on the spices but it was very tasty!  The thin sliced apples popped in the slaw.   The waffle fries were crunchy (I normally don't like waffle fries but these were thinner and possibly light battered/double fried with perfect seasoning.   We will definitely return ~ looking forward to trying more options from the menu and bringing friends with us next time.

reviews.author: Jason C.
reviews.description: Never been to this location before but let me just say it is worth a visit.  I enjoy fish and chips and found that they do it just right here!  In my opinion the only thing I did not like was the waffle fries were crunchy, mainly because there's some weird additives they added to them, looks like some kind of sesame seeds or something.  Waffle fries are just fine by themselves with great seasoning no need to add weird crunchy stuff, I literally thought I was going to check my teeth only reason why I didn't go five stars here.  My wife got the blackened salmon Caesar salad which I must say was above and beyond with a ton of flavor! I will probably get this next time.  On another note their coleslaw is unlike anything I've had before some kind of a cilantro vinaigrette highbred but I must say I do anything to learn this recipe!  Decent draft beer selection and a handful of wines this place is worth a visit especially if it's game day and you're looking for a good game there's TVs in every direction you look pretty good sports bar especially at an upscale level I would recommend it definitely give this place a shot!

reviews.author: Blackmoorbz ..
reviews.description: I have been to this restaurant twice and it is my new favorite and I'm very picky the steak special is delicious  and the fried shrooms are Amazing!! I wouldn't order the burger again it was nothing special but everything else has been delicious

reviews.author: Chase D.
reviews.description: This place has great food, a wonderful bar, great drink selections and a lot of TVs. My only criticism here would to improve their marketing campaign and they would blow the doors off. You don't see them on social media or really anything.

reviews.author: Marilyn W.
reviews.description: We found this restaurant in a portion of Georgetown that we had never been in before.  We felt like we were in a different country or state... maybe Florida. And the restaurant was also a new dining experience. We ordered "regular" food including a hamburger and fish dinner.  But they were very good. The waiter was outstanding and made us feel like we got special service.  We will go there again soon.

reviews.author: Josh J.
reviews.description: Wow. Amazing spot, really. Server Gaby was wonderful. We were at the bar of 2020 Scratch and saw this place across the street so searched it. I would HIGHLY recommend to management to change your classification to include restaurant as well because when searching for that this place won't pop up. BUT the fish and chips is killer, very crispy and great flavor. The slaw on the side is some of the best slaw I've had. Also love all the sauces it comes with. Will def be back.

reviews.author: Kat S.
reviews.description: Great food, drinks, and service. Amazing atmosphere and live music in the courtyard Tuesday nights. New fav spot

reviews.author: Nichole E.
reviews.description: This is a true hidden gem in Georgetown and I'm so glad we found it! We came here for a late lunch today. I got the Joey's el Classico margarita and my fiancé got the roadrunner. Unfortunately my margarita was way too sour for me and I hate to be this person, but I asked if I could trade it out. Our waitress said yes and I got the jalapeño martini which was way more enjoyable. For an appetizer we got the Cuban nachos, which was basically the fillings of a Cuban sandwich served over a bed of homemade chips with a swiss queso. I'm salivating just writing this because it was so good we cleaned the plate!  For my meal I ordered the chicken fried steak that came with mashed potatoes, bacon green beans and Texas toast. Y'all....as a southern girl I consider myself a chicken fried steak aficionado, and they know what they're doing. The serving was huge, the breading  flavorful and crispy, and the gravy was so good I wanted to dip everything in it. You can also really tell that their sides are not an afterthought because the green beans were so good I couldn't stop eating them even well after I was full. My fiancé got the fish and chips and while I didn't personally try it he said it was delicious, and again, the portions were huge! You definitely get your money's worth here. Along with the great food we also had great service so next time we're in Georgetown we will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Kalee M.
reviews.description: INCREDIBLE! Amazing service, beautiful atmosphere, everything tasted amazing! Drinks were a little strong but most people prefer that! We sat outside and it was beautiful

reviews.author: Hannah B.
reviews.description: Food is amazing! Their outdoor set up desperately needs fans. Service was great for our large group for my birthday dinner! The hot chicken club is HUGE and delish!!!

reviews.author: Vandesha L.
reviews.description: Wow! What an amazing meal. I stumbled upon this hidden gem while in the area grabbing thing at a near by Home Depot. I was hungry and had already tried some near by restaurants. This place was not busy and the ambiance seemed nice.  My friends and I were a starving and boy did we come to the right place. We started with cooked oysters that were absolutely mouth watering. One of my friends had never had oysters so I was excited that he enjoyed them. We also got the pork belly queso, it was a bit thick but full of flavor. The chips were crispy and seasoned which helped with the thick cheese. One friend got the Buffalo chicken sandwich, the biggest juiciest chicken breast I'd ever seen. He left nothing on his plate! My other friend go the fish and chips, he does not like coleslaw but this was no ordinary slaw. The head chef explained they don't use vinegar and they do add celery seed. I was the big girl and ordered the pork chop, large portion but I ate it down to the bone. I wish I had another option besides mashed potatoes but overall it was awesome. We did order cocktails, peach martini and margaritas. Our server was knowledgeable and very pleasant. We were immediately greeted and seated. Our food was fresh and hot and the wait wasn't long at all. I can't wait to go back and try desserts.

reviews.author: Rise L.
reviews.description: Cold beer. A good old fashioned for my husband. Lots of menu options. And yummy eats. The atmosphere was exactly what we were looking for on a Football Saturday and the food was SO good and filling. My husband enjoyed their chicken fried steak and their chicken piccata pasta was oh so good. Not too hard on the wallet either! Can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Charmayne J.
reviews.description: This was my second time coming here. First time I got food to go and it was delish. I was told appetizers were half off during happy hour. Two weeks later, I'm two days short of the half off apps. Ok cool. I wanted the shrimp and lobster roll. No longer on the not updated menu. Ok cool. I got the tiny flavorless not seasoned at all salmon and salad, grilled oysters which were excellent( they didn't last) and side stale waffle fries....... I get more fries for cheaper at McDonald. That are fresh. I pay $14/ 3-4 pieces of fresh salmon at heb. Sooooo this salmon has got to be bomb to justify this size for $18 w salad. All in all, not pleased w my second shot at this establishment.

reviews.author: Ashley E.
reviews.description: Love this new hidden gem! Really nice upscale sports bar with farm to table food. The service is amazing and the food is even better! I got the salmon Cesar and it was to die for! So fresh and flavorful. Definitely my new favorite spot!

reviews.author: Rigo G.
reviews.description: An upscale sports bar and grill, this restaurant has some amazing dishes. We've come by twice now and both times have left very satisfied. Will keep coming back to try the different dishes and superb customer service. Oh yeah, they make some killer cocktails too... Spicy Margaritas by Linda...

reviews.author: Christian F.
reviews.description: Food was cold and we spent long periods of time waiting for our server while the restaurant was pretty much empty

reviews.author: Theresa H.
reviews.description: Had brunch this morning.  Adam our server, was very attentive, friendly and provided fantastic service.  This place has a great staff starting with the hostess and continuing with our server.  The food is always good and hot.  We will be visiting again in the near future.  Kudos to management.

reviews.author: Sara B.
reviews.description: Spent a girls evening at Hard count   I personally prefer beer which they have plenty of  My friends loveeeeee Fancy! and prefer pretty cocktails.   We decided to meet and have a girls night for appetizers.  However after looking over the menu which is AMAZING !!! we each ordered dinner and also appetizers.   Our 1 hour let's catchup girl time. Ended 5 hours later having the best time.  (Casual yet classy)Our New favorite place to meet in Georgetown.  We have officially tried everything on the menu and consider ourselves... seasoned professionals at this point!!! Love this place and the staff on point and know their food. Recommend for lunch, Dinner or fancy cocktails... or beer

reviews.author: Suzanne P.
reviews.description: Amber Ale is amazing! IPA is good.  Very friendly staff and customers.  Price is now $5 per pour - 16 oz pours. The place is very small and in a warehouse area, hard to find. Hope they make more stouts and porters. Great place to stop.

reviews.author: Teresa B.
reviews.description: We had heard about Bluebonnet for a while and finally decided to check them out on a Friday evening. We were shocked to find a packed house! The picnic tables outside are plentiful but were all full when we arrived. Luckily two guys let us join them. I had the Raspberry Berliner Weisse and it quickly became my new favorite. It is sweet and crisp without being overly sweet. Our friends both got the Cream Ale and loved it. We all walked out with growlers. Everyone there is super friendly and very welcoming. We had the baby with us which was fine (there were a few kids there)...but every time a car was exiting we would have to wrangle him down (minor downfall of basically sitting alongside the parking lot). We are looking forward to visiting again.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Nice little brewery in a warehouse. Seating is all outside in the parking lot. Regulars bring lawn chairs. Beer was okay. Food was meh. Plastic cups are a turn off. I'd stop in again if thirsty and in the area, but wouldn't go out of my way to get here...

reviews.author: John R.
reviews.description: Good variety of tasty beers on tap, and they run true to form. We prefer a selection like this vs say five different IPAs. Good seasonal beers. Food truck on site. Decent seating for a smaller brewery. Lots of parking. The Tap Room is only open Thur-Saturday, so if we find ourselves on a Sunday beer drive, we have to pass.

reviews.author: Eric C.
reviews.description: Bluebonnet Beer Company is simply amazing. They are a little difficult to find, look for the side street behind the post office and you should notice it on the right.  Their beers are super delicious, I had the wit, pecan brown ale , cream ale and hef. Out of all of them, the cream ale and wit come highly recommended. They are so smooth and drinkable.  There is a schnitzel food trailer that serves some pretty decent food. The place is small but all of the employees I encountered were nice and friendly. For seating, there is only plastic benches avaliable located in the front of the brewery. Not really any kind  of shade or landacaping but this is expected since it is such a small brewery.  It may not have all of the amenities and backyard space that other larger breweries in Austin have. But if you love beer and want to interact with some awesome, friendly people then Bluebonnet Beer Company is the way to go. Everything is tasty and pints are currently at $5 each, you can't beat that price.

reviews.author: Isabel R.
reviews.description: If there was a zero I would not give this establishment any stars. We go when it's raining and all tables are outside for the exception of the owners table that was inside. We asked if we could move our table in and was rejected instantly because "there was no room" (there was enough). Hospitality was at a negative and we were highly considering the beer mug club but the lost a customer and a loyaled customer.  Bluebonnet Brewery you all need to focus on customer Hospitality and not just your sales.

reviews.author: Sereena J.
reviews.description: Great little brewery in my hometown of Round Rock!  My family and I came here on a Friday around 6:30 to grab a few beers and relax. If it's cold outside, I highly recommend bringing a layer or two as there is only a bit of seating inside but about four picnic tables outside. Also, wait to grab dinner at the brewery as they have rotating food trucks Thursday-Saturdays. When we went, they had a lobster roll truck that served amazing rolls.   I started out with their Oktoberfest beer, which was very good! My mom, who is not a big beer drinker, got their shandy and thought it would be great for a hot day. The beers are $5 a pint, and I thought it was really cool they have a series related to the Immortal 10.   Parking is not a hassle, the beer is very good, the people are friendly, and your hardest job will be finding a seat. Enjoy!

reviews.author: Shannon B.
reviews.description: Hello there, Bluebonnet Beer Company! Delighted to make your acquaintance! I don't know why I am just now discovering this treasure trove of highest quality local craft brews, but I'm so glad I'm educated now. Brewmaster David Hulama and his partner Clare have something special going on here, and yes, dirty hippies, it's up in Wilco off a toll road - don't worry, you'll love it!  Opening up special to host a local running group for #globalrunningday? + 1 star Serving 10 different varieties of delicious beer for all palates and ABV levels? + 1 star Evening shade to cool the outdoor picnic table seating? +1 star Friendly and knowledgeable staff taking orders/payments and serving patrons? + 1 star Discounts for American Homebrewers Association members + 1 star  During my visit on a Wednesday evening for a special event, the available beers (from highest to lowest ABV) were: Immortal Ten Castellaw Quadrupel (10%) Immortal Ten Kelley Imperial Stout (10%) India Pale Ale (7%) American Amber Ale (6.5%) Vienna Lager (5.5%) Cream Ale (5.5%) Texas Pecan Brown (5.5%) Bluebonnet Wit (5.4%) German Pilsner American Amber Ale (5.3%) Texas Summer Blonde Ale (5.2%)  Other good stuff to know: + Pints are just $4. Flights (4x 6oz pours of your choice) $10. + Located just east of Cedar Ridge High School in an industrial park behind a post office. Waze knows the way. + Tap room generally open only Fri-Sat 5-8p, but check Twitter and FB for special events. + Rotating variety of food trucks usually parked during open hours + Single stall restroom is in the back, next to the small air-conditioned tasting room + Venue available for parties + Kegs available for purchase + Find their beers served at area restaurants and bars, including The Dig Pub, Cover 3 RR, Greenhouse Craft Food, and more.

reviews.author: Chad T.
reviews.description: This is the best beer in Texas!  I've been coming to Bluebonnet since 2103 and its amazing!

reviews.author: Alexis B.
reviews.description: We love blue bonnet. It's really the only brewery in the area and we are used to living in the domain where there are like a million options.   Beer is tasteful and I don't always love IPA. Their indoor seating is limited by this isn't normally a problem in Texas. They have plenty of tables outside and also have tents in the summer. No food but there is always a food truck - if you follow them on Facebook you can see what it is ahead of time.   Staff is always friendly and accommodating. Plenty of space for puppies here too.   They are only open Friday evenings and Saturday! I wish they had some openings on Sunday.

reviews.author: Doug K.
reviews.description: Try the Amber, pecan brown or Irish dry stout Fantastic beer. Great off track location.

reviews.author: Jason M.
reviews.description: Great beer and great people. I only wish they had more seating. They have a loyal customer base which speaks to the way they treat there patrons but also means the little seating they have is always full. If this place would just expand, they could run the Round Rock beer scene!

reviews.author: Samuel B.
reviews.description: Middle of the road Brewery. Simple and plan. Nothing crazy. Probably following German Purity Laws. If you're looking for basic styles of beers here is your spot. The IPA is nice classic take. $4 all pints. Can't beat that

reviews.author: Eric J.
reviews.description: Prior to coming here, had heard consistent HIGH positives on this place...  Firstly, Marga (aka the Beer Snob), and I checked out a Pale...and their Pale was Very Good...asked for a sample of their IPA,...and before even drinking it....getting the nose of the beer -- already knew that it was -- Spot On and the-way-it-should-be!  Their Cream Ale was a new beer idea to me...tried that and WOW, creamy and light...Very Good.  What a Great Place and Team!!!  Thank You soo Much!!!  Eric and Marga  p.s., when it finally gets a bit cooler, we will be by with Kodiak, "The WunderMutt"

reviews.author: Jay N.
reviews.description: This a Hidden event pastors please have a new brewery was there Oktoberfest was a good idea the Oktoberfest was fun Had a chance to experience great good different types of German beers and bratwursts it was a lot of fun for family and friends

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: I'm rating Blue Bonnet 3 stars because while we love their beer and have enjoyed it the very much during their Oktoberfest, we were pretty bummed when we went on a Saturday night. We know that they are popular and were even excited to try Jimmy Vega's Smokehouse but when we arrived half of the available tables were set as reserved. There was literally no where to sit. Every table was packed. We had our 3 yr old son with us, so standing wasn't an option, especially since we wanted to eat too. We asked anyway if any of the tables were available and was told no, they are all reserved for 5pm, but you could squeeze in anywhere else. In the end, we left irritated and disappointed, while I understand reserving tables, but when you only have 10 tables and you reserve 5 of them, that doesn't leave much room for anyone else.

reviews.author: Britt J.
reviews.description: Bluebonnet is a great craft brewery with an outstanding lineup of ales, seasonal lagers, and wheat beers. I really enjoyed the Vienna lager. The owners run a hands on, customer friendly business that is a real pleasure to visit. The perfect place to relax with friends and enjoy some really good beer!

reviews.author: Katie K.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed the beer here. My favorites were the Hefeweizen and the Summer Wit.   The guy at the counter was very friendly and went through a description of all the beers. Good place to get a flight to try multiple beers.  There was a food truck present, too. I didn't get any food, but maybe next time!

reviews.author: Melody B.
reviews.description: Beer is good. Great to sit outside and have conversation but the noise from the food truck generator made it hard to have hear.

reviews.author: Nicole G.
reviews.description: Locally owned family run business that has delicious beer. They always have at least 6-8 beers on tap and a couple seasonal favorites. They have a solid line up across a wide style of beers. The summer wit is a favorite along with the Kolsch styles they release during the fall. I would love to see them expand to a new location  with a climate controlled tasting room which I think would bring in a lot more clientele.

reviews.author: Ashley H.
reviews.description: For a newer-ish brewery this place is definitely headed in the right direction. Sour beers are freaking delish! I wish that they had more food options when you drink and or a bar that you can walk up to, but all good things come to those who wait!!   My second time around I ordered a cheese tray from a local artist and brought it to eat outside. It was perfect. My husband loves their beers and always asks to go their before our date nights! Keep it up Hedgehog!

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Such an awesome place! It's all outdoors with picnic of tables, umbrellas and a few chairs and tables. Dog friendly- they have dog bowls! Pretty flowers and lots of grass for kids to run in. The beer was delicious. I tried 3 five oz pours, all IPAs they were delicious!! You order the beer online and they call you when it's ready. Quick, easy and safe. Will def be back!  They have different food trucks , check their Facebook to see what's there when you're going.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Great addition to breweries in  CP area. Multiple IPA and Farmhouse Ales. Large open patio with picnic benches and yes umbrellas.   They were also cooking up some awesome looking Pad Thai when we visited. Friendly knowledgeable folks and a great beer selection.   CC payment only via their App.  As an FYI this is where the Thousand Oaks brewery was located.

reviews.author: Amy D.
reviews.description: Clean, nice owners, great beer! I've tried a few beers here. My favorite one is Mango Tango! It is very tasty! Mango with some habanero (I believe) it is so good! Come out, you can order on your phone and relax outside in the nice picnic table/table seating area! Come on out and give them a visit! You will not be disappointed!

reviews.author: Matt P.
reviews.description: Fantastic IPA, Farmhouse, and Saison beers on tap. The beer is really fantastic and the mood is mellow. This place will be hopping once the word gets out.  Thank you for the fantastic flavors. The beer is really above par. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: Friendly people, high quality rotating  beers, nice outdoor seating. Like a nice neighbourhood space.

reviews.author: Audrey B.
reviews.description: A great place to go on a summer evening! I tried it for the first time Saturday and loved it! The draft choices were great, Crush ended up being my favorite! Chill vibes the whole night and just overall a fun atmosphere!

reviews.author: Chris B.
reviews.description: We love the people at the brewery. That is why we became members. The beer is excellent and they make you feel welcomed here.

reviews.author: Greg G.
reviews.description: Bull Creek Brewery beer =  Bull Creek Brewery pour math = BS  Cool place, great beer, weird vibe in the pour room.   When you walk in you have to stop at one counter where the attendant explains how you buy beer. So, it's 3, 12oz beers for $12. Then they hand you three poker chips and a glass that clearly won't hold 12oz of beer. The attendant at the station swings the pod around for you to select a tip option starting at 15%. You then turn and go 4 feet to the bar where the beer pourer tells you what type of beer they have and pours 8-9oz of beer in the mini beer glass. She has a tip jar as well. Out of curiosity I filled the mini beer glass with water and as I suspected the pour we received equaled 8-9oz. For the record, I would have agreed to $12 for three 8-9oz pours. Good beer, just don't piss on my leg when I buy it!

reviews.author: Carl H.
reviews.description: 11/14/20  Stoped here several times, but was take out only.  Now they're OPEN for all to enjoy their beer.  STRICT Distancing enforced, but ... keeps us all safe.  Stouts are outstanding!! Pricing more than fair.  The food trucks has Nacho's that will knock your socks off. The brisket has a wonderful smoke flavor.  Super pleased with our visit. !!

reviews.author: Dana A.
reviews.description: Beers were mediocre and the set up needs work.  We spent $30 on ten 7oz tasters but you were required to go back to the counter each time you wanted to try a new beer.  They only allow two people in the bar room at a time, which I appreciate as a Covid precaution, but when you have to go back inside ten times this isn't ideal.  We actually didn't get the chance to try all of the beers because they call last call at 4:20.  We couldn't get in line fast enough or even drink fast enough to get all of the beers we paid for.  We live about 30 min away and don't plan on going back.

reviews.author: Sasha R.
reviews.description: This place is great! The owners/brewers are women and they brew some tasty beer! Go girls!! The venue is a pretty basic metal building style with a wrap-around porch and plenty of seating. Usually the VFW is there cooking up some tasty food. We love it out there. They're only open on weekends. Come prepared to enjoy yourself!

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: This is a cool chill brewery that you should visit if you live in the 78613 or north. Our Yelp buddies suggested that we check out this brewery and yes they have some pretty good beer. Their Longhorn Blonde is perfect for a non IPA person. The Tommy Raj IPA and Mosaic is on point and will satisfy even the most discriminating beer snob. Yea that means you you bearded flannel wearing... sorry for the digression. We had a great time and the brew folks and drinkers were helpful and friendly. Oh yea there was a bacon themed food truck onsite and it was great. OK who doesn't like bacon... Like bacon nachos!!!   Paul, so why three stars? So you buy 3 tokens for 3 pints at $15.00 you order a beer and you receive a 12 ounce bottled beer in a plastic cup. That is a party foul times two. So its hot in TX and the only AC is in the tasting/pay here room. Please add some fans on your porch and in the brewery area. I'm not going to chill er sweat on your porch in July. Plastic cups c'mon really.    You guys are brewing good beer..Add  some fans and glasses....

reviews.author: S K.
reviews.description: Fun place!  Rustic, in the middle of a nice piece of land with longhorn steers in the back field!  Great beer and choices!  Plenty of outdoor seating and fresh air.  Great food truck with brisket nachos, jalapeño poppers.  Hours are Saturday and Sunday 12-6.

reviews.author: Paul D.
reviews.description: Definitely a hidden gem.. made the drive this way and it did not disappoint.  Over ten beers on tap and the price was more than reasonable.  Highly recommend if you are passing through or in need of a road trip.  Very tasty beer.....

reviews.author: Jason W.
reviews.description: The best beer in Liberty Hill!  Come out and sample some of their amazing flavors. Also check out their food truck with some out of this world brisket.

reviews.author: Russell F.
reviews.description: We arrived at 4:40 Sunday afternoon. We drove from Round Rock to try Bull Creek for the first time. We were met by host and hostess who indicated they turned the taps off at 4:40. It seems their plans tonight were more important than the customers. They said they were still on their winter hours which would be 5 PM. However, the website says close at 6 PM. They're handling of the event is less than hospitable. I concur with the rest of the reviews that say customer service is lacking, we won't be back.

reviews.author: Renee B.
reviews.description: It took forever for us to stop but so glad we finally did. As a lover of a few select styles of beer but a hater of many I can say that I LOVE all of their beer. Including the IPA which is generally something I avoid. It is an English style IPA so it is not a hop bomb, which is what I hate about IPAs generally speaking.   The patio is fantastic. The folks are great!  And they have the coolest grill ever.

reviews.author: David R.
reviews.description: This is a very family friendly brewery.  Bring the kids and even the dogs while you enjoy their great beer.  Very Texas friendly owners, we love this place !

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Bull Creek Brewery is only open currently on Saturday's.  If you are out near Liberty Hill it is worth a visit to this spot.  It is definitely a community brewery with a chill, and laid back atmosphere (not often that you will find fresh farm eggs for sale in a Brewery tap room!).  Everyone seemed to know each other.  they have a covered outdoor patio that you can sip your beer at, or you can go inside to the production facility and sit at one of the picnic tables. Great open space with views of the expansive countryside. Their tap room/tasting room is small and is meant for purchases only.  You can purchase tokens to taste three half pours of their current beers on tap.  They didn't offer flights since at the time of our visit they only had 3 options to choose from.  The staff were incredibly friendly.  I liked how they supported local artisans for their creative labels.  Looking to do something during your visit?  You can check out one of their games that they have listed on a board in the tap room.  Their beer overall was OK.

reviews.author: Chris R.
reviews.description: Less than a mile from N183 lies this jewel of a place.  I had seen their beers in HEB, but never sampled. That was a mistake.   They brew in the English style, taking advantage of the local limestone-rich water.    The regular lineup is a blonde, saison, English IPA, and stout. They had a couple "happy accidents" when we visited, including an aged stout with perfect licorice notes and a mead/English ale hybrid that delivers greatness.  Get out of the grind of Austin and experience this hidden gem!

reviews.author: Daniel P.
reviews.description: The ONLY good thing about this place is the BBQ trailer. The service is so god awful that nobody should ever bother going twice. Go to San Gabriel River Brewing where the staff actually values business and doesn't try to run people off 30 minutes before close. The owner is a nice guy but the blonde bartender is a surly waste of oxygen. She was too worried about her 'girl's night' that she started booting people at 4:30 when the brewery closes at 5. Trash. Again. Go to San Gabriel River Brewing. Their staff is super nice and their beer isn't pedestrian garbage water.

reviews.author: Justin O.
reviews.description: Great local brewery with a nice relaxed atmosphere. We arrived just as they were opening and had a great visit and learned about all of their brews. They had a deal offering one of their glasses and three pours for $15. We tried several of their beers. My favorite was the Tommy Raj, an English IPA that had a great subtle hop flavor, really nice. I enjoyed the Longhorn Blonde too, nice easy to drink beer. We also tried Fire Balls, an Imperial Stout that also has an added flavor from Fireball whiskey. It was good, but a little does go a long way. Wicked River is a pale ale with a nice black cherry background flavor. They have seating in the brew room as well as on the front porch. We opted for the inside due to it being a little chilly. As other people showed up, the tables filled up and people started meeting new folks and visiting about the beer. The Baconette food truck was there and we had the bacon queso and the baconette burger. We enjoyed the Baconette food very much. Come out on Saturday and try their beers, you'll be glad you did.

reviews.author: Erin F.
reviews.description: This place is absolutely, hands down, our most favorite brewery. My boyfriend and I Are honorary beer connoisseurs ;) and love trying out breweries or even wineries in the austin and San Antonio areas and surrounding. In our tenure, we've been to more than I can count for both and this takes the cake. Although the place isn't super warm as far as ambiance, the beer is fantastic! They have an amazing product and you will not be disappointed!

reviews.author: Brian J.
reviews.description: Great beer!  My favorite is the Iron Balls Imperial Stout.  Some of the nicest people you will meet and cold beer what a combination.

reviews.author: S G.
reviews.description: Wonderful beer! Friendly staff and great outdoor seating. Too bad they are only open Sat 12-5! Loved talking with the VFW guys!

reviews.author: Monkey B.
reviews.description: This place would be great if only because it was near our house, but the beer also happens to be really good!  I go to the few liberty hill beer stores and will seek out Bull Creek's beers. Really friendly staff at Bull Creek, and a great place to get beers directly from the source!

reviews.author: Chris E.
reviews.description: Very nice place, I came from California to try. Staff was nice, bathrooms were clean and the beer was great!

reviews.author: Dana T.
reviews.description: Love this place. Lots of good options. I think 8.5 minutes abs is even better than electric jellyfish.  The people that work there are great! Also they host watch parties for Austin FC. Go Verde!

reviews.author: Nancy Z.
reviews.description: Always a great time here! They have Meade, to hop water to yummy Lovely Day IPA.  Clean place and clean toilets.   Don't forget to check out their food truck!

reviews.author: Rosie J.
reviews.description: Such a fun place to hang out and grab a beer and some food! The hopwater is an awesome option if you don't want to drink but still want to have the brewery experience. The food truck was great too and prices are very reasonable.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: Great patio that's dog and kid friendly, complete with the Austin Steam Train behind it.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Whitestone Brewery is a great place to grab a beer and relax after work or watch an Austin FC game. They have a large patio for all their events like trivia and bingo and plenty of seating inside. Head here for some great Texas beers.

reviews.author: Jim R.
reviews.description: Awesome brewery!, excellent selection. Amazing atmosphere!, great service and the food from Van Dams is Awesome with great prices. Just became a Pub Member for these reasons!!!

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Wow I can't believe I've forgotten to review here. I LOVE their beer and location. Always great beers on rotation and the flight tray is cool.  Only reason for the 4 starts is today we came for what had to be the 6th or 7th  time and got kicked to the outside patio for having a dog. This is ALWAYS the brewery I go to when it's hot because they allowed dogs inside. I've had every other bartender let my dog in, love on him and have had zero problem sitting inside with him. Even their Facebook has a picture of a dog inside. Today we were told that was never allowed and should have been told to go outside. We have also seen many other dogs inside during past visits. I hate inconsistent rules. Also, super sad that we'll have to find a new brewery this summer. It's too hot to be outside and my dogs nickname is the the brewery dog.  I'll still support them during cooler months-- but dog owners should know the rules have changed. Very sad. Wish they would have posted something about this change.

reviews.author: Ryan D.
reviews.description: A nice flight of light non IPA beers. No food. Only a food truck but nice atmosphere indoor/outdoor.

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: Great beer vibe. Plenty of seating inside and outside. Parking kinda sucks.  The menu has a really good range of beers that I haven't seen anywhere else. Beer is cold and food options are good too. We had nachos and loaded tots. The Austin FC bold game was on. They had green beer and if you wore green you got a $1 off

reviews.author: Ellie B.
reviews.description: Phenomenal - amazing brewery atmosphere. Came on a Christmas holiday Friday night they had name that tune bingo going, was so fun to watch! Wish I had known would've joined ASAP  God I love Texas

reviews.author: Alexandra P.
reviews.description: Pretty good ambiance. Spaced out seating inside and outdoor seating available. Place was visibly clean and also smelled very clean! We got loaded tots from the food truck outside that were yummy. All the beers that we tried were good but the mango one was my favorite!

reviews.author: Joyce L.
reviews.description: I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Whitestone Brewery. The environment felt very relaxed and casual and I loved the outside patio area. We got a selection of beers, I personally really enjoyed the Mango Crazy wheat beer and the Keyboard Gansta IPA. The service was also very friendly and they offered some samples if you are in between choices.   The taco truck outside was also very good! I highly recommend one of their loaded fries. The fries were perfectly crispy and tender in the middle, and super flavorful toppings. The tacos were also yummy and I'm a huge corn lover so the elote bowl was perfect.   I will definitely be back to try more of their seasonal beers!

reviews.author: Manasa D.
reviews.description: It's been a hot minute since I visited Whitestone- I think the last time I was here was in 2016, when it was quieter and a lot more laid back.  Fast forward to 2021 - the city of cedar park and Leander are booming.  There is a huge influx of population. The tables at Whitestone are full, there is a food truck (which is awesome) as a permanent fixture BUT the overall customer experience has left me disappointed.  Maybe because it's a Sunday with lovely weather, the guy behind the bar is done with people, or, he isn't a people person , or, he just didn't like the way I looked? But man was it hard to get him to give me an effing beer without getting hateful glances. Yeesh. Im kinda scared of coming back here now!  That aside, im not really a fan of their beer selection either - the kolsch is OK but I've had better. I guess the biggest advantage is the proximity to both CP and Leander and for the people who live around here.  So, this isn't much of a review rather than a semi rant ?   Also guys- kids have a tendency to move around from one side of the table to the other. They're not capable of sitting still and neither are you. If you'd rather than families stay away, just tell us to our faces.

reviews.author: Nicolette M.
reviews.description: Ambiance - 9/10 Pricing - 10/10 Staff - 10/10 Food - 10/10   Overall, the service is great! The ladies behind the counter are very nice and loaded with insights about the beers. There's a food truck outside that was delish!! (Tacos and burgers) the al pastor tacos were amazing. We did not try the burgers but from what I've seen/heard it's also very yummy! Whitestone is in a great location in Cedar Park, TX. We are heading to Balcones state park to go hiking but saw this along the way and had to stop in. I'm glad we did!

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Huge covered patio! We stopped by while we were in the area and what a nice brewery to grab a beer at. I had the Blonde beer and it was light and crisp. They had a Food truck hanging outside so if you wanted to partake that was great.   Suggestions- In the guys bathroom the keg should be a little bit higher. Pretty tough for tall guys lol. But, I love the concept.   Moose Out

reviews.author: Sarah D.
reviews.description: Friendly, on top of it staff and great variety in beer. Love the hop water too! We've been coming here since the opening and it just keeps getting better! Love our Whitestone Family!

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: This is a fun place to hang out in Cedar Park but it is in a busy strip mall. The service is good and you can get some beer flights and the prices are very reasonable. My fiancé and I had a good time here and the live music was awesome!  I would definitely go back!

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Great local brewery!  Friendly and helpful staff, great tasting beers and a food truck out back - what else do you need?

reviews.author: Theresa S.
reviews.description: We like IPAs and we were  able to get a beer flight with 6 IPAs - they were all delicious!  Able to take advantage of happy hour which apparently starts at 2pm.  Seems to be a very popular spot!  Love the beer names too.  Lovely Day IPA and Ray Ray hazy IPA were some of our favorites!

name: El Monumento
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Private Lot Parking
Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Jody D.
reviews.description: Another wonderful and flavorful dinner at El Monumento!  This has become our favorite place.  Their food is just straight up delicious- always. Had the enchilada trio in the suizas sauce; all of them excellent. And the beans cooked with bacon??  Holy hell- AMAZING.  Great sangria- get the carafe- makes sense and you will finish it.   Trevor was our waiter- what a fun guy.  Helpful, attentive and funny - loved him. Also- do yourself a favor and get the chocolate cream pie

reviews.author: Mark C.
reviews.description: Second time coming here and it's a bit of a mixed bag. The staff is excellent, we were seated quickly and chips and two salsas brought out promptly.  I ordered a specialty margarita on the rocks and it was just ok.  The table ordered the chicken fajitas, enchiladas and carnitas plate. The fajitas were overcooked and dry. The edges were burnt and the onions and peppers were sliced way too thin and were over cooked as well. The portion was very small from my last visit, but shrinkflation huh?? The enchiladas were very good and the carnitas were the favorite. The charro beans were awesome. The rice was bland and one dimensional and the street corn was overly sweet. The salsa was flavorful but at least one needs a little more heat. The restaurant itself is really cool and clean. I will definitely go back but on a different night maybe try a different dish and drink

reviews.author: Gregg M.
reviews.description: Haven't had a chance to return to El Monumento since Covid and didn't know what to expect but the four of us may have had our best meal there ever. We got a reservation a little earlier than normal so we could take in the Christmas lights on the nearby Georgetown square.  Paige was our server and she did a great job. She was very attentive but didn't rush us. We started with chips and salsa, followed closely by the queso flameato, gooey and yummy .  Our meals included tortilla soup, shrimp chili relleno, street tacos and one of the special plates. Needless to say we waddled out... Our experiences in the past were a little inconsistent but this time they were right on point. Looked like there were enough employees to take care of the good crowd they had. It was fairly noisy though. Lots of families and groups.  Thanks Paige, keep up the good work! As I'm prone to say when it's appropriate, this is a repeater! Happy Holidays fellow Yelpers!

reviews.author: Diana V.
reviews.description: The food I got was not good, and borderline just plain bad. Beans watery, sour cream sauce slimy, rice tasted like cardboard. I liked the Brussels sprouts and the chocolate cake, but why would I go to a Mexican restaurant for those?  I liked our waitress a lot, as we were a big party and she did her best. But I just can't stand it when water isn't refilled timely, especially since I needed to wash down the nasty flavors I was consuming.

reviews.author: David T.
reviews.description: Passed this place a handful of times and decided to try it out. There's plenty of street parking nearby if the lot is full. Seating was quick for a party of three on a Wednesday night. They do take reservations so keep that in mind if you have a larger party.    ORDER  Chicken Flautas (start) Nachos (cut) Chips and Salsa (bench) Tres Leches   Food Flautas were good as were the chips and salsa. Nachos were surprising as the toppings were added to the chips and they're not the style where you can dip the chips. Not the style I'm used to but could be good for anyone trying to portion control.   Overall This would be a great place to take your out-of-town visitors because the service is good and the setting. I'd come back again and check out the bar area.

reviews.author: T G.
reviews.description: The food was okay but the french press coffee was absolutely amazing! Even if Mexican food is not something that you care for just going there for the coffee is worth it.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: El Monumento is always a solid choice for Mexican food and drinks in Georgetown. I love the decor and the beautiful view from the patio. The queso and guacamole are delicious and I've always enjoyed the margaritas. The hours of operation are a little unusual. They open at 3 pm on Sunday and there is normally a line of people waiting to get in so I would recommend getting  reservation.

reviews.author: Heather L.
reviews.description: Just wanted to add another amazing experience. Took my hubby here for the first time the other night and he loved it as much as I did. The food quality was perfection and our waiter Phillip was very considerate of my need to avoid wheat and talked to the kitchen to help me decide on what to eat. Wonderful service. Wonderful food.

reviews.author: Kasie M.
reviews.description: I can not believe I haven't reviewed this place yet, we used to be frequent flyers here pre covid.   My favorite part about this restaurant is the outdoor seating and ambiance. It's relaxing, quiet shaded, and you can see the water below.   The service has always been pretty good, no complaints there.   The food is very good and the drinks too, their cucumber/jalapeno margaritas are perrrrfecccct.   I agree with many of the other reviews, it's much pricier than its competitors for very comparable tasting food. Post covid, you even have to pay for chips and salsa- which is unusual at a mexican restaurant.

reviews.author: Ron J.
reviews.description: To be honest, I had given up on eating at this place some handful of years ago because I felt that the place was cooking Mexican food for the white-bread taste crowd. The food chronically lacked salt, seasoning or any interesting edge to it. Can you say "Food for the old folks home"?  But last week a friend of mine said to try again. said it had greatly improved, so I took his word for it and reluctantly went in....and can say that I was glad that I did.  They started us off with chips and salsa. Both the green (especially this one) and the red salsas were excellent and actually spicy, thank God.   We also ordered queso flameado with shrimp and chicken tortilla soup, both packed with flavor and quality ingredients.  The guacamole the we got was passable. Not as horrifically bland as is used to be BUT still needs a healthy dose of lime juice and salt which we ordered with it. Even or waiter said that it always needs more lime and salt, so, hey,just fix it already.  Everything else was also very nice, like the great seating outside and the bar drinks. I can see that they finally got some cooks that know this type of food and I am very happy about it. I WILL definitely be back.  My suggestion. You guys are finally on a roll regarding a more authentic taste. Don't rest yet!  You are only a few bold menu changes from being something truly great!

reviews.author: Olivia F.
reviews.description: If you're eating  dinner here Thursday- Sunday you need a reservation... if you don't have one, be prepared to wait atleast an hour. The cucumber margarita is super refreshing, I highly recommend it. The guacamole didn't have much flavor but the blandness of the guac was needed to cool your mouth after eating the salsa. Cool vibe inside, the patio seating is beautiful but will have to wait until it's not 100 degrees out to enjoy the view.

reviews.author: Cindi R.
reviews.description: We have been trying to enjoy this restaurant for years now as it is a georgetown staple and we love to support local businesses.    But I am done with their "we can't seat you here, because we don't serve out here," or "sorry, we can't do that," or " oh, you want salsa for your nachos? That's a $1.50 surcharge...."  Um, Nachos or tacos without salsa??  $ 1.50 to blend up some tomatoes and onions and jalapenos and cilantro??    I am done with this place and I hope that you all have a better experience overall than we have.  And now that you can pay your bill thru an app at your table??  Dont expect your wait person to ever come back.  We will never be back.

reviews.author: Angela G.
reviews.description: We love this place for dinner but not happy hour. Went to happy hour at 5 today and hit the bar area. They were out of pacifico, modelo especial and don't carry corona. Opted for 2 margaritas - not bad but not great. Until I went to pay and 2 mediocre margaritas (not even cadillac)  were over $33!!!! What on earth?! Honestly, unacceptable. These are worse than concert prices. Not going back for happy hour ever and may not even eat in the restaurant for a bit.

reviews.author: Laurel W.
reviews.description: Really like the food here. And the service has always been good!  Looking forward to our next visit!

reviews.author: Christine P.
reviews.description: Great Ambiance and Food Love it for Breakfast and Comfort Food The Pies are the Best Our favorite is the Coconut

reviews.author: Dene' H.
reviews.description: We chose El Monumento last night for my daughter's 33rd birthday. Best dining decision that will now become a tradition and a craving.   We started with chips and salsa as well as queso and one of the monthly special cocktails, the smoky jalapeño margarita. We also enjoyed the aqua Fruita non alcoholic beverage as well. Between the 5 of us, we sampled several dinner options including the street tacos, the enchiladas, and the relleno. They were all spectacular and even though I had no space in my tummy to finish it all, I couldn't stop.   Ryan, our server, made the experience even more special. I can always tell if a server is being nice to get a tip, which I can understand, but Ryan was honestly genuine and engaging without being intrusive.   The restaurant itself is beautiful with a generous deck that provides ample room to dine outdoors.   We will be back, sooner rather than later as I am already craving more Chile rellenos. You won't be disappointed!!

reviews.author: Lance L.
reviews.description: My wife have eaten here many times.  This place is very charming and has an interesting menu with terrific cocktails.  Try to sit on the deck if the weather is nice.  The bar is excellent and the ambiance after dark is very special.  Consider an after dinner walk down to the blue hole only steps from the river.

reviews.author: Kaitlin W.
reviews.description: The atmosphere, food and drinks are so good! Great date night place! You're better making a reservation because it gets very busy, but I like that the bar is separate from the main restaurant so you have kind of your own area to get drinks and apps while you wait.

reviews.author: David C.
reviews.description: Let's just start by saying this place sucks the waiter had the personality of a melting ice cube no social skills at all the food was just ok it was very hard to eat because we had nothing to drink because after our food arrived,we never saw our waiter again until the bill came  16.00 for two tacos and rice no salad or soup and then what Mexican restaurant charges for chips and salsa what a joke keep your sub par food, crappie service and chips and salsa appetizer..... we will stick to what we know "Mas fajitas" for the win!

reviews.author: Derek R.
reviews.description: Tried the Chili Rellano and Carnitas. Great food, service and location. Margaritas were not that great though. Going to give them another try down the road a bit.

name: Cork and Barrel Craft Kitchen and Microbrewery

reviews.author: William Z.
reviews.description: Friends told us their pizza was great so four of us went last night to give it a try. Turns out they only have one pizza on the menu, pepperoni, but boy is it good. Perfect crust. Sat by a warm fireplace and   Fantastic interior with very nice decor. Very upscale!  Typical pub type menu. Fish and chips, burgers, Reuben's, etc. give it a try.

reviews.author: Katie M.
reviews.description: I really like this place. Its interior is beautiful and thoughtfully designed. There a large yard with plenty of space for the kiddos to roam as well.   We had an excellent server and really liked the "Snug" we sat in.  The seating options are pretty and a unique feature actually.   Seating: Large tables, small tables, "Snugs"(private little cubby with plenty of room), bar seating, outdoor tables and cozy seating around a fireplace outside.   The food: Pretzel w/ dipping trio. Yes! These are excellent w/ an awesome sourdough flavor.  The fish and chips was pretty good. Great batter with a ton of flavor in it. The pizza (ordered without the pepperoni). The dough was under proved and under cooked. Ok at best.  The irish stew was pretty to look at but had none of the heart or depth of flavor that you'd expect from a stew. My soul was craving a hot heart stew, no luck. Disappointing.   Drinks: No wells here!! Just a quality selection of excellent wines and spirits.   We'll definitely be back and try a new selection of foods! If you're looking for a place to visit/meet up, this is a great venue. Plentyyyyyy of room!!

reviews.author: Sam B.
reviews.description: Can honestly say I look forward to coming back here. I want to start off by saying I hadn't eaten breakfast, lunch, or dinner prior to arriving there which you could only imagine I was hangry(hungry + angry)    So I park my car and Soon as I step on the curb to make my way towards the door the hostess had already opened the door and was greeting my wife and I with a warm and friendly greeting.   As a manager myself, I always preached that our customers should never have to touch the door and I was so glad to see this establishment have the same values about it as I do.   We sat down and in no time our waiter Homer was at our table greeting us. I must say he was very personable. He truly grasp the concept of building rapport with his customers.   The food came out pretty quick which was a huge plus because a I stayed before I was "Hangry"  My fries were cold, but then again they're fries so I just asked for some fresh ones that had some heat to it lol.  My wife order the 8HR Braised Short Rib and she stated it was just ok.  I asked for lemon pepper wings, My receipt shows that's what I got, but I can tell you that want what came in my plate. Was I made about it NO, why you ask? Because whatever the heck it was taste pretty darn good. I should have asked what was I given because I wouldn't mind ordering it again.  My fish and chips was freaking AMAZING and whatever little SAUCE they give you to dip you food into.... AMAZING!!! make sure you ask for extra so you get enough to dip your fries in it to lol. My wife tried my fish and chips and said she couldn't wait to come back to get that next time.   On our way out the door the host struck again with grabbing the door for us and she did it with a smile. As I was walking my way to the car another employee told me how much they appreciated our business and I'm thinking to myself write your done working your on your way to your own car to head home and you still take the time out to make is feel special. I feel that the friendly service has us excited to come back and eat here again and we are looking forward to it.

reviews.author: Alyssa R.
reviews.description: I've gone twice so far.  First time was terrible. They have us a terrible table when the restaurant was empty. Service was terrible. Out of almost everything we wanted. Food was average and took forever coming out. Second time was a lot better. Nice table on the counter patio. Food was available and came in a timely manner.  I really enjoyed the Pear and Fig Pizza and Wings. As well as the burrata

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: Such a fun new spot! Met a bunch of girls for lunch. Ciara was the sweet host that was so accommodating. We had reservations but switcheroooed on her with the table and she was super nice. Found us the perfect spot.  Angel was our waitress and she was just as great! Larger group... kept her cool... recommended great choices for us.. I had half arugula salad and sandwich and 2 glasses of Sauv Blanc ... the managers came by and checked on us... one lady and one man...  Great service, great outdoors... good filtered water... yes I can tell...  I will be back to try out patio and bar in the very near future!  Would love to try more items on the menu. And I did tell Angel I would be back to see her... I love that it's dog friendly and the outdoor seating is amazing... love the string lights... good ambiance... clean bathrooms...  Great for lunch date, happy hours or large groups!

reviews.author: Chenaniah B.
reviews.description: Our waitress was really nice and attentive to my wife and my needs. Will be back tomorrow to try more of the delicious food and drinks! Huckleberry wheat beer is my new favorite will definitely come back more often!

reviews.author: Lauren T.
reviews.description: Cool spot for inside and outside dining. The outside patio has strings of lights everywhere and a cute "whiskey barrel" table for a couple to sit at.   We had their lemon thyme wings and there so awesome. So crunchy and flavorful. We also had their special pizza and it was good! A little too greasy for us but you can tell everything was extremely fresh.  Our server was super friendly and she even let me sample the Bloody Mary mix that I asked about.  The charcuterie board looked tasty, we definitely want to go back and try it!

reviews.author: Andrea B.
reviews.description: Beautiful restaurant!!! Service was awful! Food just ok!  The fish and chip is flavorless! The carrot cake was strange!  The lemon pepper was was good!

reviews.author: Michael Q.
reviews.description: Been here a handful of times and it's been pretty solid each time.  Work happy hours mainly for me and the food is pretty good, burger is solid for a choice. The pretzel sticks very good!   The beer selection is apparently good (I don't drink but my peers do). Alcohol menu is good also based on my peers.  Came here one weekend for brunch and brought our toddler not great for them. They don't have high chairs here so not the most toddler friendly place. Think again if you child is learned to sit etc, not a bad spot for older kids though.  Overall decent spot I'm sure we will be back for work happy hours

reviews.author: Mariel V.
reviews.description: They brew their own beer and have a massive selection of good wines and provisions. It wouldn't be an Irish pub without these yummy fish and chips, now would it?!  It's the only time I'm down to go to a pub - I'm not a beer person but I love a good beer battered Irish fish and chips. The only way I'd take beer.  The place is gorgeous, spacious (big groups are welcome!)  We wished we didn't have to leave. Their back patio is beautifully by a creek. They also control the mosquitoes which could ruin any patio dining experience for me. It's a win all around!  I can't wait to come back to this piece of Ireland in Round Rock, the managers told us that a lot of their restaurant decor are from Ireland shipped here. That's pretty personal and lovely in my book.

reviews.author: Brittney C.
reviews.description: The vibe here is killer! You can totally dress your visit up or dress it down which I love!  The ambiance is absolutely great. Staff is friendly, never have I ran into any issues with reservation or walk ins. If you want to sit outside I would recommend just calling in and making a reservation.   PET FRIENDLY! Same goes with my recommendation with a reservation, if you're bringing your pet just make one so they know where to seat you outdoors. Call before :)  The menu is great! I've tried a lot of different vegetarian/pescatarian options on the menu and haven't been disappointed. You have to try the pizza!   I don't drink alcohol so I can't review on that but from what I see and have heard it's really tasty.   I love going to lunch and dinner here, so much fun.   The patio has one of the chillest vibes in the area.  Go eat and chill! :)
