reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: First of all, the place is beautiful inside and out. That's the main sell 100%. The food is good and so are the drinks but a little overpriced for their outdoor menu. A guiness draught at any type of irish pub shouldn't go for $9 nor any bar for that matter in my opinion. All food and drink prices could be $1-2 less, especially if it's a limited outdoor menu. If we were dining in (and it's beautiful inside + full menu offered), I could see those prices being fair. If the drinks were to be $1-2 less in the future, we could see ourselves being regulars, but definitely not until then.  Two of our friends ordered the wagyu burger, when asked on how it compares to a non-wagyu burger, they said they wouldn't have noticed anything especially different to a regular burger in comparison if they had not read the menu.  Nonetheless, they seemed to enjoy it.   I would order the reuben sandwich again with the kimchi slaw. I thought the kimchi slaw was very creative and it added nice flavor contrast to the otherwise classical meaty cheesy aspects of the reuben. The kimchi by itself was good, they use older more fermented kimchi, which gave the sandwich a bit of sourness to it.   My wife ordered the fish n' chips, one of her favorite barfoods. The fish itself was very moist and tender and it appears much larger in portion size than what we were expecting when looking at other user's yelp photos. The chile-lime tartar sauce wasn't very 'chile-limey' at all, it tasted just like regular tartar sauce, don't get me wrong - we LOVE any tartar sauce, but they could dial up the chile and lime all the way to the moon if that's what they're advertising.   Lastly, the staff was nice, although our waitress basically dissappeared for the second half of our stay and kept forgetting/taking an unquestionably and questionably long time to get our drinks and takeout box. Service was just OK, there is always next time.   Bonus points for the restrooms, very neat, clean and well decorated.

reviews.author: Elvira A.
reviews.description: Having brunch here isn't simply eating a meal, it is a complete experience. Yes, the food is AMAZING! The Fish and Chips  and Reuben Sandwich are delicious and portions generous. The craft beer is also the best (Huckleberry wheat).  Plus the place is filled with great atmosphere, and plenty of history. Our server (Jewels) pointed out the wall plaques located all along the restaurant filled with tidbits of information. This contributes to the experience. The music is great and staff friendly. A very happy place! We drove from South Austin to visit, definitely retuning soon!

reviews.author: Jocelyne V.
reviews.description: This brand new brewery is the spot to be lately and I can understand why : great outdoor space and patio,the ambiance is both appropriate for a romantic date or a friends outing.  I had the charred vegetables which were delicious although the portion was quite small. The pepperoni pizza is cooked in a wood fire oven and was delicious. Overall, it was a good experience, my cons would be the service (organization still balbutiating and we waited 30 min for our drinks) and it's pricey for the size of the portions. $14 a cocktail is overpriced, but their craft beers were good.

reviews.author: Ashleigh L.
reviews.description: I've been waiting forever to try this place out. I was so excited to have a kid free evening. The ambiance is great, what beautiful architecture. The drinks were "okay". Not great, but not bad. The food was what was disappointing. I ordered the flaming bacon burger. The waitstaff that brought it over, said "wait I have to light it on fire", and she took off quickly without another word and before I could ask how long I was supposed to leave it lit- We had said we hadn't been there before, so it was all new.  So my entrée tasted like 151. It was gross. The fries were pretty generic, so they didn't make up for the burger debacle. Likely to return? Nah.

reviews.author: Kimberly M.
reviews.description: 5 stars for the atmosphere/design. 4 stars for the manager that tried to help correct some mistakes. 3 stars for our server that seemed to have pushed beyond her limit. 2 stars for a good looking menu that was greatly under-delivered. 1 star for the overall management and organization of the restaurant.   We had a group of 6 that was sat outside on patio. We ordered charcuterie, pretzels, wedge salad, hot wings and lemon pepper wings, a beer flight, the Carrie Bradshaw, the smoked margarita and a few standard mixed drinks.  After placing our order, we were brought 5 place settings for the 6 of us. We asked several times for the 6th set which was eventually delivered after all the food was gone. The servers keep saying that they didn't have any silverware or plates left!  ‍  Our drink orders rolled out so slow that we had to go to the bartender ourselves to make sure the order was ever placed. The manager came over to apologized which was very nice and professional.  The charcuterie was delivered without any explanation  of what everything was. It was a very odd mix of flavors from sweet to acidic that did not pair well.  The pretzels were by far everyone's favorite. But it was also served with no description of the 3 sauces. The thick white cream was actually an amazing garlic butter that we all devoured once we finally figure it out.  The wedge salad looked beautiful and was enough for all 6 of us to have some. I only thought it was weird that they covered it in ranch inside of blue cheese   Both flavors of hot wings were so salty that it ruined the rest of the flavors. The sizes were good though.  All of their beers except the ipa fell flat and not good. The mixed drinks were super yummy and I really enjoyed my Carrie Bradshaw.   The 6 of us were all in agreement that this place was such a sad waste. It looks so cool and could be really something great if they execute their food on a higher level and manage their staff/facility better.  We won't be back unless they can turn it around

reviews.author: Kelsey D.
reviews.description: Ambience= 5 stars  Food=3 stars   Came here during the soft opening week. It's a big, beautiful space with lots of different sitting and hanging out areas. The outdoor games will be perfect for friends, parties and the kids. I know my toddler will love running around and playing and checking out the turtles in the creek down below.   The food was okay. We spent $80 at lunch with water. They desperately need a lunch menu!!! Please add a lunch so the locals can come enjoy the place during the week.

reviews.author: Noanya S.
reviews.description: Nice location, atmosphere and staff. I took a star away for a food preparer not having on gloves.  I started with a glass of caymus since it's $2 off for Happy Hour and although it's yummy as usual the tiny pour made me a little sad but I have to remember some people measure wine to the T. We also had the drink with Tito's and watermelon and the one with empress gin and rosemary, both were tasty and again $2 off for happy hour. For an appetizer we had the pretzels and the short ribs and both were prepared well. Finally our meal, I had the Cuban sandwich and my friend had the roasted vegetables, no complaints about either and I'd absolutely order the Cuban again. I'll definitely be back but may steer clear of wine due to tiny pours unless I get a bottle.

reviews.author: Gretchen A.
reviews.description: We visited again this weekend, our third time since the opening, with another couple who was joining and had not yet been to CandB.  All of us commented how the atmosphere is lively and how we like the decor and that service is good.  But the consensus this time, as at our other visits is that the menu is somewhat disappointing.  The food is a cross between general bar food and a smattering of Irish pub dishes.  What we had was fine but a variety of true entrees is what's lacking.  Maybe more Irish fare would be good like shepherd's pie, corned beef and cabbage, smoked salmon, etc.?  The burgers and sandwiches are okay but just a few more options would be great.

reviews.author: Cynthia D.
reviews.description: We've been here a couple of times already -- we're kind of addicted to the patio space with a lush green lawn overlooking the river forested with beautiful trees. The beer and cocktail selection is fantastic, too. I will have to update my review after we have the opportunity to eat indoors. After two visits, the outdoor menu (while great), was getting a bit redundant. Chicken wings, salads and pretzels all very good.   I believe they have more offerings inside, so again -- we'll try that as soon as possible.  Also: don't miss the restrooms! They are super cool. The women's room was inspired by the luxury restrooms on the Titanic, I believe!

reviews.author: Anna C.
reviews.description: Well-crafted beers and delicious pizza - what more could you ask for? Humble Pint is one of our favorite spots and a friendly reminder that Leander has a lot more going for itself than just a sleepy suburb.  Beer: As a former Austin proper resident and frequent brewery visitor, HP's beers are on par with the best of the best. Their daily selection is small but mighty. They typically offer one of everyone's favorite core beers: a blonde, a hefe, an IPA, etc. Also some sours or seasonals thrown into the mix. I appreciate that they focus on small batches that are incredibly delicious and complex.  Pizza: Bubbly, chewy crust that's on the thinner side. It's not wet or greasy. Holds its integrity to toppings with great flavor. Speaking of toppings, their mainstay pies are a beautiful blend of ingredients. Personal faves are the Mt. Rainier - sauce, mozz, pepperoni, mushrooms, hot oil, Kalamata olives, and fresh arugula - and the Willamette - sauce, mozz, pepperoni, and fresh oregano. The fresh oregano is a really lovely touch that even my picky 3-year-old appreciates.  Finally, because I'd be remiss to mention the kids, this place is definitely family friendly. But if you don't have kids then don't let that scare you away. It's actually pretty quiet and chill, perfect for a date or even to get some work done during the afternoon. They have large open windows that look out on a beautiful cemetery (it's cool not creepy) as well as an outdoor patio.  10/10.

reviews.author: Ted C.
reviews.description: My friend brought me back here because he felt like he owed me for my previous truncated visit. My last time I slammed the beers I had and didn't get anything to eat.   My latest visit I had some time to sit, sip and savor. Who would have thought that having time to enjoy a beer would make it more enjoyable. I had the same amount of beers this visit that I did the last but I did get to go through it, get some thoughts.  I was feeling a little peckish so we got the shishitos, or rather I did. I ordered them thinking my friend would also dig in, but I found out he's not into just eating peppers even though I told him it was mild. While I did feel a little guilty about eating them by myself I felt less guilty as I ate through the well blistered, sweet/hot peppers which were all a good size. They must have picked out the runts, which is something other establishments don't. It made for the peppers to be more uniform and also all the peppers were blistered at the same rate.

reviews.author: Steven C.
reviews.description: We go here all the time. It's kid friendly and they always have tons of high chairs available. The pizza is most excellent. It's kind of like neopolitian style pizza, but not as floppy. Chewy crust, great toppings. Look, I'm not a word smith, but it's really delicious, trust me. Easily top 5 best pizza in central Texas. The beer is f*****g fantastic. Seriously, every beer I've had here has been stellar. Their current stout is baller; I grabbed a couple of them to go, but wish I grabbed more. It's called like Into the Void or something. Whatever, it's awesome. Also all their other beers are solid.   P.S. If the owner is reading this, you should add some anchovies to the menu imo.

reviews.author: Judye R.
reviews.description: We had fun.  Tried a few beers, a bratwurst sandwich, salad and a pizza.  All good, not amazing but the staff was great.  Actually the salad was terrific.   Looking forward to visiting on Trivia Thursdays.

reviews.author: Jessica S.
reviews.description: The pizza was AMAZING! I got the McKenzie River pizza, the Shishito Peppers with Sriracha Mayo and my son got a pepperoni pizza! Their in house brewed beer, it's a must try and I don't even drink beer! It's super cute, laid back, games for the kiddos and a friendly staff! Do yourself a favor and give it a try! We will absolutely be back to try more! Can't believe we waited this long!

reviews.author: Amberly F.
reviews.description: Date night! We decided to join trivia night and try some new brews! The pizza was fresh and the beer was cold. We enjoyed the fun game and our time out. The pizzas are good but all only personal size and quite expensive. All in all this was a fun experience but not for regular visits at $15 a pizza for 12in size. The mix and match of original ingredients was delicious to try. I had the Mt Rainer and it was not terrible but had a slight minty flavor that wasn't my favorite.

reviews.author: Rachel B.
reviews.description: What a neighborhood gem this place is! If you are ever in the area, you need to drop on by to check it out. Here's the scoop:  -It's a good place for all ages. Yes it's a brewery, but kids are welcome too. There are food and drink options for both the over and under 21 crowd.   -Dogs are welcome on the patio!  -They have a game bookcase where you can take one to your table and play while enjoying a tasty beer or a Mexican Coke.   -The master brewer knows what he is doing.  My husband home brews and knows some things.  He was chatting with the brewer/owner and they were both geeking out all about the different beers.   -There's always several different beers and beer styles on tap to try out. They even do flights if you can't decide on just one.   -The Humble Pies aka PIZZA are super tasty. We have tried almost all of them and they have all been hits. My favorite is the Columbia Gorge one with goat cheese and sausage. They are available after 4pm every day.   -They make great paninis and salads too. They are available starting at 12pm.   I don't do salads, but I can tell you the Italian Panini was DELICIOUS. My only complaint was it was too small because I wanted more of it because it was so yummy.   -The staff is so friendly and welcoming. It has a neighborhood bar vibe and is so laid back. It's a great addition to the area for sure.   The moral of the story is this place is a hit! Come check it out when you get a chance.

reviews.author: Sam P.
reviews.description: Today started with a bad experience at a brewery in Liberty Hill, which led us here to Humble Pint. What a night and day experience.  The staff here are pleasant and kind.  We were welcomed with a smile and our dog received a lot of love as well. Thank goodness for people like this to turn your day around in a positive way. By the way...the beer is awesome too!

reviews.author: Abby M.
reviews.description: You can find us here every weekend! Every beer we've tried has been great. For a small brewery they do an amazing job providing a selection of their classics that are always available and adding in new ones. We like to go for lunch to have their paninis and chips but they're pizzas are really yummy with high quality toppings. Humble Pint is our favorite north brewery.

reviews.author: Natalie Y.
reviews.description: Can't speak to the how the beer tastes, BUT THEY HAVE WINE!  I had the Rose which was light and refreshing.    We recently moved out to Leander/Liberty Hill and this is a great little spot for us. Daughter had salad with delicious balsamic vinaigrette.  I had Panini. Husband had pizza.  It was all delicious.  And quick.  So it was like an easy quick in and quick out for a school night.   it was counter service and affordable.  I feel like with 3 of us --we can't leave a restaurant for less than $120 after tip.  We left here for 1/2 of that with 2 drinks on the tab.    We'll be back!

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Humble Pint is a great addition to the brew scene up here in the northern colonies. HP is located in the same strip mall area as Leanderthal distillery and Farm to Fork restaurant. This is the trifecta for me great booze, food, and brew.    The folks at HP are super friendly and beer knowledgeable. HP definitely has a Pacific NW vibe just check out the names of their pizza pies.     HP has a wonderful array of craft beers (there are ciders and non-boozy options as well) ranging from a light blonde to a  Belgium Tripel.  Basically, there is something for all.   Plus one ordered the Yard's Done Blonde ale and it was lite but flavorable. My Cascadian Dark Ale, was a deep brown ale that was not heavy and reminded me of a Brit porter. Cascadian hops keep the Pacific NW theme rolling!   We arrived too early for pizza (starts at 4PM) but we both ordered the Italian panini and it arrived warm and smothered with provolone cheese.  There was a healthy amount of chips accompanying our panini and neither of us was able to finish off the chips. We can't wait to return and try their pies.   When the weather is nice there is a patio that is covered and the inside dining is spacious and they are following all the restrictions.    If you are in the area do plan to stop by for a brew or two and a panini or better yet a pizza pie!

reviews.author: Sasha R.
reviews.description: Great little place to grab some good beer and pizza. The pizza kitchen opens at 4:00p and seems a little overwhemled right now as it's taking a hot minute to get 1 pizza, but it's all good because we have beer . The pizza was really good. The crust is chewy delicious. Can't wait to try a different one next time.  We're happy to have a new business like this here in Leander and think they'll continue to do well. We'll definitely be back to SUPPORT LOCAL!   Tip to biz: Please add those large rotating fans on your deck. It's TX, it's damn hot in heerr!

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Super cute spot! Only had 2 beers and October fest and an IPA both were delicious. Employees were very helpful and happy. They're super COVID safe which is a plus. Haven't tried the pizza yet but will be back to try some soon!

reviews.author: Steve L.
reviews.description: Went for the second time now that they opened limited indoor seating and it was a nice feeling. Felt like a cozy coffee shop except with pizza and beer. The tables had plenty of space between each other to feel safe taking down the mask to eat and drink.   The drinks were great and it wasn't all just IPAs full of hops like other craft breweries. The pizza is easy to eat and not too thick to make you full, leaving plenty of room for beers.   Going to make this a regular place to wind down from the week. Great staff l, very friendly, and they make sure your satisfied.

reviews.author: Brennan K.
reviews.description: One of the best gems Leander has to offer! Great brews, pizza and friendly staff. Awesome place to go even with kiddos. Thanks for being awesome Humble Pint Brewing!!!

reviews.author: Danny M.
reviews.description: I have to say that I am SUPER disappointed in my 2nd visit here.   The first time I came here (when the had just open), A friend and I had a GREAT experience. The owners wife was behind the bar and he was doing other things. Anyhow, she made my friend and I feel extremely welcomed. She talked to us about the beer and just chatted with us. There was only about 4 other people/customers there. She told us that their kitchen didn't open till 4pm but that we were more then welcome to buy food and bring it in (which we did). We sat inside, ate, and had some beers. She (I think her name was Alisha aka the owners wife. Sorry If that's not your name) came the table and asked how everything was and if we needed anything. We had a great experience!   Now today, On our second visit (same friend), we had a horrible experience. After our first visit we knew about them not serving food till 4pm, so we ordered food again from Next door. However, this time the girl behind the bar (not the owners wife) told us "outside food has to be eaten outside". Knowing that it was super windy out, she made us eat outside. We were fighting the wind from blowing everything off the table. After we finished eating, we moved back inside to get away from the wind and the experience got worse. The bartender was just cold/kinda rude, none of the staff asked us how things were, the staff themselves weren't even talking to each other, and the overall vibe of the place was just cold. We were the ONLY ones there this time and we still got the cold shoulder.   I hope this place gets better because the place is cute and had potential.

reviews.author: Corey W.
reviews.description: First time experience was fantastic! I will most certainly return for the amazing pizza and beer. The staff is super friendly, easy to talk to, and very welcoming.  We made a custom pizza that was perfect to order. Dog friendly patio outside.

reviews.author: Mike T.
reviews.description: This place is great. Even with all the roller coaster rules surrounding breweries during COVID they've still done a great job with this place. The staff is super friendly and welcoming, the place is extremely clean, and the beers are fantastic. High five to the hardworking people here making the best of a challenging time. I'll be a regular here for sure.   Side note, they pour a true 16oz pint here too!

reviews.author: Jean B.
reviews.description: What a surprise! A beer-loving friend had recommended this place so we drove out to give it a try. It was absolutely worth the drive. Every beer I tried (a flight and a pint) was absolutely fantastic. The brewer definitely knows what he's doing. My friend got the American pale and it was perfect for her. I took a sip of the Hefe and wow! Not a beer I usually order but this one could change my mind. The help was -- dare I say -- helpful! Smiled and greeted when I walked in and guided me through the beer menu and the pizza menu. The pizza was fantastic. We got the Mt. Rainer. It was a super crisp outer crust with perfect air bubbles and the perfect flavor complexity to the toppings. We are big, big fans and will be coming back!

reviews.author: Allyson M.
reviews.description: Staff is always great, the pizza is AMAZING and I love to try a new beer when I come in! Highly recommend

name: The Brass Tap - Round Rock
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: My husband and I stopped in for a drink or two and a bite to eat. We ordered chips and salsa as an appetizer. It was meh but it filled our bellies so in that aspect it got the job done.   The drinks are where it is at here. My husband ordered a flight of beer. Tons of options to choose from. I ordered Bishop cider on draft. I got the strawberry (my favorite) and also the apple pineapple. All the drinks were good.  We noticed that staff attention to customers had been a little lacking and very slow. I think this has more to do with our crappy country and COVID. But who am I to judge? We just made sure to grab our check before I was even close to being done with my second glass.

reviews.author: Raven I.
reviews.description: What a great place in downtown Round Rock! We met a friend here for drinks late, and the wait staff was wonderful! I don't think I've ever been in a bar with such nice and professional staff. They have an epic beer selection. Though beer isn't my thing, the selection still impressed me! They helped me select a beer, as I said, beer isn't my thing. They were patient and actually found me an option to "get me through the night". I did move on to margaritas though, and were these delicious! So why the 4 starts, well, they kept running out of things. For instance, my margarita went skinny when they ran out of the regular mix they use. Then, they ran out of limes! The margaritas, even the skinny ones, were fantastic! They use A LOT of ice, but still tasted delicious. Decor was wonderful for Christmas. It was just a warm and inviting space. We will definitely go back if we are ever back in that area! Parking was sufficient, as it was a weeknight. I'm sure that helped for it not to be too crowded. Everything was very clean also. Just a great place to go and meet with friends over drinks. If you're expecting tapas, call ahead to see when the kitchen closes. The kitchen had closed shortly after we got there, which was a bummer. Regardless, check this place out if you're in the area!

reviews.author: Kacey C.
reviews.description: I've been coming to The Brass Tap for a few years now and love it! The back courtyard has giant Jenga and other games and there are plenty of seating options both indoors and outdoors. Just recently tried their food and the loaded fries were pretty good! I was looking around at surrounding tables and their food all looked great. Can't wait to try more here in the future. Tons of beer on tap and very knowledgeable bartenders who make great recommendations. I will say that their cocktail availability is slim but definitely a good spot for beer.

reviews.author: Matthew C.
reviews.description: One of the best bars in Round Rock, TX. Plenty of space and always something fun going on. Look out for employees Angel, Rachel, and Mike. They're very helpful and always super positive / Friendly...  :p

reviews.author: Susan S.
reviews.description: Jeff is the bomb!!!  You are always know  what we want or what to recommend before we do!  I'm so glad you joined the Brass Tap team!!!!

reviews.author: Kevin S.
reviews.description: Monday 4pm.  Only 4 people inside the bar.  Again had to walk down to actually request a beer from the tender.

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Thankful that the brass tap is open and serving food and drink. Service is outstanding, they always have A great selection of beer on tap and if you are confused or just can't decide, ask, staff is great and matching your preferences to their current selections. Over the last couple weeks my friends and I have enjoyed flatbreads and sandwiches - Tasty and fresh. The options these days in this area, post Covid, are rather slim - But it is definitely worth you stopping in and staying for a while... They have a nice sitting area out back when it's not too warm outside.

reviews.author: Sterling P.
reviews.description: Came with my best friend tonight and seriously amazing  Michael and Sarah did a PHENOMENAL JOB. They checked on us numerous times, made the drinks to perfection, and were a pleasure to talk to!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND. THEY ARE THE BEST EVER!

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: I have been to this bar many times and every time I am here, I forget to write a review because I get too hammered after the visits there.   The highlights of the establishment are as follows:   1- Conveniently located close to a lot of parking in downtown Round Rock that is free  2- Mixed drinks are on-point  3- Bartenders are friendly and knowledgeable about beer  4- This establishment is dog-friendly  5- The Brasstap uses toast for their Brew Crew "Drink Beer. Earn Rewards. Become a Beer Guru."

reviews.author: Mary D.
reviews.description: Dropped by late and Elvis was in the building. A lot of fun. Great atmosphere. Had some tasty treats from the late menu: pretzels and mustard and chips and queso. Selected our own drinks for the first round, then went with our server, Tanya's, recommendations for our 2nd round. Particularly enjoyed The Princess Kiss.  Hadn't been there in awhile. Happy we stopped by. Great selection of drinks. Great service. Will be back soon!

reviews.author: Summer M.
reviews.description: I had never been to Round Rock! What an awesome treat. We happened into the Brass Tap and had a really great time. Fun atmosphere with an incredibly friendly staff. The bar back, Matt, was very helpful and made some delicious suggestions for us. Go for the brisket grilled cheese and stay for the warm, friendly, and fun atmosphere. I will definitely make this a destination must stop on my way through town!

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: I was looking forward to returning to the Brass Tap because I have had a good experience on a prior visit. There were a couple of mistakes by our server at first, but I chalked it up to him possibly being new or simply having an off night. Unfortunately, the service progressively got worse throughout the dinner. From spilling a drink on the table, to telling us he wasn't focused, to the bartender remaking the drink and under pouring it, and it taking almost 20 minutes to receive our check after we asked three times for it, you can't blame it on anything but a lack of effort. Continuous poor service can truly ruin an evening if you let it.

reviews.author: Joey G.
reviews.description: Great place in downtown Round Rock. Always great service, no matter how busy the strip is. I didn't play the trivia tonight, but it sounded like everybody was having a blast. I don't know how many beers they have on tap, but there's something for everyone. Great outdoor section. And there's a smoking section outside and with cigars on sale.

reviews.author: Christina G.
reviews.description: My Fiancee' and two friends of ours visiting from Dallas area decided to check this place out on Friday night.  I read the reviews on Yelp (as I always do before going), and suggested this place to them.  I am sorry for doing so. We got there, in what seems to be happening area of downtown Round Rock, which I did not know existed.  There are several bars in this same stretch of road.  Parking was easy on the street.  Once we got in, it has the bar and lot of the front area filled (no social distancing here).  Sign at the front read, "Seat yourself, and we will find ya".  We sat at a table/booth section across from the bar near the back.  Our waiter, seems like he did not know much.  We asked him questions, and he was not sure.  We found out though, if you don't want beer, they are limited on other alcohol.  I wanted a Grey Goose and tonic.  They did not have Grey Goose.  I asked for Ketel One.  They did not have.  They said they only have local vodkas, "Dripping Springs" and "Titos".  I went with "Titos" and waiter asked three times, what I wanted with the vodka.  My friend got a "Apple-tini".  It came in a very small v-shapped glass, that looked like not much more then a shot...and it had ice chips floating in her drink.  She used to be a bartender, and knew that is not what you are supposed to have there.  Also, her boyfriend had a Long Island Ice tea.  He sipped it, and it was not tasting right.  So, she walked up to the bar to get it fixed.  They told her to go back and get her mask and come back (*mind you, no patrons at bar were wearing a mask).  She did so, and ask if they could remake it.  They did so, and brought to our table by different waitress person, and he tasted it, and still not right.  So, my friend asked the waitress if they knew what they put in it.  They went thru all the ingredients and found out they use "lemonade" instead of  "sweet and sour" , which made it taste really sweet.  The food was just ok.  My friend got a salad, and looked like left over pieces of lettuce they had lying around. The nachos were just ok, and the reuben and cuban were ok.  It took us about 15 min or more just to get our waiter to come back to get bill.  They pay attention to bar area, but not much in area around it.  Sorry, won't be back.

reviews.author: Steve S.
reviews.description: After enjoying delicious food and well poured drinks from my favorite bartender Tanya, I was blindsided for having a political opinion. I was shushed and shunned by the staff for having any kind of point of view. I decided to move to the main bar to be by myself and was then questioned by the staff, who blew the whole thing out of proportion. I was told that I needed to leave the premises by some screening bartender because I was "disturbing other people"; all while never raising my voice. If the staff had not perpetuated drama, it would have been dropped. I would not suggest this bar unless you're absolutely certain that you're going to be quiet and pay for over price drinks for underwhelming service from the newer waitstaff. Weak management.

reviews.author: Ryan S.
reviews.description: Great pretzels. They charge $89 for an ounce of a bottle that costs $350 (Macallan 18). The math works out to that being less than $15 an ounce. I fully understand markup and a business making a profit, but come on. Could still make a killing at $40, and I wouldve actually bought it. Need to take a calculus class at ACC to learn about price optimization.   Good beers on tap, too.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: So, as a visitor to the Austin/Round Rock area, I do have to say that I did enjoy the ambiance and home town feel of this local pub. As per the service, the blue haired bartender/server was THE WORST best bartender that I have ever had! ;) Real talk, if you enjoy good drinks, good atmosphere, good people and great service, please stop in and check it out!

reviews.author: Tony P.
reviews.description: Saturday at 3:30pm, unable to get any service after waiting 15+ minutes. Don't both going. Not particularly busy, just not focused.

reviews.author: Cindy R.
reviews.description: Good beers but not the service is not great. Do not get service from the man with the beard and glasses. He's completely rude, uneducated on beer selections (which is weird is because he works at a Beer Tap), and lazy/slow. If you don't mind that type of service then it's still enjoyable! Great selection of seats outdoors and indoors.

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Stumbled on this place while looking for a drinking spot up north. Cool vibe being in old school round rock.  When you walk in they have mostly a collection of not your average beer. For those looking for bud, coors etc time to expand your horizons lol. Every month they switch up which brewery they get select draft beers from, notably good draft  breweries!  This month they were featuring Clown Shoes, a brand that  has some really great  IPAs and high % which is nice. Tried a 12.5% stout while here and it was amazing. For sure a beer lovers bar!

name: Red Horn Coffee House and Brewing Company
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: A.J. T.
reviews.description: Stumbled upon this place while walking the area as my car was being worked on across the way. Walking in gave me comforting coffeeshop vibes, with mostly tables of small parties 2-3 drinking beer and socializing.  Having no idea what to order, staff made some recommendations for a flight that were all fantastic. My favorites were the Cuerno Rojo (lightly carbonated and very smooth) and the Continental Breakfast (heavier stout but tastes just like French Toast and Maple syrup). I had to do a double take that I wasn't just drinking syrup but the flavors were spot on!  I'll be back again with friends/family and hopefully get to enjoy the great coffee I was smelling as well!

reviews.author: Anna C.
reviews.description: Not sure where to fault this place, honestly. First time here and the three beers we tried were excellent: a nitro double IPA, an black ale, and a Czech pilz. The interior ambiance was dark, cozy, and perfect for an intimate convo, remote work, or even games with friends. I have two small children so helped myself to the outdoor covered and heated patio. The kids enjoyed the chips and salsa while we sipped our stellar brews. Excited to try the Leander location that is actually closer to us. 10/10 plan to come back, especially to try the coffee.

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: Just wanted to update this one. Red Horn just gets better and better with age and has really turned into a community institution - especially during the pandemic when they switched to "to go" beers that we could all take out to the parking lot and drink while socially distanced. Fortunately those days are past us but I think I will always have a soft spot in my heart for this place that was a little bit of sanity amidst all the insanity.   As for the fare itself? The beers rotate and you can't  go wrong because they will always let you sample (I'm a strawberry pop-tart ravioli fan - and yes that's a beer). Pair that beer (or wine) with a meat and cheese tray or maybe a panini and you have absolutely nothing to complain about. They even have food trucks on most days...  Thanks for being here Red Horn.

reviews.author: Gerald C.
reviews.description: very cool atmosphere with both a brewery and coffee shop vibe mashed together without clashing. I got the Gordon Ramsey coffee and it was obviously made by someone who knows how to craft a latte. I do wish the flavor complimented the espresso more or punched above the espresso. It was too balanced, if that's even a thing. I will definitely return next time i'm in town to see what pieces of coffee art they come up with next!

reviews.author: Mert S.
reviews.description: I liked the ambience, coffee was good. Outdoors seating is great but the generator of the food truck next door was unbearably too loud to enjoy outside, we did not even bother trying. I did not care about the live music either, we were yelling at each other to get our word across the table. We ended up leaving 30 mins after the live music started. That was a Friday night.

reviews.author: Garrett N.
reviews.description: Love me some Red Horn coffee!   The atmosphere and service are both outstanding.  Any questions I had about coffee were answered, the help was super helpful.  Really appreciate the indoor and outdoor seating.  Really live the tables and decor, rustic hand built feel but comfortable.  Snack food is overpriced but everything else is top notch.

reviews.author: Milton C.
reviews.description: We chose Red Horn Coffee after perusing local coffee spots for some good coffee. Red Horn was very highly rated and the photos looked like they offered genuine espresso beverages. Red Horn offered a number of non-dairy options so I would not destroy my stomach on my pending road trip. We ordered Americans with a half inch of steamed oat milk. The coffee was very smooth. The espresso taste was still solid enough that I knew I was drinking espresso. I.e. Not watered down at all. All-in-all a great cup of coffee that hit the spot.

reviews.author: Vincent W.
reviews.description: Superb beer bat and coffee roastery in Cedar Park.  Convenient to HEB and Walmart.    Great service and great coffee!  We will return.

reviews.author: Jenny K.
reviews.description: I'll be back soon!! One of the best coffees I've had, so good I had two during my short stay here. It's hard to find decaf that isn't boring and the decaf here is strong and full of flavor! I even purchased a pound of decaf beans to take home.   I pulled up and my first thought was that the vibe was more brewery than coffee shop and I was right, but I was wrong that the coffee would just be an afterthought. When I went on a Saturday early afternoon, there was a taco truck and people hanging out in the beer garden. Lots of bicyclists and not sure if it's a popular rest stop or because there's a bike shop in the same parking lot or both or something else. Once you step inside there is a giant section of beer taps and beer menu, and a small coffee and pastry menu. They also sell ice cream here which was tempting but I stuck to my americano and later a vanilla latte.   The inside has plenty of socially distanced seating as does the outside and I lucked out with a parking spot right out front. There's a large lot of shared parking for the businesses.   I want to come back to check out their beers!!

reviews.author: Ann Marie M.
reviews.description: Best coffee house in town. Great coffee and they also have beer on tap. Very laid back atmosphere and nice people. No snotty hipsters. Cheese boards, sandwiches are good.

reviews.author: Mel B.
reviews.description: One of our favorite places to grab a few beer. They always excellent elections, we love the space and the people. So beer....good; but man their roasted coffee! We love using their Roadhouse in our French press.

reviews.author: Carrie J.
reviews.description: Sometime I struggle to decide if I want coffee or beer here, and at happy hour I am definitely know to order both! You will not be disappointed. An excellent coffee shop in the morning to meet with co-workers to do some brainstorming with excellent coffee or a wonder patio for a chill evening and great beer or wine. They have a great menu to pick from too, so you not stuck with just pretzels. I personally like the vegetable panini, and my husband like the cheese board.

reviews.author: Josh P.
reviews.description: Fantastic coffee house and brewery with inside and outside space located at parmer and 1431. You can get coffee, lattes, and cappuccino served anytime or also buy their beans to go.   They usually have 30+ taps of delicious craft beer which 10-15 being their beers with other guest beers also. They normally have cans to go and they will do growler fills as well. Its unusual to find a place that has both really good beer and great coffee but Red Horn is just that. There are a few slightly more secluded tables where I'll see people working remotely quite often. Most weekends you can find a local artist performing live music too.

reviews.author: Christina O.
reviews.description: I have been going to Red Horn for the past few years and don't know how I've forgotten to give them the credit they deserve! Not only is their coffee delicious they have a great variety of beers to choose from. They have recently expanded their outdoor seating which is covered so great for all hours of the day. Parking is sometimes limited but it speaks for its self on how many people love coming here. It's a great place to study, relax, and meet up with friends but get there before rush hour if you wanna snag a good seat inside. Clean environment and staff is very friendly! Also, great music

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Sat outside on their extended patio that goes onto the parking lot so tables can be socially distanced. Dog friendly and gave water bowls to the pups. Had a pretty solid number of beers on tap! Didn't have coffee but it smelt good. Salads, sandwiches, and snacks are available. We just had chips and salsa and it was decent. Restrooms were super clean! Huge win for me.   I'd come back for beers if I'm the area.

reviews.author: Cindy D.
reviews.description: We used to stop in here almost every weekend to have coffee before my granddaughters soccer game. And today we came in order to 2 hot cup of coffees and they were Luke warm cups. And unfavorable to say the least we have had better.

reviews.author: Preetesh V.
reviews.description: I love the chilled back vibe and the fact that it is so close to my neighborhood. We typically invite our friends to this place if we are looking for a venue closer to our home to hang out and catch up over few drinks. Their options for in house brews is fairly decent. They have decent size indoor seating available where in live music is performed from time to time. Additionally they have small outdoor seating area. During the pandemic, they stood up temporary outdoor tents to accommodate people who wish to seat outside. The food option is decent and limited to few comfort food options.

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: This is a great place to go for coffee - their nitro is great and it's a nice atmosphere with a lot of outdoor seating!

reviews.author: Mitsy V.
reviews.description: Since our move to the Round Rock area, we discovered a hidden treasure of Coffee and libations nestled behind a Brushy Creek corner-- Great Coffee but a fun vibe to stimulate mood beyond caffeine.

reviews.author: Laura L.
reviews.description: When we first moved here, the lady was super nice to my daughter. Weeks later, I walked in with our service tiny chihuahua dog (since there's a sign that says "we welcome service dogs" so I went in and ordered coffee and as soon as I began to wait for my coffee to be ready so I could take it to go there is this man that was very abrasive behind the counter and I miss felt like I was in the principals office and he said that dogs are not allowed in the facility.  He was very abrasive embarrassing and in my face. I personally think if you don't allow dogs at all then take the service sign dog off the window. It's a shame because that's very close place for us to get coffee but I don't want to have that feeling again.

reviews.author: Jason M.
reviews.description: This place puts every other beer store in ATX to shame. The variety of options here seems endless. The dude behind the counter knows more about beer than most sommeliers know about wine. That's just icing on the cake. They get every limited release and seasonal that drops. Prices can be a little steep but hella worth it.

reviews.author: Greg M.
reviews.description: Great place to try out a new beer then buy a six-pack or two. We had a couple beers each (they sell singles if you are hanging out) and then bought some to take home. Taco Truck pilsner was great, Mama Pisner, and there was a pickle beer that was probably a tad too pickley for me (go figure).  Great/fun selection, good prices, knowledgeable staff, and lots of picnic tables out to keep you spread out and safe. You can get snacks too, or play Starship Troopers pinball (Do You Want To Know More?!?). We had  a good time just chilling there on a Sunday afternoon.  Oh, and they recycle those plastic can holders that craft breweries use. Bring yours back to help out the brewers in town!

reviews.author: Josh P.
reviews.description: If you haven't been to The Brewtique in Cedar Park, you definitely should check it out.   Anytime you stop by, you'll meet either the owner or his wife and they are both nice and very helpful. You can pretty much buy anything they have in singles and they always have their inventory listed online along with the untapped rating for each beer, which I find very useful. They have a solid selection of local stuff and occasionally some more rare stuff as well. If you're immunocompromised, you can call your order in and they'll bring it to your car; they also have a very sanitary setup inside and require masks (of course) and make everyone use the hand sanitizer when you come in. We've been there about 5 times mixing that in with buying direct from breweries but I really love the diversity you can get while supporting local at the Brewtique

reviews.author: Philip J.
reviews.description: Really impressive beer bar and shop in Cedar Park. If you're a bit of a beer geek, head over here and you're sure to find some new stuff you haven't tried before. If you're more beer curious, head over and chat with these friendly folks. They know their stuff and helped me to pick out some new beers.  There's a good range of price points here too so you could find a good gift here.   Website is also really useful and lists out everything they have if you like to head in with some ideas of what to grab.   Good atmosphere in there too if you're drinking in.   Overall highly recommend and glad they are here.

reviews.author: Greg W.
reviews.description: Review time kids!! So the bride is out of town for business, what does any good husband do???? He meets some buds for suds!!   We all met at another place for happy hour when bud 1 recommend this place for some take home treats. I mean,come on, we know a beer-n-burger nut like me can't say no.  This place is totally chill with a few picnic tables to relax and converse with friends. There is also a couple of other chairs if that's your thing. Sampling on sight is totally cool too.  On to the selection of beers. All I can say is,if you can't find something here that you would like, go home,empty handed and admit you have no taste. That's right, I threw the blame squarely on you! Why? Because they must have better than 300-400 different beers to choose from!  Now go, prove me wrong and try that chocolate oatmeal stout or triple ipa !!

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: A craft beer lover's nirvana. Come here peruse their extensive inventory pick out a beer and enjoy either on site or grab a few brews to go. I could go on but that's it. Come here and drink good beer, but.  These guys got it goin (sic) on where else can you find a Maine Brewing Co beers or a selection of IPAs that will blow your mind.   Folks here are friendly and of course knowledgable and provide a high level of customer service. Case in point I was out of town and a pal informed me that they had a very hard to find beer available. These nice folks held my order until I arrived, almost at closing time.  Nice folks and righteous brews!

reviews.author: Meg K.
reviews.description: Such a cool spot. I don't live in Cedar Park but I'll be making regular trips here to check out the cool beverages!

reviews.author: Whitney B.
reviews.description: I really can't say enough good things about the Brewtique.  They have an amazing variety of drinks and they're always bringing in new items. The team is incredibly helpful, very knowledgeable about their products, and all around just a couple of really cool folks.  Just tell them what you're in the mood for, and you'll absolutely receive a satisfying recommendation.  They're dog-friendly both in and outside, and are super welcoming to well-behaved pooches. They also do some really cool charity events on behalf of some great organizations. There's almost always something going on in the evenings -- live music, comedy shows, football games, game night, beer tastings.  They also have some neat retro arcade games and board games on hand to entertain.  There's always a reason to pop in and have a drinks!

reviews.author: Dan S.
reviews.description: Great place. Owner always remembers you and knows what you like. They keep an amazing selection that is always changing. If you want to try some beers they have tables inside and outside. Personally love the selection of Texas beers and sours they have.

reviews.author: Catalina M.
reviews.description: Welcome to cedar park the brewtique! Had the absolute pleasure of coming here today. Great atmosphere, awesome beer selection and such a friendly welcoming owner.  The bottle shop that lived here prior (RIP) was great, but the new layout and even better beer selection really sets this place apart! Such a plethora of great beers and a cool little shop you can crack one open and enjoy it right there! Looking forward to my next visit!

reviews.author: Short Fuse S.
reviews.description: Just a fantastic place. I had a friend come in from San Antonio and he kept saying he wished there was a place like The Brewtique in his neighborhood. There's a great beer selection, and the owner is a really cool dude. Plus, they carry my favorite beer even though I'm the only one who buys it. That's dedication to customers!

reviews.author: Matthew M.
reviews.description: Need a beer? I mean a great beer? Do you want to enjoy it while killer music played? How about suggested by avid beer enthusiasts. Well, you're home. Enough said. This place hits all the check boxes. Fast WiFi for work, big tables for games. Endless beer.

reviews.author: Javier A.
reviews.description: What can I say about Brewtique that hasn't already been said? Great and various beers available here keep me coming back and back. Mgmt is top notch, friendly, and above all knowledgeable. I am always impressed with the ambiance. It feels like a great big community. Service with a smile and a laugh makes my trip there memorable. Also they have great events, live music, and  board games to boot! 3 cheers and a beer for Brewtique.

reviews.author: Jarod P.
reviews.description: Love this place. Great selection. Knowledgeable owners.  Fair prices.  If you remember this location when it was under previous owners, you'll find it's been nicely updated, more tables, chairs and such, even arcade games.  Keep up the good work Brewtique.

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: Cool little place, glad to see that the old bottle shop here was replaced by another. Owner(s?) seem to care a bunch, and have been available to point out new releases/limited beers, make recommendations, and take pics of my dog.   Prices slightly higher than other big retailers, but selection is much better (tip: check their Instagram for limited beers and new stock). Also, a good selection of CBD products for those interested. I have never hung around to drink there, but you can for a small per-beer charge if you want.   Hope this place keeps getting tasty limited beverages and doesn't turn into a vape emporium like the last one!

reviews.author: kenneth m.
reviews.description: The Brewtique has the best selection of fresh beer in the area. Prices are more than fare, and the staff tends to go above and beyond to answer questions.  Bathroom is always clean and stocked with soft and plush 2-ply charmin, they don't skimp on the good stuff! The owner was quite nice and helped me carry my order to my car, even sent me a nice wink and a smile while I was pulling out.

reviews.author: Luis P.
reviews.description: Craft Beer. Wine. Cider. A great neighborhood little store that always has something that the big stores don't carry. All you have to do is to ask, and they'll give a great recommendation. It's probably the thing you'll always want to do as they carry seemingly hundreds of brands of beer.   And it seems like they are trying to bring more cool events to the Cedar Park area like Comedy nights and Movie nights. Check it out and check out their vintage pinball machines!

reviews.author: Justin C.
reviews.description: If you haven't been here, please stop by. This place is absolutely wonderful. Every time I go in, always greeted and asked if I need anything. There is always something special for a random night of the week. The price to pop a top is great, individual cans or packs is really nice. Exactly what a bottle shop should be. Looking forward to the future of this place. Best of luck.

reviews.author: Marion W.
reviews.description: Absolutely amazing. Great selection of beers. Really fun to pick out singles and drink them there or take them home for later. They have a lot of fun events throughout the week like game night, comedy night, and brewer educational events. The passion is obvious with the owners, and they're super friendly to boot. They're building a great community in a cool location. We love coming here and are so thrilled to have such a cool place so close to home!!

reviews.author: Christy B.
reviews.description: I love this place!  The beer selection is amazing, and the owners are above and beyond welcoming!  Every time I walk through the front door to grab one of their new arrivals, Scott and Jana greet me like an old friend.  Also it has so much more to offer than just beer, everything from game night to comedy shows and little bit everything else in between.

reviews.author: Craig L.
reviews.description: Great beer, huge place with plenty of seating even when they are at their busiest.  I used to not be a fan of their pizza, but these days it's amazing!  Best brewery in the area by far, and we have some pretty good ones.

reviews.author: Victor D.
reviews.description: Cool spot with lot of choices ! I go here if I want to go with my boys and order my food -  You definitely need to plan ahead for TNF and MNF -/

reviews.author: Adam L.
reviews.description: How can I possibly express how awesome this place is.  The food is outstanding and the crew is such a wonderful family.  Every time we stop in we are welcomed like regulars even tho we are (currently) new.  The cannonball is dope!  The tap selection is on point.    Please don't go tho, it's already so popular I can't find a seat at the bar! :)  J/k. I wouldn't belong in the family if I didn't welcome y'all in to join too!

reviews.author: Heather D.
reviews.description: Phenomenal!   The pizza is crafted with fresh ingredients, made quick to order, and absolutely delicious! There is an excellent beer selection, and the staff is super friendly and very helpful. We had a couple of pizzas, garlic cheese bread, a side Caesar salad and 2 beers. Great atmosphere for all ages. Zero complaints. They know what they're doing. We will be back!

reviews.author: Doretta W.
reviews.description: Door is around the side towards the back. It is a very convenient walk from several hotels in the area.  If you want to eat... Walk in and turn left to place your order at the counter.  If you want to drink .. walk in and go straight to the bar.  They have salads, apps and several speciality pizzas ... sized from individual to family. You get soda from the fountain (cherry, cream, cola, etc) or beer from the tap (too many to cover here).   There are a few booths and tables but mainly it is community seating at 20' long tables. Kind of cool I think.  TVs everywhere ... watched baseball and ESPN. I bet this place is lit on Sat and Sun for football.  So the food? I really liked the beer mates .. garlic cheese bread. Good size and flavor for just $5. I had the pear honey pizza .. add blue cheese, basil and pancetta. I really liked the way the flavors all stuck out .. sweet, herby, salty ... love it!!

reviews.author: Josh E.
reviews.description: Queso very watery.  Definitely not a go to item for me the next time I'm in. I'll stick with the pretzel.

reviews.author: Cynthia V.
reviews.description: This is a good spot to come hang and catch a game on the TV while you enjoy some craft pizzas and beers. You order the food and beer separately, food from a walkup counter and beer from the bar in the middle of the restaurant. You get a buzzer puck when you order food so the servers can locate you and bring it to your table. We ordered the Beer Mates and Pizza Roll appetizers to start and two pizzas, the Oo La La and the Shroomin' Goat. Food timing was staggered and the only real hiccup was that the Beer Mates appetizer order seemed to have gotten lost because we had to ask for it after all the rest of our order had trickled out, and it then took about 15min more for it to finally arrive. But, when it did, it was piping hot and fresh, so that's good. Food quality was very good and we enjoyed everything we ordered.

reviews.author: Jonathon S.
reviews.description: I thought the name referred to the beers they serve and while that is probably the inspiration, I find it sad that it also refers to the amount of grease in their pizza (about a pint).  If you love pepperoni or sausage  grease then this is the place for you.   If you don't then don't get these meats on your pizza.  I hope the kitchen learns about skimming  fat off their more flavor proteins to prevent the crust from being a fatty sponge.  Happy Sunday everyone.

reviews.author: Andrew I.
reviews.description: Great food. Friendly staff. Excellent beer.  What more could you want?    For pizza, they have all the traditional toppings, sauce, and cheese along with many others  For beer, it's fresh and crisp.

reviews.author: Fernando B.
reviews.description: I had high expectations for this place.  Have tasted their beer before and they are great! First time going to the location. We started with queso and chips which was good. We had the works pizza. Good amount of topping on the pizza. The sauce was nice and thick but had too much oregano, too much of a string flavor. The dough is to soft, needs to have more chew to it. Overall good but not my first choice for pizza.

reviews.author: Lauren T.
reviews.description: Cool pizza and beer spot (they also have wine too).   Very urban vibes and very popular.  You order your food and drinks at the window and then it is brought to your table. The pizzas are unique and HUGE!   The armadillo was our favorite - sausage and goat cheese?! Yes please!

reviews.author: Natalie R.
reviews.description: Delicious pizza and they have great vegetarian options. The parking is not ideal, hence 4 stars, and why we don't go here as often as we'd like. The side salads are good too. Nice homey atmosphere.

reviews.author: Kristen H.
reviews.description: One of our favorite sources of both beer and pizza in the whole city. Excellent topping combinations, tasty crust with just the right balance of chewiness and tenderness. And the beer is incredible- I hated IPAs until I tried Electric Jellyfish!

reviews.author: Shereka J.
reviews.description: Usually place a curbside order. Process to Order online and pick-up is do easy. Food is always good and never had an issue with my order.

reviews.author: Bryant P.
reviews.description: Vegans - DON'T COME HERE. Their vegan options are trash.  Here's a build-your-own vegan pizza that cost us $25, before tax and tip. It's a sad little thing that deserves a happy home. Not in my belly though...I could've gotten something better and cheaper from the frozen section of H-E-B.  Would've been one star but I know they don't cater to vegans. Still, I'm not sure you can call yourself vegan-friendly if your vegan pizza looks like a Lunchables.  At least their beer is good!

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: Bringing them up two stars from the Father's Day fiasco.   Service today was spot on and very timely. So why 3 Stars? I got the monthly special, The Fuzz. It supposed to be brisket, chopped jalapeños, pickled onions, and a chipotle sauce. Honestly, it was like pizza dough with pickled onions. I had trouble finding and tasting the brisket as it was non existent. The chopped jalapeños were hard to find and taste as well. There were plenty of pickled onions. To sum it up, this pizza sucked !!! I should've stuck to my favorite the Banh Mi with extra sausage and extra jalapeños. Lesson learned and money lost, such is life.

reviews.author: Gregg M.
reviews.description: Haven't been back to Pinthouse since Covid and since we loved the food we wanted to go back.  Glad they were busy but I have to say, while the pizzas and salads are absolutely great, the service seemed off. I know this is mostly a serve yourself model but it felt awkward standing with my family trying to see if anyone would help us find a seat. We stood there quite a while and once in a while a server would walk past us, look at us and keep walking. It would have been nice for one of them to smile and say 'sit anywhere' or something helpful. I knew I'd have to stand in line to order, then go back for refills, and finally to close out my tab. I guess the two things that chapped me most after  the seating thing was first, when we asked the server who brought our pizza for 1 more plate and fork and she said 'sure,' then never came back and second, I was presented the option to pay a tip from 15-25% when I closed out my tab. Now I almost always over tip because I'm in hospitality and try to support exceptional service. I did tip but felt it wasn't really deserved, sadly.  Outside the service issues, we will likely try it again as I know finding enough good employees is very tough now and we LOVE any restaurant that is part of the Jack Allen family because the food is SOOOOO good.  I hope owners will work on the service and keep the high quality of the food and beer.  Cheers

reviews.author: Manasa D.
reviews.description: Update.   Reviewer is now a regular at  Pinthouse round Rock and has some very biased opinions. Read with caution.   I believe that the round rock location is definitely the best of the Pinthouses. Their beer selection is quite diverse, the food is just hands down amazing and there are also options such as cider, wine, hard kombucha (thanks hipsters) for non beer drinkers.   I'm struggling to think of one bad thing to say and just to say  something- it's the crowds on Friday and Saturday evenings.   I'm chuffed that this branch has gone from strength to strength; and I hope it continues to do so. As long as they're open, my Family and I shall keep visiting !!

reviews.author: Kimberly S.
reviews.description: Pinthouse Pizza was recommended by a bartender at another local brewery when we asked for suggestions for other places to visit while vacationing in the area. We stopped in at the Round Rock location and figured out the ordering process - order at the counter or at the bar, get a beeper, and your food is delivered to your table. If you have questions about the beer, I suggest you order at the bar. We ordered our food at the counter, but when I asked a beer question, I was referred to the bar. The bartender was very helpful. I ordered a flight and she offered some feedback on one of my choices. There was a combination of booth, bar, and common tables. We chose the common table to have the best view of the Red Sox/Yankees playoff game. Go Sox! The queso and salad came out first. The queso was good; the Italian salad was amazing. The individual salad was enough to share. The Shroomin' Pizza was very good too; I thought the crust was phenomenal and enjoyed dipping the end pieces in leftover salad dressing. The last thing I'd like to mention is how environmentally friendly this place is; paper products are compostable, pizza plates and utensils are metal. There's very little waste here! I would definitely recommend Pinthouse Pizza!

reviews.author: Trenton V.
reviews.description: Friendly staff, large enough to reasonably accommodate you at any time, even Friday nights without too crazy of a wait, reasonable prices, high quality delicious pizza with a red sauce that makes my mouth water just thinking about it. Excellent place, highly recommended.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: We came during peak time on a Saturday evening. This means we are seeing them at their most challenged time. And I was a little "hangey" having to wait a half hour to be seated. But it was worth it. The waiter checked back with us every few minutes (mandatory for a good restaurant). And our order was delivered hot and fresh in a reasonable amount of time (a little slow because they were very busy - but in a reasonable amount of time).  We had chips and queso as an appetizer. The chips were the thick, homemade type. And the queso was their own recipe with ancho cili drizzle, crema, some sort of pico de gallo, etc. Really good - exceptional.  I had a chicken sandwich. It had a lot going on (in a good way). It was not just a run of the mill chicken sandwich. And the sidewinder fries are fresh and homemade.   My wife had the watermelon, which she also said was really good.  Overall, some creative foods that were well executed, and on point service  Definitely give this place a try.

reviews.author: Leena N.
reviews.description: I didn't love this place. I totally understand that with COVID, many restaurants have had to cut back their menus.   With that being said, it seemed like breakfast-y food definitely prevailed during our Sunday afternoon visit. Seeing that they do a Sunday brunch, I get it, but always pictured that included a few other options not focused around eggs or waffles.   My husband ended up ordering their burger (which isn't even obviously advertised as a burger), and said it wasn't anything to write home about. My mother-in-law had their chicken sandwich and seemed to be okay with it. Not much fanfare from my husband's stepfather or his girls.  I ended up ordering the chili and didn't have any major complaints. I would've loved to see more in the "siesta" part of the menu that wasn't a salad.   My other complaint was the noise. The music was so loud that we could barely hear each other across the table, which pretty much awkwardly split our party in half. At first, we tried to get past it by borderline yelling, but that got old.   In between waiting for condiments, I asked our waitress if there was any way to knock the volume down by a click or two. She mentioned that she would see what she could do, but that it wasn't guaranteed since "people pay for it". My brother in law ended up seeing the jukebox in the corner, and while that's fantastic, I don't think it's too much to ask to keep music at a reasonable level in a place where you'd expect your guests to socialize at their table.

reviews.author: Meagan H.
reviews.description: My family and I ate here on Friday. The food was good. I had the special which was a fish. My husband had a shrimp po boy. The kids had chicken strips and mac n cheese. The beers were good and cold. I love how they bring the beer in icy glasses.   We chose to sit outside but soon discovered the flies were way too many to be able to eat in peace. We couldn't stop waving our hands or the flies would land on the food. I'll go back, but sit inside next time.

reviews.author: Tara M.
reviews.description: The atmosphere here is great. Everything seemed good at the start. Then we went to order food. Out of steak. Out of salmon. Out of wings. Out of shrimp. Out of some Cabernets. They were out of everything we went to order. The server could not have been more kind and sweet. She said it was because they run out of a lot of things on Saturday nights so Sundays they're just out. Well, I did a quick review of the comments on this restaurant and this is apparently a running theme. 1. Shame on me for not checking the comments before we came, 2. Shame on them for not resolving this clearly on-going issue. I know times are tough, but just close on Sunday nights if you cannot have more product delivered. We finished our drinks and left without ordering dinner at all.

reviews.author: Kate R.
reviews.description: Great food, great service, great atmosphere, love this place! Been here many times and have never once been disappointed. Great outdoor and indoor seating. Love sitting at the bar!  One recommendation only: maybe put chive tv or something else on just one (of 7'ish) tv instead of just sports

reviews.author: Jeff B.
reviews.description: Sorry this is a little late but I wanted to give a review. I stopped by here a couple weeks ago for dinner. The place was full, but they squeezed me in at the bar. I asked for a menu and a beer. The bar tender let me sample one of the beers on tap. I liked it so I ordered one to drink. I also ordered a patty melt with tater tots. The burger was think and made to order. I had to cut the burger because I did not want a big mess from trying to get a bite into my mouth. The burger was juicy since I ordered it medium and very tasty. I can say it filled me up. The beer was cold, nothing better than a cold beer, well almost nothing.  The atmosphere was as most sports bars are, a little noisy but people seems to know each other and they were friendly. The bartenders were busy but kept getting those drinks. The servers were also busy taking food and refilling cups of the patrons. There is outdoor seating but it was one of those HOT Days so I was glad I was inside. The parking is decent but they share with several other businesses. It was not too far away from the entrance so no need to wear the sneakers unless you want to.  Thank you Republic Kitchen + Bar for being a good neighbor and giving us another option to dine in Leander, Texas.

reviews.author: Polina W.
reviews.description: It was easy to grab a spot indoors. I had the salmon dish- it was spicy and salty for my tastebuds. I must not have read the description very well.  The Kids corn dog was tasty. The chicken steak dish was devoured, as was the watermelon salad.  All in all it was a good afternoon lunch.

reviews.author: Sasha R.
reviews.description: Decided to try a new place tonight, and glad we did! I had the patty melt, it was good. The only complaint I have about it is that they put the bread on the grill to get grill marks, but all I tasted was burnt toast. They do the top if the burger bun the same but it's not as grill marked. So next time I will ask for them not to do that, I hate black charred burnt toast. My husbands burger was good as well and both the tots and fries were tasty and perfect portion. They have a big bar with a good variety. I had a Hell or High Water to drink, and will definitely order that again. Delish! And last but def not least the service was great! Our server Kelsey was attentive and very sweet. Definitely looking forward to the next visit...word is they have a good weekend brunch, so we'll be checking that out.

reviews.author: Ashley R.
reviews.description: The chicken fried steak needs seasoning. It was missing some salt and the sauce over it was so much it took off the breading. But the mash and veggies had great flavor and tasted good!  Texas Smash is good if you like a honey whiskey, I don't.  But the old fashion was just how I like it!  Overall good place to try, the service was good. They have tvs on but I'd recommend that they put subtitles on all of them so since we can't hear them we can at least read and know what is going on.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: Great food. Great drinks. What more do you need? I absolutely love the barnyard fowl chicken sandwich. It's seriously delicious. All of the drinks I've tried are solid and they have a great beer and wine selection. Republic is a great option for anyone in the Leander area looking for a nice, trendy restaurant without driving all the way in to Austin. They also have a solid kids menu. We'll definitely be back.

reviews.author: Lora O.
reviews.description: First time here. Ethan, our server, was excellent. He did the best he could with working with so many items out of stock. I mean you're  out of Jack Daniels? And steak? And Salmon? Yikes! We had chicken fried steak and the chicken sandwich. Both very good! Pictured is a yummy dessert! A brownie on top of graham cracker crumbs topped with a toasted marshmallow. Along side comes vanilla ice cream drizzled with caramel and dark chocolate with a drizzle of raspberry coulis and fresh raspberries.  We will try you again.

reviews.author: Andrew S.
reviews.description: First time visiting. The drinks and location drew us in. The 3 okra dish ( it's Okra prepared 3 ways) was an instant hit. This was a quick first review and I want to come back for a meal. The Drinks are interesting and a good mix.  Pro tip - parking can get challenging in the evening. This strip mall has a lot of customers, early helps or enjoy the walk :-)

reviews.author: Elaziel R.
reviews.description: Hiding gem in the area, the food is surprisingly really good. They have very unique combinations for most of their meals like spicy ranch and the ambience is great. I will say the staff needs a little bit more guidance because they always look lost or confused about their duties. Beside that it's a great small bar with food options for everyone!

reviews.author: T N.
reviews.description: Came here for the first time and was ecstatic about visit. Ordered a salad and asked for ranch. Said salad arrived drenched in something I thought was ranch. Tasted said salad and immediately my mouth was on fire. Asked waitress to verify if it was ranch and she says... "oh we don't have regular ranch, just a spicy one..." that would've been nice to know. I CANT EAT SPICY FOOD!! She proceeded to suggest I use another dressing to bring down the heat. Word of advice to owner... put the dressing on the side. I was sick all day from this incident.   Partner got French toast and it was amazing. Sadly we won't be back..

reviews.author: Carrie Q.
reviews.description: This was our first time here and we will definitely be back. The queso was delicious and unique, the entrees were very good, and the wine on tap was great! I had the special (shrimp linguine in a pesto sauce) and my husband had the chicken sandwich. Everything seemed scratch made, which we really appreciated!

reviews.author: Donna C.
reviews.description: This was one of the worst experiences we've had in a restaurant in a long time.  The server was rude, the manager condescending (strangely, I don't remember him being so rude at Texican) and the place was dirty.  The table was sticky, and they knew it, even said there was nothing they could do about it because it was "resin"...it wasn't.  We ordered four entrees, and they came out in stages. The first ones to hit the table were cold.  The third followed five minutes later, and mine didn't show up for another five minutes, at which time I told them to just keep it.  The "hash" was runny and not at all hash, the scrambled eggs cold, bacon underdone, and no condiments available; when we asked for them, they acted like it was an imposition.    $92 worth of bad food and crap service.  Very disappointing considering the executive chef was wearing a Fox Hole chef's coat, and Fox Hole is one of my favorite places in this area; I assumed from the get it would be extraordinary after seeing that...I guess not.  Oh, and word of caution, when the server handed my fiancé the mobile payment device, she selected the 20% tip option.  Make sure you watch out for that...there is no signage indicating there is an automatic gratuity so the servers have NO business choosing their own tip amount.  Update: while we were out of town, we discovered my fiancé's debit card had been hacked.  Oddly, the odd charges started AFTER using the mobile payment device, which was WiFi powered.  I cannot stress this enough...BEWARE!

reviews.author: Lisa M.
reviews.description: I finally tried this place and so glad I did! Went with some girlfriends for some much needed quality girl time. This was the perfect place to sit back, chill and enjoy great food and company. I really like the ambience of this restaurant. It boasts a laid back feel with the dim lighting, yet has an open atmosphere. I ordered the Grilled Atlantic Salmon and everything was cooked to perfection. The salmon was cooked on the medium side to my liking and request to the server. We also ordered the James Bowie Nachos. Keep in mind these are not the typical Tex-Mex nachos, but they were still delicious and flavorful with a hint of robust BBQ flavor. There is an option to add chicken or steak and we opted for the chicken...great choice! If you love spicy (I sure do), they have a kick to them, as they are topped with freshly sliced jalapenos. Our server was excellent! She was so friendly, accommodating and checked on us frequently. She alone deserves a 5-star recognition! Try this place that offers locally-sourced, high quality food with its own, unique flavor.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: The Republic Kitchen + Bar is a great place in Leander off Parmer/Ronald Reagan. It has been around for about a year and I'm mad that this was my first trip. I guess that means I'll have to make up for lost time. We got the Brussel Sprouts as an appetizer. There was a sweetness to it with the apples and honey and candied pecans. So good! For dinner, I got the Pan-Seared Chicken and had to say yes to that when I saw that the chicken was on top of risotto, my favorite. The chicken was a small piece but very flavorful. I got the tots and also some chili which was spicy! Thanks The Republic, great place. I gotta get one of your large cocktails next time too.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Oh mannnn I thought I took a picture of my drink! Darn it. Get the Pineapple Express! It was taco Tuesday, the shrimp taco was fabulous.
