They were out of fried salmon (odd bc they had the other way?) or I would have gotten that since you can basically get a shrimp taco anywhere. I'll definitely be back for taco Tuesday again. It was a little cold, I like my food room temperature so it was perfect for me, but I could see someone being disappointed in the temperature of the food. But I'm not knocking off any stars for that since that's how I like my food.

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Came here for dinner on Tuesday night 6/15/21 with some family. I ordered the El Cesar Chavez salad with salmon and when they food came out the first bite I took I was fishing a bone out of my mouth from the salmon. So I started to inspect the rest of the fish and found 3 more bones. I informed our waitress and she kindly had it re made but when the second salmon came out I once again found 2 more fish bones inside.   At this point I did not receive an apology nor did a manager come by to check in to if everything was okay so I asked to speak to one and inform him. The gentlemen came over and apologized but really did not seem genuine about it after I explained how dangerous it was that I found a total of 6 fish bones that I could have choked on. He also attempted to blame the chef for not cleaning it right and saying "I always tell him to make sure all the bones are out."   Coming from the restaurant business myself and having my husband be on the corporate side of a big restaurant chain - I was very disappointed in how this place dealt with the issue.   Please check your seafood at this place - they clearly are not ordering boneless seafood or properly cleaning they're fish.

reviews.author: Jennifer B.
reviews.description: I come here for takeaway every 1-2 months. Am stuck on their burger and pretzels with beer cheese, and have never regretted my choice. Food is always hot and fresh, ready when I am and made to order. Wish they would include more beer cheese, but that's just cause I like it so much! Would love to come in for a pint and check out more of the menu and plan to do that soon. Staff are friendly and helpful. Overall a place I will frequent as much as possible when I'm in the mood for a good burger.

reviews.author: Conrad C.
reviews.description: 10/10 white claws. I highly recommend the Mango,  be sure to ask for the reserved ones in the back.

reviews.author: Craig L.
reviews.description: Fantastic beer selection, friendly staff, and welcoming atmosphere.  Food is fantastic, too.

reviews.author: Samuel T.
reviews.description: Was there about 9 pm last night. My companion wanted a really good burger and Yelp gave us this place.   We were the only patrons eating at tables. There were a few guys at the bar. Since I wasn't really hungry, we decided to order their signature burger which is made with ground brisket and ground meat from short ribs. I asked for it to not be overcooked. We talked about the cooking temperature with the waitress and she assured us it would be cooked medium. When it came out it was more like well-done. Pretty dry meat and not all that tasty. The bun seemed like it was homemade and was good, as were all the veggies they put on it. Fries were nothing special.   We will be back and I will try their fish and chips.   Service was good and the prices for what we had were consistent with 2021 inflation prices. I am sure this would be the place to be when a soccer game was on.   Music playing on their sound system was very good too.

reviews.author: Nate T.
reviews.description: Fish and chips is enormous and delicious, best I've had in years. Properly poured Guinness is always a treat. I'll be back as soon as I can.   Also, who gets a margarita at a British pub? Any review mentioning margaritas should be deleted.

reviews.author: Jack K.
reviews.description: I just took a trip across "the pond" for my first visit here. Not really across the pond but 15 minutes away. This definitely brought me back to my Navy days of Portsmouth and London Pub style fish and chips! Perfectly battered and fried with that nice light crunch when you bite into it. The buffalo cauliflower bites was a first time try for me also. All vegetables need too be made this way. Not too spicy but just right.  This was a takeout order and everything was still hot and crispy when I got home. Perfect spot for any occasion.

reviews.author: Jeremy A.
reviews.description: Great pub with great food.   Been here 6 times so far.   Just super loud inside.   Very hard to hear each other while dining.    Great beer selection and good cocktails too.   Can't beat the fish and chips and their burger

reviews.author: Jessica A.
reviews.description: The fish and chips were really good.  I have only been once but it was tasty.  The wall art is cool too.  Go and try it.

reviews.author: Taylor A.
reviews.description: As a Brit in Austin, after moving here and finally settling in, naturally the next step was the go on a hunt for good British grub in search of a slice of home. I came across the Fort Kenney Pub in Yelp and knew that the following Saturday would start with a fry up!  When we walked in, the staff were all super friendly and welcoming. It wasn't busy as it was still early but there was plenty of seating and the football could be seen from most of them.  The food was great and everything I had hoped for! I subbed black pudding for an extra sausage which our server was more than happy to do. The sausages were really delicious!  Really enjoyed spending my Saturday morning here eating a yummy breakfast. I would love to come back to try some of the other meals on the menu!

reviews.author: Adam L.
reviews.description: A word to the wise, the Sunday dinner is insane for a mere mortal.  My wife was definitely a victim of eyes bigger than tummy!  I got a burger that was actually pretty remarkable, tho I couldn't enjoy the pretzel bun thanks to this stupid diet!    The bathrooms are clean and the entire facility is well kept.    The staff was outstanding and everyone was super.on the ball.

reviews.author: Edward R.
reviews.description: This place is fantastic. The food has been consistently great. I really like how they added the small version of the fish and chips for those with smaller stomachs. The drink and beer selection is great. And their staff has been efficient, helpful and friendly.  Great place to watch sports and hang out in the back for a more quiet drink and meal. The outdoor patio is super cozy.

reviews.author: Eva Maria T.
reviews.description: Cool neighborhood British pub with proper fish and chips. Come with an appetite because the large was the size of my forearm. Loved the tarter sauce and Indian curry style sauce which accompanied the fish. The Mr. had the cheeseburger on a pretzel bun with British style bacon. Happy hour drink prices are $2.00 off. Very friendly and attentive service. We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: The food is fantastic! We've been to the UK several times and this is authentic to what we get there.  The restaurant itself is a bit warehouse ish. I feel like they could have done better to give it a pub feel. It feels nothing like a pub which was disappointing.  I'm docking one star for the Pimm's Cup. It's made with that awful soda machine Minute Laud Lemonade. It was horrendous! That was all I could taste. Simple syrup and Minute Made Lemonade.  I also docked a star for the music. It was SO LOUD. My husband and I couldn't talk. Literally. Couldn't hear each other. We were starting to question whether we're hitting an age where we say things like "the music is too loud", but no. No no no. This was freaking ridiculous! They had a lady there playing it for an hour before she started what I think was a quiz or game. Music should add ambiance. This felt like we were sitting front row at a concert. It was insanity. To the point I'm totally okay removing a star because of it.  We'll probably go back for the food, but if we're in the mood for a cocktail, or conversation, it won't be high on our list.

reviews.author: Garrett D.
reviews.description: We've ordered from here a few times and quality of food and service is usually good. Today we got the burger, side salad, and chicken tika. Burger didn't come on pretzel bun like usual and meat was basically raw. Side salad was a generous portion but the cucumbers were moldy. Chicken Tika was awful. Looked like freezer bag pre cooked and seasoned chicken, dry and tasteless without the sauce. Rice was soggy mushy, clearly too much water in rice cooker when it was made. Bread that came with the tika had a yellow gel slime. Going to get people sick or worse serving up food like that.. When I called to let them know about the bad produce two different people took attitude with me about it, poor customer service. As someone that works in the food service industry I'm disappointed. Will not return or recommend to anyone.

reviews.author: Alex H.
reviews.description: Came here tonight for the first time, to meet friends, and it was so good. Service with a smile, great appetizers of the pretzel with beer cheese, and buffalo cauliflower bites. The fish and chips is so freaking good. Fried to perfection and so light. While it's not close to me, I'll definitely make my way out again.

reviews.author: Natalie K.
reviews.description: Today, on this lazy, rainy, gloomy, post-#AustinBlizzard2021 Sunday, Hubs and I were on the hunt for some true comfort food! Thus, we knew that crossing the proverbial pond was a must! This is how we found ourselves at Kenney Fort Pub. Can I just say, y'all, that what we had here was just what we needed? This is true English pub food, and it warmed the very cockles of our very recently frigid hearts!   Hubby went with the English Breakfast! As he was wolfing it down, he looked up at me with an actual sparkle in his eyes, and he said, "Do you know what this reminds me of most recently, honey?", and I said, "Yep!"! I knew right away that he was referring to that Irish Breakfast that he got at the military part of the airport in Shannon, Ireland, on the way to his too long deployment in Afghanistan in 2018! The picture that he sent me on WhatsApp of that breakfast in that airport is burned in my memory forever!   I went with the Sunday Roast, and it was bloody fantastic, as well! The picture tells the whole story! So good! Chris ate 3/4ths of it, which is our usual division of restaurant food, but I just loved everything about it! The horseradish sauce was MAGIC! I could bathe in it!   We ended with the Sticky Toffee Pudding, and damn, y'all! Just damn!  Bottom line: if you've never tasted either of these traditional plates across the pond, but you're the sort that likes little tastes of many things, both of these dishes will be RIGHT up your alley!   And, even if you're not down for little tastes of many things, you'll absolutely wax poetic about that pudding!   What a fantastic find!   p.s. Our server was Noah, and he was a gem!

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: A solid 4 star experience!  I loved the fish (the chips were ok!). The burger was smokey and the meat was fresh. The fries that came with the burger were tasty. Everything was well seasoned. The kids fish and chips was great and my 5 year old ate it up.   I did not like the tikka masala. It was not creamy and felt heavy on the cumin. It was a smaller portion and not very much sauce. This was the only dish I didn't care for.     Also, when you pack up a to go order, please package the naan separate from thee sauce. It was packed together and the naan was all covered in the sauce that I didn't like so I didn't eat that either.    They need clearer instructions on what their pickup curbside process is. It was a little confusing but we just called and the man who answered brought our food out.  Maybe we were supposed to go get it inside?  I don't know.    I'm glad Kenney Fort Pub is in our neighborhood. I am sure  that we will be ordering curbside from them frequently.

reviews.author: Netta K.
reviews.description: I had really high hopes but I left disappointed.  I have had British food in a many locations and this left me wanting.  I feel they either put an Texas flare or their own take on what British food taste like.    The burger was good, you  can't really mess up a burger.. well, maybe. The banger and mash, yall.... no. It tasted like a warmed up Slim Jim, the mashed potatoes had an odd flavor that none of could place. Maybe the mustard?  The staff was very helpful but it kinda sucked I couldn't even get a paper menu, my QR reader wasn't working on my phone.   I'll give it another try but will definitely not get B and M again!

reviews.author: Nancy P.
reviews.description: Can't believe I haven't written a review here yet.  I went out of my way to get here. Was so looking forward to eating real British food.   I was going to be out this way during my first vaccine shot at Dell Diamond.  It was around lunch that I arrived here.  Waited a short time until they opened. Yes, I was the first one there.  First stop was to the loo.  Yes, it was labeled Loo. Started off with an order of iced tea.  Sorry, Brits no hot tea on a hot day. I asked the server if I could possible try the Black pudding they serve with breakfast. Turns out the server was one of the owner. So I got a slice. Ordered up a Scottish Egg and a plate of Bangers and mash.  I have had Scottish eggs before. These were a bit different because they used British sausage.   British sausage is very much leaner than US sausage.  The sausage meat surrounding the soft boiled egg was denser.  And it was served with picalilli (British salsa).  Loved these starters. Next up the bangers and mash and a slice of black pudding. Had to try the black pudding first.  Trust me it is not a pudding but a blood, oatmeal, pork fat, spices sausage. Before you turn your nose up, try it. A little nibble and interesting flavor. Bigger bite and it was good, before I knew it I finished it off and wish I had more. The banger was a Cumberland made sausage.  Lean pork shoulder meat makes it different than US sausages. Once you get over the difference, It is really good. But the mash potatoes, oh wow. They add mustard and cheddar cheese to theirs. Next batch of mash, I plan on adding mustard to mine. Now if that isn't enough, Red Onion gravy.  Take a slice of sausage, dip into the mash and make sure you have the gravy on it.... Prefect bite. I keep thinking the next time I go, I will get the fish and chips. But as I am writing this, all I can think about is the Bangers and Mash.

reviews.author: Jeff U.
reviews.description: We came back   Juju had KF Burger    Dang good burger   I tasted it and it was good   Pyper had pizza     Bland  Uncle Joe had fish and chips-his looked better than what I had first time. He likes it   Molly had kids fish    Not too bad   Shared the loaded chips for appetizer  nothing to write home about   Margaritas tasted  weird     Can't put my finger on it   Still marginal..... but I came back, I told you I would  Expensive

reviews.author: Mariana B.
reviews.description: We came for breakfast. It's a nice and spacious place. They brew coffee and beer. We ordered breakfast tacos, chilaquiles, bowl and croissant. Tacos is good, chilaquiles are very spice, croissant is good and bowl is ok. The latter and the hot chocolate came cold. The coffee was hot is good.

reviews.author: Brian T.
reviews.description: Okay this is my favorite coffee shop in the Austin area period.  I love how big and spacious this new location is, but the coffee is WHERE IT'S AT.  Definitely come here if you're looking for the perfect date spot, study/get work done, or just to enjoy a nice morning coffee and breakfast.  We ordered a hand pour over, a Chemex, and a double espresso.  The double espresso came out first and this one definitely packed a punch - don't let the espresso size cup fool you.  If I was just here for the caffeine content, this one definitely would've done the job alone.   The hand pour over came out next and the presentation was super impressive!  They bring you the entire carafe with the dripper on top, so it's definitely a lot.  Considering this is only $4, you definitely get your money's worth!  This one was so flavorful and the fruity notes definitely stood out while drinking it.  Now the Chemex...just wow.  For $5, they bring the entire Chemex setup to your table and you pour our of it as you drink.  The fact that they trust their patrons with the Chemex really speaks volumes about how much they care about the presentation piece!  Looks aside, this coffee (I believe we got Ethiopian) tasted amazing and on-par with the pour over.  Don't let me forget the breakfast tacos.  This was such a treat.  I got the Migas breakfast taco and this one was stuffed FULL with eggs, tortilla strips, and pico.  It was delicious and filling and for $3, this one definitely hit the spot alongside the coffee.  I also bought one of their coffee beer stouts to take home...I believe it was the House United coffee milk stout.  If taking home, you either order beer in a Crowler (two pint cans) or a Growler (64 oz).  I can't wait to try their coffee IN THEIR BEER.  But most of all, can't wait to come back here every time I'm in the area!

reviews.author: Thao E.
reviews.description: OH ! High anticipated location! I've been waiting for this location to open since they announced it on their Instagram.   They are having soft openings right now. The space is airy, has high ceilings, and gorgeous.   Being the soft opening, it looks like they are training some new people but they are nice as can be!  They also have Tacomaye on site now for your taco needs. I can't wait to make this my new work spot!  Support your local businesses!

reviews.author: Ru L.
reviews.description: The only thing this location doesn't have from the original is the coffee roaster. Other than that the beer is fresh, the coffee is hot, and the food is good. Tacos came fully filled with protein and veggies with two sides of salsa, one green, one red. Two thumbs up.

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: This new location is the bomb! Prime selection of craft beer, coffee, tea, fountain sodas too. Plenty of seating, GREAT service, and super delicious food menu -- our favorite so far are the  carne asada loaded nachos -- a must try! Perfect for sharing . The place is really open and bright. Big screen TVs with sports playing. Family friendly. We love coming here for game night, dinner and cold beers.

reviews.author: Shannon A.
reviews.description: They care about their people because they had no kitchen on Independence Day.  The beer flight is great if your fickle or just want to try all the offing's.  It's not on the menu, but it's great.  Also had a London Fog that was absolutely delightful.  Looking forward to coming back for the soft shell crab!

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Nice location. Very clean and inviting. Knowledgeable and friendly  staff. Not a beer guy but the coffees and teas are solid.  It's not on the menu board, but they DO offer beer flights.

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: Been to this location several times, for both the coffee and the beer. Both are really good. Breakfast tacos are good. The soft shell crab sandwich was also good. The space is great for either socializing with friends or getting a little work done. Staff is friendly. Yeah, this is goi g to be a regular spot for me.

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: Coffee review only. I've tried both locations multiple times hoping each time was a one-off. The coffee here is not good. Like really not good. Service has always been fine. Just really bad coffee.

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: Food is average at best and the same cashier always gives me an attitude when I order for whatever reason.

reviews.author: Christy M.
reviews.description: This location is great! Nice open space and a good selection of beer. Haven't tried the food yet, but the coffee is also good.

reviews.author: Eric F.
reviews.description: Great decaf coffee and tacos were awesome but be warned the bacon is thicker than normal but still good.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: This is another place when we come down for a visit we always stop at! The coffee, beer, and food are fantastic! Then there is even dessert coffee.

reviews.author: Teresa M.
reviews.description: 2 stars for the new location - the beer is just as good as the original location and the food isn't bad, but there is zero character and no covered seating  This is Austin - people have dogs. I'm totally ok with sitting outside with my dog since you have a kitchen but man at least buy an awning or umbrellas or something. 4 random picnic tables thrown outside with no shade is an afterthought.

reviews.author: Dan S.
reviews.description: Great coffee and amazing area to meet with friends or network on Wednesday mornings.  Stop in and support local.

reviews.author: Laura N.
reviews.description: I love the new location, closer to my home. The food and drink selection is superb. Service was fast and friendly. It's a big open room - simple but nice. The outside could probably be served better with some decor/ awnings or umbrellas. It's a good vibe inside and I'll be coming back!

reviews.author: Amber W.
reviews.description: Spacious, clean, industrial decor. Friendly service. Delicious coffee and breakfast tacos. The only thing I don't like is that they don't have comfortable seating. It's mostly wood picnic tables. There's one table that has chairs with backs and there are a few counter height chairs with backs. I love to hang out and linger at a coffee shop. This has the space, but it's just not comfortable. Adding  some cozy areas would make this place off the charts amazing.

reviews.author: Bri L.
reviews.description: Great brews, solid grinds and good people! The perfect local spot. Would highly recommend!

reviews.author: Julia G.
reviews.description: This is such a cool place! I planned an outing in Cedar Park with a group of my girlfriends. After our outing at the Ecuadorian chocolate factory, we needed a place that could accommodate a fairly large group of friends during lunch time on a Friday (a task that seemed.... yikes). I am very thankful I stumbled across The Good Lot on Yelp! I reached out to make sure The Good Lot could accommodate us, and they said "Of Course" and let me know that all of the trucks would be out on Friday.    When we arrived, we were pleasantly surprised to find several open food trucks and a large building (see, beer bar). People had their dogs outside and everyone seemed to be having a good time.   Between all of us, we tried every food truck. I personally got Four Brothers Venezuelan Kitchen. I am a sucker for good Venezuelan food. I got a Pulled pork Bowl with extra garlic sauce, black beans, avocado, sweet plantains, and all the fixings. I would definitely eat here again. I tried a few samples from other food trucks as well.   Everyone left super happy. This is a great place to go if you have a casual group looking for a quick bite and place to hang out.    The next day (Saturday), I swung by the dog park across the street and stopped by again for lunch on my way home. They have trivia nights, live music over the weekends, and happy hour all day on Monday. Please build another location close to Fort Hood. A copy and paste of exactly what you already created would be great. ;). I promise to stop by weekly.

reviews.author: Ted C.
reviews.description: I made the drive up to Cedar Park and my friend was excited to take me here as it had just opened up and seemed to add a streak of cool to my friend's new neighborhood. So, it was midweek around 8pm and while the patio had plenty of folks and there was music going the food trucks were done and they weren't too courteous about letting it be known they were closed or out of food or closing up.   So, the taps were open which allowed me to try out a beer. The staff pouring were definitely friendly, letting me know some of their personal favorites on tap as well as letting me try some out. I did also appreciate that they had some NA options as well and I liked the kombucha they had on tap so much I had two more of those instead of the more adult beverage options they had.  If there was a way to have some of the bar staff cross train with the food truck staff it would make a huge improvement.

reviews.author: john g.
reviews.description: This place is pretty cool.   They have a partial circle of food trucks about 5 or 5.  Various choices of food trucks that all serve really damn good food.  We ordered from 3 of the trucks and everything was awesome. Each trucks menu is limited but they do it well!  Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: The Good Lot is a wonderful addition to the CP area. Bring your kiddos and your hounds sit outside under the shade or on their covered patio.    Cocktails anyone? I was surprised at their expansive craft beer options. Check out their rotating taps at: https://thegoodlotcp.com/beergarden/drinks/  There are wine, seltzer, and non-acholohol options as well.  When we visited there were 3 food truck options; Yard Bird, Oink, and our favorite The Rice is Right.    Be aware on weekends and when there is live music parking will be a challenge. This has been a point of contention with the neighbors and according to the Good Lot, they are looking to expand the parking area.    Pro tip: Don't park in the adjoining neighborhood park 5 minutes away at the Veterans Memorial Park. Stretch your legs on the way there and work off that beer on the way back.

reviews.author: Ashley H.
reviews.description: Food trucks are delicious. Wish there was one or two more but that will come with time. The beer selection is great, mimosas as well. Outside area is clean, and safe for kids. Glad this place opened up! It's a little gem!!

reviews.author: Oak Z.
reviews.description: As far as I can tell, The Good Lot only has 5 star reviews and for good reason.  It is a great beer garden with plenty of non-beer options as well.  I have always passed by the place and noticed how busy it is most weeknights and especially weekends, but I am certainly pleased with what it brings to the community.  Generally it gets pretty busy after 6PM until close, and parking can be difficult to find.  Carpooling or taking a rideshare would be the best way to do it in my opinion as I would hate to park in front of someone else's house in the nice neighborhoods nearby.  Certainly a parking lot expansion is something the owners are considering as that is my only issue with the place especially when it gets busy.  That being said, it is always a great atmosphere with a variety of food and drink options.  There are also always lots of dogs in the grassy area by the patio and it is nice to see how family-friendly the place is.  I will certainly be back and bring some friends in the future!

reviews.author: Rain S.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed this place and plan on visiting more in the future. They have a great beer selection, multiple food trucks and decent amount of seating! I happened to visit on a Tuesday and to my delight, they had trivia. I think this place is a great option if you are hoping to grab a beer and chill!

reviews.author: Dane S.
reviews.description: My daughter and I visited The Good Lot yesterday (8/8/21).  It's the new and hot food truck and bar spot in Cedar Park TX (2500 W New Hope). The Good Lot has a main building with a large dining area enclosed by glass garage doors that open and a bar that has numerous beers, ales, ciders, and craft sodas.  It's nestled among the oak trees. There is a nice amount of paved parking and gravel lot parking.   The Good Lot also has dining areas under the oaks along with a game area (corn hole) and a playground for the kids with a large wooden teepee for climbing.  They are dog friendly.   The Good Lot had 4 food trucks.  We chose The Rice Is Right that serves Korean inspired rice boxes and other items.  We ordered the crispy chicken box and the cauliflower box.  Both items were perfectly fried and coated in a sweet and spicy Korean sauce.  Flavor was amazing.  The boxes came with steamed white rice and a purple cabbage slaw.  The portions were large and more than enough food for us. There were other food trucks that served Mediterranean, Pork, and Chicken.  The menus look good and I will explore those in the future.  The Good Lot and The Rice Is Right are on 'My Keepers List'.

reviews.author: Jay Z.
reviews.description: This is a neighborhood friendly indoor/outdoor bar with several food trucks and live music. We came upon it by an invitation from a friend to meet them for a drink. What a wonderful experience. There was a variety of beers on tap and nice small selection of wine by the glass. The food was outstanding. Most importantly the environment and the friendliness of the staff was exceptional.   During our visit we met the owners and their family and it was truly an enjoyable experience. Playing corn hole and chatting with the family was outstanding. Neil and his wife are fantastic.  Do yourself a favor and enjoy and afternoon or evening there. I think you will enjoy it.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: The Good Lot is the new spot to hit up in Cedar Park off New Hope. Food trailers here, beer on tap, covered patio, great outdoor seats and space, place for kids and pets. It has only been open for 3 weeks and the word is getting out. As we were leaving tonight, the park lot was pretty full. Great place to relax with buddies after work or with the family with a wooden teepee for the kids to climb and corn hole. Head over to The Good Lot and get some food from The Rice is Right and Oink Mobile.

reviews.author: Nick P.
reviews.description: After we took our dogs to the dog park nearby, we noticed that the Good Lot had finally opened! The beer selection was great, lots of locals including Whitestone, Hedgehog, Red Horn, Family Brewing and (of course) some lovely PHP Jellyfish on tap.  We decided to tried Yaadbird, since we hadn't had any fried chicken in a while. The lemon pepper chicken was on point, crispy, juicy, peppery, a 'lil salty, and everything you need in your fried chicken!  The property is beautiful and well landscaped. The lawn was amazing! It was so fluffy! When we first arrived we just admired the live oak trees and the quality of the grass.. Lawn lovers, you will understand...  The bartenders were very nice and very excited to introduce so many new people to the Good Lot. The owner was all over the bar, pouring drinks, helping staff, and checking with guests, seeming to have time for everyone.  We are looking forward to coming back here and trying the 3 other food trucks, along with the rotating beer menu. Hope they are planning to host more events, as we would love to do an anniversary party here at some point!

reviews.author: Ben F.
reviews.description: Finally, a really great beer garden in Cedar Park. I came on their first "soft public open" day and I'm so glad I did. I've been to about 20 pubs and bars in CP and this one stands head and shoulders above the rest. It's an open air (no AC but there is heat in the winter) with big garage doors that were open and a huge ceiling fan so it was comfortable. There were about 20 taps and 3 of them were not filled yet. I chatted with the owner and she said she was looking for ideas so my friend Greg gave her some. :)  There is plenty of indoor seating. Plus, there is a huge grassy area with picnic tables and even a fire pit. It's family-friendly so no smoking.  There is a playground for the kids and spots for four food trucks although only two were filled.   Beer was about $6 on average so not cheap but not expensive either. $1 off all day on Mondays.   It was an enjoyable experience and a really great ambience. I'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Lauren R.
reviews.description: I have been dying to go since this place opened and we finally got the chance today. No disappointments here! This place is non-smoking, dog-friendly (leashed) and kid-friendly, with a unique play area, six sets of cornhole, and plenty of shaded grassy area to run around in. Tables are wide and comfortable, and the entire patio was open-air, so social distancing is a breeze. We ate at the Oinkmobile truck (delicious) and grabbed local beers and ciders at the patio desk. We walked the fifteen minutes from our house, but it looks like they have a decent-sized parking lot and are working on creating more space. The only downside is that there's no ramp down to the grass/play area, but hopefully they'll make it more accessible in the future. Staff was super friendly, and I can't wait to come back for open mic night. Because yes, we'll be back!!

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: Oh my! Visited the Good Lot for the first time on a cool Saturday night in October and was very happy I did. Let's start with the atmosphere - fantastic. Huge outdoor space with picnic tables plastic chairs or plenty of room to bring your own (even saw someone bring their own folding table). Live music was at just the right volume playing just the right kind of classic rock that doesn't offend and always pleases. Beer selection was generous and reasonably priced (not to mention $5 glasses of wine). Had a 50/50 burger at Oink and was BLOWN away. It's half bacon and half beef and all good. Loved it. The bacon Mac and cheese was also delicious but the portion was a little small for $9 (my only complaint of the night). Do yourself a favor and if you're up in the 613 check this place out!!!

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: Found out The Good Lot opened last Saturday so we had to head over. We arrived and got in line to get a beer (lots of local options which you love to see!). Once we got a drink, we were lucky enough to snag a table under the fans and the breeze was so nice. They had live music while we were there, which I believe will continue on weekends so that's fun. The lawn looked so nice, chairs to sit in, trees for shade, lawn games for entertainment! There were 4 or 5 food truck options while we were there and while we didn't get any food, all the food we saw coming out looked so good! Definitely recommend stopping by and checking it out!

reviews.author: Anastasia P.
reviews.description: Had a great time here. Great service, clean and overall just very nice. Love the live music, dog friendly and outside activities

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Great beer selection! They really should get penny bags hung out because there are SO many flies. They would get 5 stars if there weren't so many flies.  For the owners- they may have different names other places- it's a ziploc bag with water and you put coins in and hang them. If you Google penny bag it will tell you they avoid them because it's bright (thanks Matt for googling!) but I like to think it looks like a spider web to fly eyeballs so they are trying to stay away from a web. Flies probably aren't that smart.. it's probably the light part.

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: What a fun local spot here in the CP! Been wanting to come check out for awhile now and finally drive out last night and closed the place down!!! (sorry guys, we were the last ones to leave)  Parking is nuts so plan ahead and maybe carpool... We drive a jeep so we had no issues ... live music and plenty of smiling faces.. service was great, bathrooms were clean... dogs welcome! Plenty of good beers, wines and ciders... gals were so nice behind the bar.. offered samples and were super sweet... good folks, good music and good grub.... my son joined us and grabbed some food from the food trucks... cauliflower wings, shrimp fried rice and macaroni and cheese... so so good.... bring your chairs/ blanket to sit on because tables and chairs are hard to snag... the lines are long for drinks but they go fast.... We will be back for sure! We feel right at home here. If you like fresh air and freedom... come here.. if you are afraid of fresh air and human contact, probably should go to Austin and be amongst others who feel that way... Merica!

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: This place is cute and super family friendly. There are adequate food truck options and beer selections. I enjoyed the openness of this place -- there was a lot of seating that was not in the immediate proximity of others which was great. My only issue is the pricing -- I cannot pay over $5 for a Kung Fu Robot IPA when I can get it for $3 near my apartment. $8.25 for an Electric Jellyfish? I can't but I understand.

reviews.author: Maris M.
reviews.description: We're so glad the good lot opened near us! It's the perfect place to relax with the kids, enjoy a variety of good food, and hang out for a while. It gets crowded on Friday and Saturday nights when there's live music and it can be hard to find parking, so recommend showing up in the late afternoon if you want a good spot.

name: Leander Beer Market
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Kimberly H.
reviews.description: Amazing Food! I highly recommend the pizza, fried pickles and wings! Normal prices and they have indoor and outdoor seating. Plenty of on street parking. The location is great in the middle of old Leander!

reviews.author: john g.
reviews.description: It's a local watering watering hole in "downtown" Leander. Why the double quotes around downtown - because there isn't much happening in downtown Leander.   Anyway, cannot comment too much on food as we only had an appetizer and it was alright.   Beer and wine are served in a plastic now which is less than desirable. Not sure how it was pre-Covid.   Staff was fast and efficient but I don't think I could describe them as warm or friendly.  They weren't rude either.   Decent amount of variety. It's charm is that is local and has the hole in the wall personality.   We plan on returning.

reviews.author: Amber W.
reviews.description: My review is mostly based on service.  I came here with the husband on a Monday night because I wanted a post-dinner beer. I marked this place in my bookmarks as a place I wanted to try based off the reviews. I generally try to be open-minded about my experiences at new places, but honestly I was just rubbed the wrong way here. We walked inside around 7 pm and I only noticed the list of cocktails on the wall behind the bar. I looked at the tap handles to see if I could tell what they had and the bartender finally came over. I figured I'd ask for something easy and see if they had Dos Equis on draft and was told they didn't with a snarky attitude that I guess he thought was witty or funny. I asked where the list of beers was and he stared at me and just pointed up...ok where am I supposed to be looking? OH. Apparently I'm supposed to know there are individual beer names hanging not only above the bar seats, but also sticking out slightly over the seating where you have to get up to see them. I tell him I haven't been there before and wouldn't know those were there. I order the beer he suggested (Alstadt Kölsch) based off of me asking for Dos Equis. He asks if I want to open a tab and I say no. His response: "Only one beer?" with what may as well have been an eye roll. You would think with me telling someone that I'm a new patron the attitude would be better. He probably doesn't care since A) it probably isn't his business, B) I'm sure they have regulars and C) he was probably in a hurry to come outside to vape with his friends on the patio that says "No Smoking".  Side note: if you want to sit outside be prepared to listen to cornhole games underneath the same covering as the seating which causes it to echo so loud you can't hear your own conversation.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: On this past Saturday, we made the adult decision to venture out as LB was open. We decided to visit as they were not busy and were following the separation guidelines. The service is always friendly and it was even better on this visit. Our guest puppy was treated to snacks and fresh water. We sat on the covered patio and watched rerun sporting events and just enjoyed being outside.   I've been an LB patron since day 1 and I remember when it was difficult to find a local venue that offered a large variety of craft beer options.  LB has changed a lot of the years as they now serve cocktails and their patio has been expanded. Venues come and go (see Sheas and AJs across the street) but LB has a loyal following and has remained our go-to venue to have a brew or two and some pub grub.   It's a misnomer to call their food pub grub as you can order a pretty darn good pizza, meatball casserole, fried calamari, artichoke dip, or our favorite their homemade fried pickles. Yes, they pickle on site!   Nice folks, great beer, good cocktails (check out their specials), and food.

reviews.author: Corey W.
reviews.description: Amazing food, staff, and regular customer group. The food is fantastic and the pizza is by far the best in Leander. The owners are locals in Leander and always strive to provide a fun environment

reviews.author: Laura N.
reviews.description: Owner harasses people online about politics. He's displayed his misogynistic attitude while bullying of his female staff during meal service. No Covid-safety protocols at all. I miss the sweet bakery that was there before.

reviews.author: Chris K.
reviews.description: This place is great! The prices are set and easy to determine, the staff is helpful and friendly, the food is way better than I expected.  Only draw back is if you go on trivia night seating may be a touch difficult to find, but save that I love this place.

reviews.author: Emily J.
reviews.description: I don't see the appeal of this place but it was busy.   1 bathroom, that smelled like pee and had no paper towels.   The hurricane that I order that was off of there board on drinks that they made was not a good drink.   The garlic bread we ordered was overdone and almost fully burnt on the bottom.   We ordered pizza also. One side was barely done while the other side was burnt. They put a lot of Italian season on top the pizza after it was cooked. Some times you just get a bite full of seasoning, not good.  First bits we thought the pizza had a good flavor but the more you ate the pizza the less tasty it was.

reviews.author: Madi U.
reviews.description: We visited on a Friday night after some late evening tennis because we literally couldn't find a restaurant that's kitchen was open past 10pm. Of course we know that's what to expect from Georgetown lol, but they're kitchen is open until like 11:30 which is fire honestly. Fried pickles were amazing, very nice patio, the music was a little loud but it was busy. Loved that they're dog friendly

reviews.author: Kali H.
reviews.description: Went yesterday for the first time for happy hour. We sat outside had some beers and ordered pizza and mushrooms and the food was fantastic. I will go back

reviews.author: Jason K.
reviews.description: The beer selection is always fantastic. The food options are limited, but tasty. I made the mistake of getting an old fashioned here one night-- meh-- but come for the beer and the vibes, and you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Landon O.
reviews.description: I had to post something about their food after all the negative reviews I read before going. We got a pizza, wings, the meatball casserole and a Greek salad. Everything was really good, came out quick and didn't seem like "frozen" meat at all. The meatball casserole was probably the best. The food won't blow you away, but it's great for bar munchies. A solid 4 stars   If they realigned their pool table and got some better sticks it wouldn't hurt.

reviews.author: Jeremy R.
reviews.description: Artichoke dip was great, pizza was just ok.  Nice outdoor area, nice bar.  Would go back again.

reviews.author: Matthew M.
reviews.description: Seek and ye shall find. This tiny hidden spot in old Leander checks off lots of my boxes - but doesn't impress. First off. This is a nice place dont get me wrong. I have been 3 times now just to see maybe it was an OFF day. Good menu , sports , decent tunes. So - those are pretty solid. Let me start with the menu. Pub grub for the most part with $10 pizzas unlimited toppings. So- naturally this is what i ordered each time. Each time it comes out it looks amazing and I'm excited. Like a Pointer Sister ( I 'm so excited ) . But the pizza never tastes cooked. The dough is mushy. Not a big deal. NExt time around I tell them to leave it in a bit longer for me. Comes out -- same. Not a deal breaker. Just need to change what I am eating. My belly prob says same thing. Next lets move onto the staff. For the most part the lady running the joint is on point. Friendly- helpful and witty. The remainder of the staff is quite the opposite. I have noticed this during a lunch visit with us being one of 2 people in the place, and in the evenings like during the sports games and crowds. Just abrasive . Again- I'm not there to make friends. I'm there to have a cold beer ( maybe 3) watch baseball or the slew of people who still have to think if they need to be wearing a mask when they enter an establishment( smh). So - The beer. They have a pretty typical tap list with 1-2 silver and gold medal choices. I saw Aldelberts there last night.. sweet!. But behind the bar is a ghostbuster lunchbox treasure chest of cans and bottles. WARNING! don't try to figure out what's in there. Hard to see them all... and after learning  how friendly the bar staff(see above ) is - I gave up asking and went with an IPA. The crowds are not bad and for the most part follow distancing rules.. but - nothing enforced. This scares me. While I know its MY choice to patron , I would still like to see ppl adhere to the 6ft. Outside- good seating - tv;s good parking and over all fantastic. I will prob go back, just not order the pizza and maybe try and get a spy camera behind the bar to see the other options as -- that's what life is all about. Options. Thanks for eating with me today, and I'll see you next time.  -M

reviews.author: Stephen H.
reviews.description: Fantastic service. Great beer selection draft and cans/bottles. Also have liquor and Red Bull. Lots of TV's and also play sound for the big games. Great food also. Mary is a rock star. TouchTunes could be a bit louder at times but that's probably a good thing based on some of the music selections I've heard. Also have golden tee. Quaint little bookstore next door too. Easy parking.

reviews.author: Ryan T.
reviews.description: Good place fun atmosphere it's like you neighborhood bar with good food good prices too

reviews.author: Erica R.
reviews.description: Wow I'm pretty upset. First game of the season and I was so excited to support my favorite local business. We got here before opening so we were the first to arrive. Sat down at the bar and asked to move because a regular sits there. Ok fine. Told the game was on a certain TV. Once people started arriving the manager said she didn't have enough boxes to play the game I wanted all of a sudden. We had ubered to the bar and now are forced to leave. I guess there is a hierarchy in customers and you have to be important to be treated well. I'm baffled.

reviews.author: Marcus G.
reviews.description: Owner is a jackass who thrives on bullying his staff and customer personnel; have gone a few times to this bar to see him disrespect his female bartenders as well as her clientele while being 'on the job'. A real shame because the place has incredible potential that's obviously being held back

reviews.author: James H.
reviews.description: This has been a local fav of mine for some years now. The owner is extremely active in the community. The food is great and priced well. Something changed at the spot and for me no longer has that comfortable feel. Seems has if over serving is not monitored as you will have several loud and obnoxious folks who aren't being controlled.   This was the second night in a row that I was ignored while sitting at the bar and watching the bar tender hang at the end of the bar with is buddies.   What was once a nice calm place to eat and enjoy some craft beers is now a place for the high volume drinking and the vocally high volume people.  Bring back Luigi's for the food and leave everything else.

reviews.author: Carly T.
reviews.description: This is my favorite place in Leander.  My husband and I started going every Friday and then our teenagers wanted to join us one night and they love it.  On Fridays everyone in the house is excited for LBM night.  The food is good, the atmosphere is fun, the TouchTunes are fun.  The service is great! We will be regulars for a longtime.

name: Salt Traders Coastal Cooking
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Thursday, Saturday

reviews.author: Krasti Q.
reviews.description: This restaurant is a 5 out of 5 for me. I absolutely enjoy eating here. The raw oysters are always my favorite to snack on (tip: on Mondays, their gulf oysters are only $1). I've also tried their chowda fries which are delicious. It's everything you would expect with chowder but better because you also get fries (this dish itself can be heavy and filling). Definitely one to try if you're looking for something to warm your soul. Their lobster roll is good too. I love the lobster meat but I wish they served it as a warm, hot sandwich rather than the chilled one. Nonetheless, still delicious!   Now don't get me started on their dessert which is also worth noting here. All their desserts are made in-house but there is one that really hits the spot. This dessert has a warm chocolate brownie topped with a scoop of Vanilla ice cream and drizzled with caramel. If heaven was a dish, that would be it because it just transports you into another world. Worth saving some room in your stomach for!

reviews.author: Thomas S.
reviews.description: Good vibes and atmosphere and hard to beat the happy hour prices. The wine list was pretty lacking... I mean throw 1-2 nice options on there... it's oysters after all.   Oysters were fresh but not great. The sushi rice was made out of a home rice cooker... come on y'all... gotta step up your game there. Food is a bit salty but overall decent. Worth a try if you live in Round Rock otherwise probably not worth stopping by for.

reviews.author: Jim C.
reviews.description: I mean the food was OK but was a) very very rich, and b) everything was very salty.  I had a half-dozen gulf oysters which were very small, and also had the shrimp and grits which was just over complicated. The shrimp was overcooked as you would expect someplace hundreds of miles from the coast where no one knows anything about seafood, and the dish was overall just rich and higher-flown than necessary.  D had something else for a main dish that neither of us even remembers, and she also had the mac and cheese which was tasty but also a little over-produced.  Neither of us would consider returning. Third star is because the service was good - Kevin was our server - otherwise, and this this is just OUR opinion as lifetime gulf coast residents, maybe two stars.

reviews.author: Angela M.
reviews.description: Always a great visit! The chowda fries are one of my favorite things on the menu. That has a crispy shrimp bowl as a special and I hope they bring it back! The shrimp were luscious and delicious and it was a huge portion. Service is always amazing and they've upgraded their HVAC system so I feel comfortable dining here.

reviews.author: Melissa D.
reviews.description: Good oysters and the half chicken plate is amazing.  Just a quiet laid back seafood joint yes it's expensive but good

reviews.author: Jim N.
reviews.description: We found ourselves in Round Rock, TX on a recent Saturday, early evening, so we decided to stop by Salt Traders Costal Cooking on IH 35.  We found a couple of open seats at the bar.  Our first orders were a couple of craft cocktails, the Gin and Housemaid Tonic and The Rum Around.  Both were good, but upon reflection, for the price, regular cocktails would have sufficed.    We kind of went crazy on appetizers, having Gulf oysters, grilled oysters, crab fingers, and the crudo plate, which was yellowfin.  All of those dishes were "off the chart" crazy good, with the exception of the crudo ... the white sauce used was way too sweet for the awesome fish.    When we finally ended up at the main section of the menu, we ordered the fried oyster lettuce wraps and the simply grilled fish of the day, which was redfish.  The tartar sauce served with the lettuce wraps was delicious, but a bit too much was slathered on the wraps.  IMHO put a dash on the lettuce leaves and let the patron add as desired from the small cup of tartar sauce that comes with the dish.  The redfish was terrific, but no one knew why the place would have farm-raised redfish from the Indian Ocean when we have fresh redfish 200 miles away in the Gulf of Mexico?    Keeping it local, we ordered the Becker Vineyard Reserve Viognier, and it was delicious.  In closing, a special shout out to our waiter Nathan behind the bar, service was attentive but not intrusive, so nice to have a great waiter with a great attitude!

reviews.author: Brian O.
reviews.description: We've been a fan of Salt Trader's Costal Cooking in RR since their opening five years ago and not surprisingly we dine there 2-1 over Jack Allen's, our previous go-to place. We've never had a less than wonderful experience there with the diverse menu and bold bright flavors and textures of amazingly prepared seafood and American cuisine and wonderful drinks.  The newly transformed Flat Top Fish Tacos are unbelievably good as the two hearty tacos are prepared Birria style with caramelized cheese crust on the flour tortilla and with substantial amount of grilled black drum with a street corn filling along with the cup of aromatic tomato-shrimp soppin broth and tomatillo-lime rice with pickled chilis.   Other favorites include Grilled Oysters and Fried Oyster Lettuce Wraps for Starters and the  Fish Enchiladas and of course fresh Oysters and Daily Specials and Seasonal Deserts.  FLAT TOP FISH TACOS 17 crispy cheese flour tortilla, street corn,  tomatillo lime rice, pickled chilis,  charred tomato-shrimp soppin' broth

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: We love everything about Salt Trader's.  First and foremost the 512 Cocktail. It is perfection. Sometimes I crave it and we go just so I can grab that drink. Haha! The food is outstanding. Every single thing. We've never made a bad selection. Their crudo of the day is always a favorite.  Dang now I'm craving Salt Trader's again. Haha!

reviews.author: Mildred A.
reviews.description: Hannah made my experience great! She went above and beyond to make sure I was satisfied during my time here!  Parking: there is a parking lot Reservations: im not sure if you can make reservations but I would suggest it. Although, the wait isn't too bad  Food: I got a very basic meal( lol), I got the the fried fish and shrimp and was not disappointed  Honorable mention: tried the New Orleans bbq shrimp and the pasta- i wasn't a huge fan- my taste buds said it was too salty foe me- but my friend enjoyed them  Drinks: i really wanted a spicy margarita and Hannah made sure that she got it to my liking, which I truly appreciated!

reviews.author: Andrew B.
reviews.description: Salt Traders might be my favorite upscale casual restaurant in Round Rock. The vibe here is similar to Jack Allen's, but with a nautical twist. 100% the kind of place where you'll find at least one dude rocking salmon colored shorts and boat shoes. No shade, just facts.  I particularly love their happy hour. All the appetizers are hits (especially the chowder fries), and that $4 discount on apps is really nice. I may be wrong, but I think on either Monday or Tuesday, happy hour is basically all day. If you've never been and want to sample a bunch of things, definitely take advantage of this.  My favorite entree by far is the shrimp and grits. It comes with a savory sauce on top that really sets it apart from other places. The bowl is also huge, and so the price is more than justified. I'm particularly fond of the Bonnabel -- one of my favorite whiskey cocktails ever. Just sweet enough for a guy like me who can't drive a manual, but just whiskey forward enough that it doesn't look like I own a Fiat.   The place gets super busy at the usual dinner times and all times during the weekend. Be a pro and hit them up during slow hours for the best experience!

reviews.author: Jerry J.
reviews.description: Have been going here for many many years. I would say the best seafood place around. Very friendly staff and professional. It's a sister restaurant from Jack Allen's. So you know it's great quality. Enjoy the dishes all the time :). My family and I come here frequently. Best oysters in town!

reviews.author: Big W.
reviews.description: I dunno why i gave this place only 4 stars on my 1st review?! I LOVE THIS PLACE!! Whenever my wife asks me where i want to go for fathers day, birthday etc... it's ALWAYS Salt Traders, and I always get the salad which is amazing and the simple grilled fish.. AMAZING TOO!! I LOVE THIS PLACE, SEAFOOD...AND SALAD.. Dont get better than this!!!

reviews.author: Jack K.
reviews.description: Dining in has never felt so good. After a lengthy hiatus we spun the wheel and what a meal. The service was outstanding as was the food. Fresh and ginormous shrimp on the Cobb salad!! The fish enchiladas and corn are amazing. Make sure you save room for dessert. We had drinks instead. Very refreshing!

reviews.author: Dylan K.
reviews.description: Really high end modern cuisine in an unexpected area. North Round Rock really isn't the place you'd think of for high quality seafood and a great classy bar scene, but that's exactly what this place had.  My wife had the scallops and they were seared perfectly and tender in the middle. Couldn't ask for better.  I had a fish sandwich, but I'm picky so I did it without the slaw, which was a mistake because it needed the crunch and the sauce. I'm sure it would be a 10/10 with that.  Definitely go to this place. We were treated like gold and the food was excellent!

reviews.author: Rick R.
reviews.description: This is my second time here in the last couple years. I started with the gumbo. In my personal opinion it was under seasoned. Kind of bland. I then had the New Orleans Shrimp. Very nice. You can tell the shrimp are fresh. I then proceeded on to the Shrimp and Lobster roll. The roll was fantastic! Warm, fresh, toast yet pillowy on the inside. The Shrimp and Lobster salad was nice and cold. The shrimp burst with flavor and freshness.  My server, (Scott) was elusive to say the least. The other waiters attended to me a lot more than he did. I probably waited 8-10 minutes before he took my order. The restaraunt was probably at 30% capacity at most. I had multiple managers see me looking for my waiter and just walked on by.   Overall, the food is good and they can definitely improve on service. I understand being shorthanded, but some things are inexcusable.

reviews.author: Susan E.
reviews.description: For my birthday, I chose to visit Salt Traders. We hadn't been there in a little while, and good seafood is always a treat.   My husband and I arrived in the early side, during happy hour (3:30-6:30 on a Thursday), so we could enjoy a leisurely meal. We started with drinks. I had the frozen grapefruit margarita, which tasted like a regular margarita. I loved that the salt on the glass also had citrus peel.  Our appetizer ($5 off during happy hour) was pot stickers. They were excellent, and the portion size (6) just right for sharing. The sauce was wonderful.   I ordered one of the day's specials for dinner, seared monkfish. It was served over fingerling potatoes and topped with a great salsa. The monkfish was tasty  but a bit on the chewy side... and the potatoes were barely undercooked. My husband had fish and chips, always a good choice at Salt Traders.  Dessert was vanilla creme brulee topped with peach sorbet. Excellent!   Service was excellent. We enjoyed Patrick's sense of humor and the stories he told.   We will be back again, without a doubt!

reviews.author: Tee C.
reviews.description: This was by far one of the best dining experiences we have had in a long time! Kenneth is an exceptional server! His knowledge of the menu, and every detail of the dishes was impressive to say the least. He can describe a salad and make it sound magical! We were too full to want to order dessert, but after he described each one we went home with almost all of them to go! We had an exceptional first visit! Thanks for the great food and service we can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Angela W.
reviews.description: Super yummy food by the people of Jack Allen's Kitchen. Given that it's by the people behind Jack Allen's, Salt Trader typically gives you a small portion of their Salmon dip to welcome you.   This place is always packed, especially on Mondays when it's all day HH. If you plan on coming on Monday, definitely get a reservation or you might be waiting ~1 hour.   I've had a number of their appetizers and they're all super tasty. My favorite is definitely the fish collar. Nicely seasoned with Cajun spice and the perfect amount of crisp. You can't really go wrong with any of their entree either.   All in all, solid restaurant that I would go to again and again.

reviews.author: Gregg M.
reviews.description: Since this is one of our local favorites, we brought out of state family for another GREAT dinner.  We enjoyed a variety of fresh oysters as an appetizer and then ordered a second round! Super selection so we had to try most all of them  Entrees included the fabulous monkfish special and my absolute favorite, the ciopino! I thought about the monkfish but just had to stay with my favorite, which was soooo yummy as always.  I have to give a shout out to our server, 'Hanna from Louisiana.' She was SUPER! Kept us entertained and was a great representative of the Jack Allen family-knowledgeable, super friendly and totally dedicated to delivering an exceptional guest experience. She is 5 stars for sure.  In summary, we just love love love Salt Traders!!

reviews.author: Cristal Y.
reviews.description: We were in town for a wedding and this was a great in between place from Georgetown to Austin. Make sure to make your reservation online! We made our reservation a couple of days in advance and the only available time slots left were 4:30 and 8:30pm. We decided to do an early dinner and IT. WAS. SO. GOOD.   We got the 2 dozen chargrilled oysters, 2 dozen seasonal oysters, chowder fries. Presentation, portion, and service was great! Our waitress Hannah was attentive and very sweet! I'm not a huge oyster fan, but these were phenomenal! Between the four of us, we cleaned house and walked out with our appetites satisfied. Afterwards, we walked off our fully bellies at the outlet mall!

name: Tony C's Pizza and Beer Garden

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: This place is a ton bigger than I expected! Picnic style seating on the inside and a great, comfortable bar area. There's TVs all around the restaurant, so you can catch all the football games! Beer selection covers something for everyone and they had frozen wine drinks that looked good. Half off beer pitchers on Thursday's and half off sangria on sundays.   I've never been one to rave about a salad, but omg the dressing on the Greek salad was out of this world. Even my man was in love and ended up hogging it from me.   I was there to kill time before a baseball, but will most definitely be back for pizza and game watching!

reviews.author: Jesse B.
reviews.description: We have been to Tony's C for several years now at the Cedar Park location so when they opened up this one , we were we excited because we only live about 6 minutes away .   Unfortunately our to go order was very disappointing. We order a LG Mama Mia and a $9.99 Caesar salad , when we got home " 6 mins drive " the pizza was cold , and the salad was wilted, looked old . It's a shame because we love this place so much . At almost $40 ? Definitely not worth it .

reviews.author: Elizabeth B.
reviews.description: The garlic rolls were burnt. I threw the Pizza away it was RAW!  Called manager for a refund she said I had to deal with Uber Eats.  It's was Tony's Pizza that burnt the rolls ( tasted like rubber) and served up raw Pizza.   Will never go back!!!

reviews.author: Eva Maria T.
reviews.description: We have eaten here a few times and always an excellent dining experience at Tony C's Pizza and Beer Garden. Super friendly staff, fresh ingredients, and all public areas are spotlessly clean! This visit The Mr. ordered a small house side salad, which was was a very generous size. He ordered Build Your Own Pizza: pepperoni, salami, mushrooms, and red onions. I ordered the meat lasagna...large enough portion to feed two people. Love the marinara used in the lasagna. It was very light, fresh, and not sweet. (Some places add a lot of sugar to their pasta sauce not Tony C's). Not ordered this visit, but make sure you get the mozzarella sticks, made fresh in house, not Sysco Foods frozen. Photos of those beauties are in my previous review.

reviews.author: J C.
reviews.description: Their pizza is delicious! Be careful because the delivery fee is very high during the checkout.  That aside we love there food. One day we will dine in to see what else they got.

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: We used Door Dash. I added a note to modify my order and they did it exactly the way I asked. Excellent customer service.   The pizza was very different than anything I've had in Austin. Excellent crust, quality toppings and definitely all fresh ingredients. The Carnivore was just spicy enough to make you want to keep going back for more and the Truffle was not your average fake truffle oil flavored pizza. The mild hints of blue cheese and fontina took this over the top!    Support local and eat their pizza - it's delicious!

reviews.author: Felicia L.
reviews.description: I really do enjoy this place and the atmosphere (solid jams happens and my little family loves to sing and dance to them).  I absolutely am in love with the truffle pizza and their pepperoni rolls! Why they have four stars...I hate on the app if you want ranch instead of red sauce it doesn't allow you to adjust and if I'm ordering a family size pepperoni roll dish (which is over 12 rolls) I get two or three small ranches, and any additional I have to pay for (.50 a piece). I wish they would fix the issue or relax on the ranch.

reviews.author: Angie M.
reviews.description: Loved popping in to this spot for a quick drink at the bar while we waited for out of town family to arrive. We're from Houston, but have been here to visit several times and...THEIR PIZZA IS BOMB!   Great family place-covers all bases and tastes. Friendly, fun atmosphere with 50's and 69's music playing often. Pizza is even good for takeout, which is quite popular, as well! They also offer salads and LASAGNA! (Marinara or Alfredo sauces) - see my photo of the menu for details!  TONS of seating - long tables for large groups. Nearby, newly-opened LaQuinta Hotel's guests , including sports teams, families, conference attendees, and other large parties, will love coming here, not just for the seating and atmosphere, BUT FOR THE PIZZA!!!  We visit Austin regularly, and always make it a point to visit-whether we dine in, or bring it back with us-that is, provided it makes it back...whole, lol.

reviews.author: Oscar R.
reviews.description: Absolutely phenomenal pizza!!! The wifey and I arrived 30 minutes after they opened, we were the second customers there. We ordered the chicken Parmesan pizza as recommended by our cashier and an order of garlic knots. It was a great recommendation.   The garlic knots came out first. They were so warm, soft and garlic buttery! They came with their house made marinara, which was sooo good! Those poor garlic knots were gone just as quick as they arrived.  When the pizza came out, it looked amazing but I was a little concerned the chicken Parmesan might be a bit dry because it kind of looked that way. Let me tell you, the pizza was spot on! The chicken was well seasoned and cooked, definitely not dry. The crust on the pizza was amazing!!! I'm craving it again as I write this review!  The atmosphere was also laid back. They had beautiful wood bench seating, which could accommodate a large party/gathering if the place is not to busy. Service was also excellent.  Honestly, the best pizza I've had in a while! I highly recommend this place if you're in the mood for delicious pizza!

reviews.author: Michelle W.
reviews.description: Delicious!!! We finally got a chance to try this place out. It definitely looks nice from the outside. Beer garden in Round Rock? Yes please! Ordering online and pick up is easy! I scheduled my pick up order in advance so I wouldn't forget.  Food was delicious. No complaints. Really enjoyed the sauce that came with the garlic knots and calamari. Gelato was satisfying. Looking forward to trying another pizza soon!

reviews.author: Braden W.
reviews.description: Service was A+ and the food was even better!!!!  We went here after all the Kalahari restaurants were booked, highly recommend!!

reviews.author: Brooke H.
reviews.description: Amazing pizza if you are nervous about trying new pizza don't. This place is amazing. perfect amount of sauce. Honestly everything was amazing about these pizzas! Going back every tuesday!! When you walk in you order before you sit down so be prepared for that if you have ordering anxiety but 10 out of 10 recommended!!!

reviews.author: Carol N.
reviews.description: My husband is a pizza snob. Seriously. The staff here recognizes us now. I would say that's a pretty good sign that we go here often.  Here's what I don't like about this place: cheap, thin napkins and stingy thin plates. Also, If you have unwrapped straws, please buy a dispenser for it. It's really not sanitary in the first place, but with COVID, can you purchase wrapped straws please? I do appreciate the conscious effort to recycle. Please ditch the cheap paper goods and maybe use reusable metal pizza pans for plates or something. Also, I don't think I ever see lids for the cups. Again, perhaps consider plastic reusable cups.  What we do like: mozzarella sticks, pizza rolls, THE PIZZA, did I mention the mozzarella sticks ;) I don't like them trying to upsell ranch, but I get it. Also like the availability of pizza boxes for leftover pizza and lids for sauces.  We'll be back. Don't worry about my 4 star rating and comments about the paper goods. If we lived closer, I wouldn't insist on dining in.

reviews.author: Metra J.
reviews.description: I'm not from TX but when I'm here I love to stop in here and get some great pizza and beer.  Pepperoni is my fav but I had to get the motz, basil and tomato on the margarita pizza.  Manager Shanna came by to check on us which was great, she is super sweet and took the time to have a conversation with my toddler as he told her how many rocks he found and how much he loves pizza.

reviews.author: Rhea S.
reviews.description: We were starving so the pizza isn't full and a picture of the fried ravioli is absent. My boyfriend and I had a great time at the the new local pizza joint. We shared the largest size pizza, split a fried ravioli app, and gelato. We also enjoyed a few drinks on HH.  We usually go to slapbox for local pizza, but dare I say it, this place has better pizza in my opinion! Not as greasy and it's closer to us. Their HH runs from 5-7. My boyfriend got 2 October fest beers and I had a glass of PG, a frozen bellini and a sangria, which were all $2-3 off depending on the drink. The frozen bellini was very good and I don't normally drink frozen drinks. I did not care for the sangria at all, though.   Everyone was very friendly. In regards to COVID, everything was very clean from what I saw.   Shoutout to the manager, Catalina! She was very genuine in her table checks and we both believe she's a great asset to their team in QC.

reviews.author: DeAnna H.
reviews.description: Yum yum yum! My family of four shared a 12" pepperoni pizza and it was sooo good! We also orders the garlic knots which were also fantastic but look more like cinnamon rolls than garlic knots. Then, we tried the vanilla, chocolate and strawberry gelato. The vanilla is more of a rich vanilla bean flavor so it's an acquired taste (my husband loved it, I didn't care for it)  my daughter loved the chocolate (said it was better than Baskin-Robbins) and I had the strawberry. The strawberry was so delicious. Sweet, soft and airy with the perfect amount of tart to it. The restaurant was industrial looking, open concept and very clean. All the staff were friendly and attentive. Wish we had one of these where we live!

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Stopped for lunch here today. This has kind of a Pinthouse Pizza vibe (but more sterile/family oriented and less Austin-ie). Service was great, place was clean, and they seem to be taking COVID restrictions seriously.   The pizza was pretty good. Not as good as Slapbox/600 Degrees but just a notch below (on par with Pinthouse). Came out quick and was hot. Beer selection was pretty good - had a local brewery Oktoberfest.   All in all, worth returning and will try to nudge my kids into agreeing to go here instead of Hat Creek next door.

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: Made our way in last weekend to give this place a try. The restaurant was extremely clean and nicely decorated.   Food: we tried the toasted ravioli, garlic knots, Italian chopped salad and pizza. The food came out quickly and was very tasty. While the prices were not cheap, I do think you get a good value for what you pay for.   The only improvement we'd suggest is letting customers open a tab and be able to order both food and drinks on it. We were told they're already working on this though!

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: What's the best food when you're lazy and it's cold outside? Takeout pizza! I placed the order Saturday morning for an afternoon pickup. I ordered the 12" carnivore pizza and it definitely satisfied my cravings. The carnivore has salami, pepperoni, sausage, meatballs, pizza sauce, mozzarella, and calabrian peppers. There were a lot of spices, which made it quite flavorful. If you like meat on meat on meat...this pizza is for you!   Service was great! I went inside, instead of using the curbside option, to pickup the pizza from their takeout counter. They greeted me right away and had my pizza ready on time. I appreciated their organization. The inside of the restaurant looks really cute with long family style tables, TVs, and a warm atmosphere. I look forward to dining in the restaurant next time.

reviews.author: Cindy B.
reviews.description: I'll take everything to-go ! I was here for there opening week . Then I got hooked and I visit once weekly. There's lasagna, salads and PIZZA! Also beer if your slightly into that.  Great place for takeout, not sure if they have delivery?  I usually order ahead and pick up curbside now during covid. However, still have gone inside for a sangria or two and wait on my order.

name: URBAN Eat.Drink
accommodations: Good for Breakfast, Brunch, Lunch, Dinner
Best nights on Wednesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Sandra B.
reviews.description: Came here for a quick Sunday brunch with some girl friends! We made a reservation and the put our name on the table which made it feel personalized.   Everyone got pitchers of mimosas but I'm pregnant so not drinking. They all enjoyed them!   All the food that came out looked amazing. I wasn't really feeling anything crazy but the items i got were delicious! The biscuit was fluffy and flakey and everything i wanted.   The sausages were actually huge and so filling. There was a nice flakey crunch to the outside of them which i wasn't expecting but enjoyed. The service was great and so were the portion to cost ratios! Well worth it!

reviews.author: Edward A.
reviews.description: My wife and I were looking for a new place to eat on Saturday after a long day of running around. We found this place on Yelp.  The staff was not friendly.  They were not outright rude, but not very hospitable. Nobody smiled throughout the evening. Definetly did not feel welcome.   I ordered the burger and fries.  It was probably one of the worst burgers I've had.   There needs to be a balance between meat, bread, and veggies.  The burger was under cooked and  too big for the bun.  The veggies were minimal and soaked in blood from the burger.    My wife had the hot chicken sandwich.  That was better, but a mess to eat.    My son had the Mac n cheese with fruit.  The Mac was a thick gooey mess with large elbow pasta. Very hard to spoon out.  Not easy for a 3 year old to eat.  Also, quite salty.   We don't plan on returning.

reviews.author: Lauren T.
reviews.description: Saw really great reviews for this place so we decided to check it out for brunch! They had live music in the outside area.  The brunch food was just average, I think this might be a better spot for dinner. I had a Bloody Mary and it tasted like watery tomato juice with no spice or horseradish. My boyfriend had the shrimp and grits - he really liked the shrimp on it but the grits didn't have much flavor. The best item that we had was the appetizer of chips and queso but we subbed fries instead of chips - SO yummy. The queso was spicy and the fries were so crispy.   We would probably go back for dinner and drinks to see if it's better!

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: This place was okay. Had live music which was the best part. This location is only on the ground, no cool rooftop view. The food was okay. The service was slow, I assume understaffed. The drinks were overpriced.

reviews.author: Ramimi T.
reviews.description: I went here only once before and it wasn't too too great. I decided to give it another try and I am amazed! One of the best burgers that I've had in a while! The fries paired perfectly with the ranch and the sweet tea was so good! I only had to wait 17 minutes for my food to get out. I will definitely be coming back!

reviews.author: Adam L.
reviews.description: The folks on staff were all quite nice, but that's about the extent of the good for our experience.  I got a chicken sandwich and my wife got the ribs.  Both were pretty much flavorless and dry, even with sauce.  All in with 2 drinks, soups and meals it was $100 before tip.  The fries were great, but otherwise I don't think I'll bother visiting again.  I wish them the best and may make a trip again just to check in and see if they've sorted stuff out.

reviews.author: Hannah B.
reviews.description: This place is cool! The vibe is fun and they have a fair selection of foods. The bacon wrapped quail is to die for!   Our service was a little slow when we ate here. My BLT also had a weird herb flavor to it that I wasn't fond of, others may enjoy it. I personally felt it was a little overpowering.   I recommend eating outdoors as it is in a nice part of downtown round rock

reviews.author: Kevin E.
