reviews.description: Great atmosphere and our sever was amazing! That's were the good in this breakfast putting with my daughter ends.  Highly disappointed in our actual meal. I ordered Shrimp and Grits and she ordered the Full Monty (American sampler)  Our food was all cold nothing hot or remotely warm. They didn't seem too busy so maybe they are working out some expediting issues. My grits were mediocre at best maybe if they were warm that would be different and the shrimp was fishy and rubbery. I've never had grits that were like a smear on the bottom of the bowl/plate but that's exactly what this was.  My daughter said her eggs tasted off and her fruit was clearly on the brink of, if not already spoiled. The best thing on the plate was the potatoes  I'd give them another shot just maybe not for brunch this time.

reviews.author: John W.
reviews.description: We hadn't been by here in a little while and we're looking to go somewhere different than "the usual".   The good: We were seated quickly and there were quite a few staff in the restaurant to help so we didn't have to really wait that long for anything. In fact, once's we're done my wife said, "we should start looking for the bill" and here comes the waitress with the bill. This is really surprising in light of the challenges that other restaurants are having with staffing.   I like that this place is in downtown round rock and I like the overall aesthetic with wood beams on the ceilings and the house converted to restaurant feel.   I got a special off of their hatch chili menu and it was very tasty and a pretty decent sized piece of fish.   The not so good: While the food was tasty, I was missing some of the expected hatch chili flavor that I would expect to find when ordering something off a hatch chili menu  My wife's fish was a little tough, but again the flavor was good  If you get cold easily, make sure to bring a sweater. The temperature was pretty frigid and because of the small floor for the restaurant there wasn't really a way to find a spot where the you don't get blown on by the AC.   Wrap-up: All in all the food and service were good. A few tweaks and I think this could be a 5-star review.

reviews.author: Bijal P.
reviews.description: I've been here a few times now I really like the atmosphere it's really calming every time I come.  The customer service to outstanding food and let me not forget the drinks yum.  - happy hour here is a must I paid $6 for my tequila ole fashion yes you heard me right.  It was the most unique drink I've had by far I really appreciate the bar tender going out of her way to make the most delicious drink. FYI I had to have two lmao the ice cube was crystal clear made the drink even more interesting to drink  - overall I always have a great time here whether it's brunch , lunch or a date night great place to a have a good time ( no I did not get drunk lmao )

reviews.author: Jeremy T.
reviews.description: Came for brunch with few friends on a random Saturday and thank goodness we came to round rock. What a charming downtown they have and this place we perfect. Heaters for the fall outdoor seating, amazing entertainment and the food and bev were great.

reviews.author: Paulette A.
reviews.description: Charmingly rustic interior and good food but overpriced for the portion size and mediocre service.    Staff were friendly but noticeably uninterested as some were preoccupied scrolling on their phones and others even hanging out at the bar. Our waitress was at least attentive.   For food I ordered the salmon frittata, and the hubs got the pork belly hash and a $5 orange juice that was clearly brand made and from a bottle that probably cost just as much as the charge of the 8oz we were served. Flavor wise, my food was delicious tho slightly salty. However upon arriving to the table, the pork belly hash looked smaller than my entree. For $16 you'd expect strips of pork belly on top of the sweet potato hash - what you really get is 10% protein, 20% dry biscuit, 30% hash, and 40% arugula garnish. Redeeming quality was the perfectly poached egg.   Definitely a happy hour/small bites spot but wouldn't recommend for brunch or a full meal. For $50, much left to be desired

reviews.author: Madi T.
reviews.description: Here's the Tea. Everyone else's meal looked great. Lots of food everyone seemed to love it. That said, I ordered the eggs Benedict and let me Tell you. What a let down. It was like one thin deli sliced ham on and English muffin with an underdone poached egg and barely any hollandaise. It was more like eating eggs on toast. Now the potatoes; they could've been great. They were fine. But the peppers with the potatoes were not cooked and more thrown in just because. Not only that the music outside was too loud to have a conversation. I wish my experience was better, but mayyyybe I'll try it again with something else on the menu? I don't know.

reviews.author: Teresa B.
reviews.description: My fiancé, baby and I came here for a nice Friday night on the town. We had heard how great it was and was anxious to check it out for ourselves. Upon checking in we were told there was a 45 minute wait...fair enough. We walked to Finley's to grab a quick drink. We were both surprised when we got a text only within 20 mins! When we came back we were greeted by the hostess who was an absolute doll and showed to our table up front. Let me just say - customer service was top notch. Exactly was we hoped for. Our waiter Chandler was amazing! For an appetizer we ordered the bacon wrapped quail. It was superb. We both enjoyed it very much. For our entrees I had a side Caesar salad and the Dry Aged Ribeye (with asparagus and a cheddar potato cake), my fiancé had the Pecan Smoked Pork Chop (with asparagus and a cheddar potato cake) and for our 2 year old we ordered a kids meal with Mac and Cheese and Fries.  Let's start with the Pecan Smoked Pork Chop. While it was the tastiest of our entrees it was just a bit slightly overcooked...but delicious despite that. Okay on to the ribeye. I get this is not a steakhouse so I probably shouldn't have ordered it, but I had a craving. For the $45 price tag we were very disappointed. The thin cut steak very under-seasoned. The "cheddar potato cake" was just okay...its basically a mound of mashed potatoes with a cheddar crisp on top. The asparagus was okay but I like the small asparagus better and these were ginormous.  I noticed the baby wasn't eating his mac and cheese and wondered why. It looked like it came from a generic box and once I tasted it I learned why. Oddly enough the dish tasted like it had vinegar in it!! My fiancé tasted it and said the same thing. We even let Chandler know when we were leaving.

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: We were Celebrating my daughters both getting new great jobs this week. We wanted a special dinner and we selected this great place. Reservations for 10 were easy as we called first thing today. They save a great table for us. Very nice touch.   We started with a few apps that was great. The chips and dip was perfect. Everyone loved the main courses and the plates were cleared.   We ate inside but went outside after to listen to the singer for a few songs. We love live music and it is so great to have it back.   Great night with family.

reviews.author: Tia R.
reviews.description: First time visiting Urban but decided to check it out on a whim because I was nearby. When I arrived it was happy hour so ordered a cocktail. Called the Passion Project which was delightfully delicious! A bit on the sweet side but yummy nonetheless. It was a cold day so decided on a cup of tortilla soup... unfortunately I was accidentally bought the tomato soup which is pictured as well... I didn't taste it but it smelled delicious. The waitress was kind when I let her know the incorrect soup was brought and quickly brought out the tortilla soup. The soup seasoned well and perfectly warmed however tasted liked chicken soup with tortilla strips. I also ordered the Urban chopped salad with salmon... it was huge! Lol! The salmon was a bit dry and not really flavorful but once chopped over the salad all of the the flavors blended well together. All in all I enjoyed  my time at Urban... the service was fast, staff was friendly, and the overall ambiance was nice! I'd definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Susan E.
reviews.description: My daughter and I enjoyed a Saturday brunch at Urban to celebrate her Halloween birthday. We arrived a few minutes ahead of our noon reservation but were seated promptly outdoors and were told our server would be there soon. Then we waited...and waited.    Once our server arrived with waters in hand, things ran more smoothly. My daughter had a full Monte and I had shrimp and grits. The food was attractively plated and tasted great. My shrimp was spicy, and there was plenty of bacon in the dish. The only thing that seemed out of place was the redeye gravy around the edge of the cheesy grits. It really added nothing.   There are plenty of menu choices, including vegetarian and gluten free items. Prices are a bit on the high side for some things and reasonable on others. But the food was good for us so I'd definitely return. This would have been a 5 star review had we not waited so long before a waitperson visited.

reviews.author: Yolanda R.
reviews.description: The food was great! Live music was amazing. The waiter was okay ( not too good) but Toya the girl walking around asking people if we needed anything made up for the waiter. Toya was great, she was happy, friendly and had great customer service.  We definitely recommend this place. Toya and the food deserve the 5 star! Thank you Toya!

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Food was pretty decent, service was great, nice outdoor patio, menu had a lot of options and the bartender was squeezing fresh fruit juice for the cocktails. Happy hour has $8 bar bites and drink specials. Would visit again! We got the chicken fried steak, pork chop and fried chicken hot sandwich. The hot honey sauce was AMAZING - spice only hits you at the end, and the dishes had the right level of crisp.

reviews.author: Gregg M.
reviews.description: My wife and along with some friends went to Urban Eats for the first time in a couple years and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. This s not a fancy place but very welcoming and casual. We decided to try the covered outside area and even though it was pretty hot, the fans and breeze made it very comfortable.  We discovered they have a happy hour Tuesday-Saturday which is pretty unusual in my experience. The menu is creative and utilizes locally sourced suppliers and though it is not a huge selection, it is varied, offering some seafood, steak, pork chop, salads, soups and starters. We had  grilled shrimp, quinoa salad, tortilla soup and side salads. Service was very attentive without making us feel rushed. Live music started at 7 which was another pleasant surprise.  We were amazed how much this part of downtown Round Rock has really developed. Parking was easy, the area is very walkable and Main Street entertainment district nearby.  Urban Eats is definitely a repeater for us! Give it a try and support a great local business.

name: The Dig Pub
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Jeff B.
reviews.description: Drove by here today and thought I would check it out and I liked it! I ordered a Peacemaker Beer, an ale that tasted good. The next time I want to try the Blackberry beer. The name itself is appealing. Since it was close to dinner I figured I should order food instead of going home and cooking. I got the fish and chips. You can order the 2 piece or 4. I got the 2 piece with cut fries. It was cooked good. The fish was flaky and not oily. The pubs tarter sauce was good.. the fries were very good too..   The service was very good. There was a sign to sit yourself which I did and within 1 or 2 minutes my server stopped by to get me started. She showed me the ropes and got my beer and food quickly. I was really surprised at how fast my food came out. I can say it was just under 10 minutes but I was still surprised at the promptness. There was quite a few customers but the servers were on top of it. They talked to the customers as if they were family.   The place was clean and there was good parking. The beer menu had several types of craft and IPA beers. I'm  pretty sure I will return when I have time. My total cost including the food and beer was only $14, amazing! Thank you Dig Pub for being in Cedar Park and giving up another place to get a beer and some grub in a friendly way!

reviews.author: Ted C.
reviews.description: Evening in the suburbs and the dining options were dwindling. I was getting hungry and being out with my buddy meant that I'd have at least one more beer. My friend went through his mental list of places and came up with The Dig.   We arrived there and fortunately got there in time, it was a slow night and the kitchen was about to close so we quickly made our choices. I saw that they had Scotch Eggs and I'm a sucker for Scotch eggs, but unless you're a vegetarian/vegan what's not to like about an egg wrapped in sausage that's then deep fried?  I also ended up getting their Buffalo Chicken Sandwich because...actually why do you need a reason?  The egg was good, a little thin on the sausage side but the mustard dip added a little more savory. The sandwich had a good amount of spice but the sauce was pretty runny so it was messy but otherwise good.  They do have a lot of taps and I appreciate that they try to have a little bit of everything and focus on locals. I get that they have to strike a balance between locals who want a beer that's cold, yellow, fizzy and domestic and crazy whale chasing beer nerds that are into barrel aged, wild/lacto, hopheads but for my visit it was a little more on the tame side. I had a sour from Prairie and a local mead which was great and at the time, that was about it.

reviews.author: Krista L.
reviews.description: In their left side room with 2 booths, the first booth was propped up to look like it was stable, but it collapsed when I sat down ...  my butt literally hit the floor! And I've broken my tailbone twice while playing sports. My wife and I reported this to several staff and received shrugs!! We stayed long enough to finish our beers and while we were drinking, staff propped the booth bench back together. I disassembled it twice but they kept putting it back. This place is just begging for a customer to get hurt and get a lawsuit!  If someone does, then I'm willing to testify.   I've posted photos of the bench c

reviews.author: Will S.
reviews.description: The Dig is a great local place in Cedar Park to meet friends and try out some really tasty brews, or wine if you prefer.  Lots of good seating both inside and out for  those who want a more open environment. Their pub grub is excellent, Scotch eggs to die for and some really tasty cheese offerings as well as some standard fare. The whole staff is friendly, honestly, never had a grumpy server and I really like sitting on a couch...one of the seating options depending on where in the pub you are. Check this place out, you might find that you....DIG it too.

reviews.author: Rainey B.
reviews.description: So...for those who believe that The Dig is run by snotty brats, perhaps you should have some consideration for the amazing service industry folks who have gotten us through the last almost 2 years of Covid he!!. Erik, Sage, Miles, Kayla and the rest of the crew have been considerate and friendly throughout and the food quality has always been outstanding. The beer selection now is better than it has ever been (coming from an Austin beer snob who used to live on Rainey). Don't pass this place by if it is on your radar!

reviews.author: Chris R.
reviews.description: Knowledgeable staff about beer options. Friendly staff. Good food. Plenty of indoor and outdoor sitting.

reviews.author: Lucky N.
reviews.description: This place is interesting. The right side of the restaurant looks pretty nice and lively and the left side of the restaurant looks like they gave up or ran out of money on decorating and just put a few tables out. They also have an outdoor area but no shade so I didn't want to sit out there unprotected, otherwise, it would have been nice because I had my dog. It was a bit busy so unfortunately had to sit on the left side (maybe everyone else there agrees the right side is better and that's why they all preferred to sit there). It didn't look or feel particularly clean and I'm a clean freak so I didn't particularly enjoy sitting there.   The service was fine; the waitress was nice. The food was pretty decent, but nothing outstanding or memorable where I feel I have to come back again. It was fresh though and I appreciate that for comfort food, it wasn't soaked in oil. I think the ambiance had already turned me off so I didn't enjoy my food as much as I would have it was clean.   They are known for their beer but I don't drink beer so take my review with a grain of salt. Clearly I'm not a dive bar kind of girl (unless it's out for drinks and bar hopping) but plenty of people are fine/really like those types of places so if you do, you'll enjoy this place. I'm not knocking this place and I would come back if friends wanted to go but I like more of an ambiance when I go out to eat.

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: Ordered a two meals and drinks  They brought one meal out and forgot about the other..... asked twice.... they said they didn't want one to get cold. It was clear they forgot... wasn't till we went to leave the brought out the other...  asked for it to go, didn't even do that brought it out plated, we had to ask for a box.  what a joke. Honestly party of two how hard is it to make two meals.  Don't go here

reviews.author: Gregor M.
reviews.description: Wow.  Some rude, snotty young people working at this place.  I don't expect great service from a dumpy joint like this, but I do expect civility and respect.  I am sure it's not easy to find good help these days, and perhaps it's a particular challenge to find young people who display a modicum of tact and dignity these days.  Nevertheless, in that case the owner shouldn't depart and leave the bar to let it be run by insolent brats.  My friend agreed with me as we left that we would never set foot him The Dig Pub again.

reviews.author: Kelsea K.
reviews.description: Good selection of various beers! Lots of tap options. Grilled cheese might have well been on the kids menu, pretty flat and boring... but my 5 year old liked it!  The adults got the Thor's Hammer and BLTA with fries and the table shared scotch eggs and pickle chips for apps. Sandwiches were straightforward and tasty and the fries were thick but crispy outside and soft inside.   Scotch eggs were better than Renaissance festival... but could have more sausage.  Pickle chips were average bar food. Overall, good meal and fair prices!

reviews.author: Sara J.
reviews.description: What a great evening at the Dig Pub! We took our dog and enjoyed sitting outside in the casual picnic area. Ben and Ashley provided the best service we've had in quite a long time. The food was fresh and quite tasty. Many choices for beer on tap...wine and cider, too. We will be back soon!

reviews.author: Diana S.
reviews.description: Food - Acceptable Service - So-so Friendliness - Poor Chance of a return visit - Zero, mostly due to the unfriendliness of the waitress. Perhaps some training in the area of making your guests feel welcome in your establishment would help alleviate this problem.

reviews.author: Nicki T.
reviews.description: They now have Sunday brunch! It's fabulous and delicious with craft beer. Who doesn't love eggs Benedict? Wonderful. The new owner's getting serious with the menu! Love the beer selection as always. The outdoor area greatly enhances the Dig Pub experience. Can't wait for game nights and dinner club coming up next year!

reviews.author: Howdy B.
reviews.description: Nice place with relaxed environment. I'm not a beer drinker but I saw lots on tap. It's dog-friendly and the food is yummy. Alexander was super friendly and accommodating. We will be back!

reviews.author: Steve W.
reviews.description: Very good food. Wings on Tuesday, fish and chips on Friday. Erik does a REALLY GOOD job. Good beer selection too.

reviews.author: Jim O.
reviews.description: The place to go in Cedar Park for a brew. Wife and I went for our anniversary night out to grab a bite and a brew. We had a blast. Service was exceptional with four different staff asking if we were good or needed anything. They were prompt and courteous and just plain nice. Food was served quickly and was delicious. Wife had the patty melt and I had the monte cristo; both were exceptional. The poutine as an appetizer is also on the to do list. We will be back.

reviews.author: Brian M.
reviews.description: We have been craving some loaded fries so we did a search and found this place. Recently they started offering delivery so we decided to order loaded fries, fried pickles, and a few beverages. The order was done fast and delivery was fast as well. Delicious food for a decent price. Support your local restaurants!

reviews.author: Carson C.
reviews.description: You know, I just wanted to come here for a quick bite to eat and a beer after playing disc golf in the area. What I left with was the best, most attentive staff  I've experienced since COVID. The food was underwhelming but filling so, no complaints from me. But again, the staff! I'll come back for them!

reviews.author: Julia Elizabeth Brack C.
reviews.description: Been checking this place out online for months now and finally got an opportunity to go in person today. Wow. What a superior waste of time! It makes sense now why it was so empty when we went in.  You would think that as we're just coming out of a pandemic, pub and bar owners would be over the top happy to have people show up to eat and drink their food.  Well, not this owner! I'm still in shock how rude he was to me and in so little time of me being there! His bar waitress was super sweet and answering questions as it was our first time there. The plan was to order some grub, and craft beer and go sit outside on the picnic tables on this beautiful Sunday.  I was into my second question about one of the brunch items, when he rudely interjected himself into our conversation by trying to answer my question for the waitress where he clearly had not actually heard my question at all. I then corrected him by repeating what I actually asked. He then tried to defend his ignorance by stating something else about the food they serve that was a complete contradiction to half of the menu items. You should of heard the way this guy talked to me, there was absolutely no reason for it, completely unwarranted.  Plus he made himself look like a total idiot in front of everyone and it was so obvious. The more obvious thing was that he didn't want our business. When I say our, it was my husband, 2 yr. old and me. Maybe he felt threatened by our kid? He wasn't misbehaving or doing anything crazy. The nice waitress was chatting with him and everything was totally fine. And then out of no where the owner was just a total dick to me!! So of course we left, I mean who would stay!? But that's exactly what he wanted, for us to leave. With pleasure, Asshole!  I felt bad for the nice waitress, she seemed to be in shock also. Sure hope she finds somewhere else to work since I can bet she gets treated like garbage.  Funny thing is that I can't even comment on the food or beer which is all I was yes to try. This guy should do the world a favor, sell the place to someone who actually wants business and go take a class in The Important of People skills in the food and bev business. Mean people suck and they need to learn how to be nice or just grow the F up.

reviews.author: Jesse C.
reviews.description: First of all, not family friendly. Took my daughter here for a dinner with our dog ... sat outside, and ordered a couple of burgers, and after a long day I wanted a couple of cold, craft beers. Perhaps I shouldn't have expected a family friendly atmosphere, but I honestly didn't think I had to think it through too much. So, a group of men in their 30s-40s began arguing about a patron sneezing , dropping "f bombs". The patron went in to get the owner. I thought "ok cool, the owner will take care of this." Instead, of calming the situation, he comes out dropping "f bombs" of his own, bragging about how he's going to kick all their asses, and how big of a Texan he is. I asked if he could watch his language in front of my family, he ignored me. So, I took it as a way to teach my daughter that this is the definition of a bunch of men that are nothing but losers. I told her, this is not the way men that have any class should act in public. There were also plenty of other women around that didn't need to hear all of this male drama while they are trying to have an enjoyable evening with their families. The guy that actually started the whole thing apologized. Owner, Eric, you should be ashamed of yourself. Dude, have some awareness ... no one cares about how cool and tough you think you are while they are trying to have dinner and spend some time with their friends and family. The people next to me just got up and left, too. You were so caught up in your own ego, you didn't even notice. I spent $42 and still left your staff a 20% tip, mostly cuz I felt sorry they have to work for such a loser. Not sure what Texas you claim to have grown up in, but not the one my family has lived in for 6+ generations. We all make mistakes .. and I rarely leave reviews or waste any of my precious time on this kinda thing .. but this needed to be said.

name: The League Kitchen and Tavern
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Michael Q.
reviews.description: Came here for lunch with a few of my coworkers and it was pretty good.  Lunch was solid service was good but I think that was partially because there were only 4 tables occupied when we were there but the service was attentive.  Menu is pretty large and has breakfast items during lunch so no complaints there because I do love me some breakfast for lunch or dinner.  Overall solid place would come back if I'm in the area not making a special trip here but if I'm here I definitely would come back.

reviews.author: Kasti K.
reviews.description: This place wildly exceeded my expectations.   We are in from out of town, it's a perfect Sunday spot for lunch and to watch football. The Sunday crew in the bar was super fun, our server Aaron was really kind   Their Sunday drink special is $3 mimosa and bloody Mary's.   Their gluten free bun is the best I've had at a restaurant, it is nice and chewy and stays together.   The chicken sandwich was great, a huge chicken breast with lots of bacon and avocado. They do a "first timer" complimentary dessert of their chocolate dump cake, my husband said it was great!

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Very unassuming from the outside but walk in and you find a upscale gastropub style restaurant. We came at lunch and though I was initially hesitant to bring in kids, there ended up being plenty off other families in there. The menu was upscale American. Given it was lunch time, we went with hamburgers and sandwiches. The main dishes were all really good and a decent portion (not too big, not too small). The sides we got were a bit under seasoned though. Lastly, there should really be a hamburger on the kids menu.   Overall, really enjoyed this place. Will come back for dinner to try more of the menu.

reviews.author: Ken D.
reviews.description: The League is part neighborhood bar, part gastro-pub and I love both parts!    The bar and dinning areas are separated.  Despite both being relatively small, there's plenty of seating.  Choose from high-tops to semi-circular booths to high-back swivel bar stools.  And they have an outdoor patio as well, but not much of a view.   The League is a great place to meet a friend for drinks, a casual date, weekend brunch, watch Sunday football, or to just to ride the bar solo.    Excellent food with new, weekly specials, including a burger-of-the-week. On Mondays they have 2-for-1 burgers for dine in - can't beat that!  They also have cocktail specials to go along with their food specials (in addition to their menu and drink standards).  I wish they had a bigger beer wall, but the selection is serviceable.   The League is one on my regular spots and I've yet to be disappointed with their food, drinks, or service.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: I was so pleasantly surprised when we stopped here for a quick lunch. Friendly service and helpful staff members greeted us at the door and I loved the Prohibition era style and decor. Lots of variety on the menu. I tried the Society burger which was tasty and my husband had the club sandwich. $3 mimosas and they sent us home with a complimentary dessert- can't beat that.

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: Overpriced bar food.  Fries were soggy. Burger needed basic salt and pepper to give it flavor. It was medium rare.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: This place is our most visited restaurant since moving here thirteen years ago. As a former restaurant owner / operator, I appreciate the consistency and quality of the menu offerings. The facility is always clean and tables are cleared immediately when a party leaves. They have some really good deals, like burger Monday where you buy one and get one free. They also have a mouth watering prime rib special on Thursday that we can't wait to try.  One more attraction is , if you are into science or astronomy, you might be waited on by Galileo.

reviews.author: Eva Maria T.
reviews.description: We have been going to The League for a couple of years now. I get my hair done around the corner so it's convenient for my husband to hang at the bar. Sometimes we eat here and sometimes not.   Upside; Bartenders are always friendly and welcoming, they have great happy hour prices on drinks and apps. Also weekly food specials.   Food can be hit or miss. Between the two of us we've had everything on the menu. Club sandwich is always as hit and so is the spinach artichoke dip. Burgers sometimes a bit dry. The salmon is usually perfectly cooked. Fish and chips over battered and greasy. Prime rib sandwich is hit or miss.  Burger of the week this visit was Frito Pie Burger. I had the garlic butter grouper, which was a huge portion, but lacked seasoning on both the fish and couscous. Garlic butter was on the side, but was just melted butter with a chopped garlic at the bottom. No other seasonings.   We will continue to come hang at the bar and eat here occasionally.

reviews.author: Carl H.
reviews.description: 7/4/21 1st visit.  Already a crowd at opening.   Waitress : Kenza - very attentive, paying attention to details. ( even asked about allergies ) There's definitely a spirit of cooperation- every employee was eager to help out.  Drinks : Bloody Mary's delicious and at $3.00 a bargain. Arron the bartender jumps in to help out in the dining area. Great guy !! Food : Pot pie (basically a biscuit with gravy with a fried egg on top - WOW filling and Delicious!! Wife had the steak salad - steak cooked exactly as she ordered it.  Mother in Law had a breakfast anytime.  All of our food was delicious!!  All and All we had a GREAT experience!! Definitely will come again.  A quality restaurant ! Absolutely nothing negative to report.  As a treat on your 1st visit - we'll show up and ask about it.  Prices were VERY REASONABLE!!

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: The service was great, and the food wasn't bad, it was just meh. We tried several items on the appetizer menu, as well as one dessert.   The beer selection also wasn't very impressive, but it wasn't bad.  Gets the job done; doesn't impress.

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: 5 stars for service and 2.75 stars for food. My 4 stars are on the generous side.  We dined here this afternoon. The server was very nice and took care of us. I'd give her service 5 stars.   For our food we ordered the chicken fried pork chop, the full rack of ribs, the southern burger, and the kids Mac and cheese.   Our little guy loved the Mac snd cheese. It was decent and definitely not out of a box. It didn't come with anything else but was only $5.   Hubby had the Southern burger with truffle fries ($2 up charge). The burger was solid. It could have been a slight bit juicer but it was a good burger. The "truffle" fries were not. The fries were limp and soggy and sprinkled with Parmesan but had no truffle flavor at all. Actually when you picked up a fry the cheese all fell off too. Pretty bad fries to be honest.   Older son ordered the baby back ribs and enjoyed them. They were your standard fair. Similar to what you'd find at Chili's but they cost $30 and come with a side of mashed potatoes.  I had the  chicken fried pork chop. It was very over cooked and dry and was topped with jalapeño gravy but there was no heat or jalapeño flavor at all. The gravy made the pork chop less dry though. I subbed Brussels sprouts instead of mashed potatoes ($2). They lacked seasoning or flavor. I like the taste of Brussels sprouts so I ate them but they had no other seasoning that I could detect.   The food was all fine. Not bad but at their prices I would definitely not run back.

reviews.author: Amari H.
reviews.description: Food and drinks were delicious! Tried it out for the first time and I will definitely be back. The food is quality for sure. I had the prime rib sandwich with truffle fries, and OMG! Every aspect of it was amazing and paired well together. I will say I was underwhelmed with the salmon deviled eggs... it just tasted like eating cold eggs with no signature flavor.

reviews.author: Gaye J.
reviews.description: Really good hamburgers and fries. They have a full bar so you can have the drink you want. Great neighborhood vibe

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: Give this place a try!! It's a little hidden gem! They have interesting burgers and I have tried a couple of their dishes and didn't have one that I don't like.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: The League is a cool watering hole and sporting some excellent food for the denizens of Avery Ranch.  Two for One burgers on Mondays is a great deal.  We usually pop in for a late lunch early HH and sit at the bar. Check out their small bites menu the meatloaf is pretty darn good. Fish n chips are AOK there are better fish n chips in the area but you can easily split this bountiful dish.   The League pours a good cocktail and their bloodies, according to Plus 1, are right up there with the best. There are rotating taps for you beer snobs (like me).  There is a patio off to the side and a good-sized dining room. It does get crowded hence our late lunch HH visits.  Pro tip during football season Friday nights are packed pre-game.

reviews.author: Barry B.
reviews.description: I took the family there tonight and was looking forward to having a good hamburger.   It was not to be!    It all started with a very aggressive an unkempt server with a bad attitude. We ordered the burgers which came under cooked and had soggy buns on the bottom.   The server was very rude when we asked to have the burgers redone and later literally threw a to go  box at me !  The manager got involved and was very gracious to comp the meal ,but i will not go back again because of the bad experience with a terrible server!

reviews.author: Jeanette H.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed our late lunch there, delicious appetizers and drinks. Great patio. Right as we we're done eating, a truck pulled up behind the building visible from patio and there was a strong sewage smell, it must've been some kind of clean out. Horrible. Thankful we were done or we wouldn't have been able to finish our meal. The smell was horrible.  We'll be back and hope that won't happen at the very moment we're there.

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: Stopped in for lunch on a Friday. Noticed the outdoor seating was pretty full but indoor wasn't busy at all. Service was good and the place was small but cozy and clean.   We ordered the fish n chips and a burger with onion rings. The burger was fine, very average and a little bland. The fries that came with the fish were also ok but a little cold. The onion rings and the fish is the part I wanted to love but didn't. Taste wise they were good. However, they had so much batter on them it made me feel sick after just a few bites. I know these were heavy items to order for lunch, but the ratio of batter was just too much.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Really clean feeling place with a great bar staff. Bloody Mary was solid and $3 on Sunday. Beer selection was on the better side for restaurants in the area. Lots of TVs. Burgers were tasty and I highly recommend ordering a side of the jalapeño gravy to dip everything into it.

reviews.author: Brad T.
reviews.description: My last visit the banana pudding was off, like spoiled milk off. Ordered the cobbler, it should be called a jam as there is no cobbler.  Poppers weren't really cooked, maybe they were just uber cold because they sat out, see below.  Order was to be ready at 6:58 and brought to my truck. I though ok they are behind...at 7:10 I went in and saw it just sitting on a table next to the door.  No clue how long it was there. They said I could just grab it and go.  Disappointing Brussels spouts we're amazing, the only reason they get two stars.   The last visit they brought it to my truck but the food was mehhh.

name: Slap Box Pizzicheria
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Private Lot Parking

reviews.author: Eric C.
reviews.description: Perhaps one of the best local pizza places in Round Rock.  Their menu is definitely creative, they have a lot of amazing pizza combinations or you can always create your own.  You can also order a whole pizza or order by the slice which my wife loved since she usually doesn't eat too much.   We ordered the Orig Mama Gallo and it came with sliced meatballs and pepperoni. The combination of meats were great. The crust and dough were amazing and so soft. Their beer selection is quite extensive, I found a local beer from a small brewery I had never heard of before. I loved it so much that I ended up visiting the local brewery in Pflugerville.  Definitely give it a shot if you are a pizza lover like I am.

reviews.author: Liz Z.
reviews.description: Bought some wings this weekend.  Tried out the:  Kentucky Bourbon - Amazing! Right level of heat, smoke, and sweetness  Teriyaki- Sweet and tasted exactly how teriyaki sauce should taste. Deep notes of ginger which was amazing  Lemon pepper- could have been a lot better. It was almost as if they just sprinkled a little bit of essence of the seasoning.  Honestly couldn't tell the difference between the lemon pepper and the following wings.  Taco- I could see the seasoning but they were basically naked wings. The only flavor I could sort of taste was cumin, which was kinda blah. I wouldn't call these Taco Flavor. A good idea to market these as taco flavor would be to market the as "carnita wings" fry them up until they are super crunchy like chicharrón crunchy then serve them with side of salsa. If you use this please credit me! Lol free wings with a year would be nice too lol ;)

reviews.author: Davidm A.
reviews.description: I highly enjoyed this pizza and the atmosphere of this place. I have been around so much I hadn't left a review for them. If you cone her and eat make sure and try there Thai hotwings... OMG so delicious I had to order another round of them. High fluffy crust and just walked out completely satisfied with this place. All around great. T.vs and games playing full bar and delicious food!

reviews.author: John C.
reviews.description: I honestly do not know where to begin with this review......I get it, possibly short staffed, since I did see a sign out front, but management should adjust how many patrons are seated if that's the case. 1. We signed up for space available seating for six people, mind you, two were planning to order single slices. We get to the restaurant and the first thing that strikes four of us as odd is the fact that the "greeter" had the emotions of Wednesday Addams...zero expressions nor cordiality. Did not see a smile one from this person. She should reconsider her position, but I'd suggest she work BOH the way she appeared.  2. Our waiter/order taker person, whatever the pronoun is today was flat out.....Terrible! His name was AJ, AJ was not attentive, didn't write ANYTHING down, did not take our drink orders(he was reminded by the bar staff). After he "mental" took our order down l noticed the "I got you look", AJ did not have us. Nope, ordered sweet tea, got unsweetened, came back with an excuse, we brushed it off. Ten minutes later, came back and asked my wife and I what pizza we ordered(again, he wrote it down mentally), I asked him to guess...when I told him a number 12 he replied, "I knew it, was just checking." I honestly could keep going on number two, as the service was just that....shit.  3. Nothing, I mean nothing arrived on time. My Brother received his pizza before ANY of the the reheat and serve slices came out. My wife and I got ours after he'd finished half of the pizza. After the complete shit show for service, as soon as our pizza came out we got a to-go box. I could expound on every one of these points, but I won't.   All in all the bill was $145, only one beer was ordered. I was "fine" with leaving a $20 tip for the service we received, but was talked into being generous. My old self would not have been so nice. Maybe folks are used to this service at this establishment, but for the money we paid I would have been happier with a PJ pizza and some good garlic butter sauce! Oh, I attached a pic of my pizza from last night....

reviews.author: Diana L.
reviews.description: Hands down the best pizza I've had. The Pirate pizza is a family favorite in our house! We also enjoy the chicken wings.

reviews.author: Natalie R.
reviews.description: The pizza is delicious and my husband agrees. The parking is awful. One time we ordered it for delivery and were charged mega bucks by the delivery service, so we'll never do that again.  Another time I placed an order over the phone to go and had to wait outside for about 15-20 minutes past the pickup time because there were so many people in line.

reviews.author: Seon B.
reviews.description: Slap Box is an interesting name for a Pizzaria with an included drafthouse. I stumbled upon this spot after Google searching "pizza near me". I was sawyer by the 4 star Yelp reviews, I had detour from my original plan to visit Pinthouse Pizza.   There's plenty of parking in fact there's an indoor covered parking lot on the same block around the corner. Upon entry the ambiance is well wonderful. There's enough tables and an ample amount of TV's to watch any of your heart's desire for sports.  I proceeded directly to the bar to order my pizza and beer to go.  When I sat down at the bar I ordered a pepperoni pizza and some water. After the pizza arrived after about 15 minutes or so I decided to sample a couple of ciders. I tried the Meridian Hive Cherry and the Meridian Hive Rhapsody. I ended up buying the Meridian Hive Cherry. It was on the sweeter side think like a wine.  When I finally tried the pizza it was pretty good. It was above average and I would try it again. The wings were really good. The sauce was flavorful and robust. The chicken was very good too. I definitely recommend Slap Box!

reviews.author: Glenn L.
reviews.description: Everything was great, the service was top notch - honestly the waitstaff was on top of their game!  First time in and can't wait to go back to try some different t combinations. We had the hot wings, by the slice and the garlic parmesan fries.

reviews.author: Lauren M.
reviews.description: Located in downtown Round Rock, this pizza place is right next to the Main Street plaza.  During CoVid times, we ordered to-go and ate in the plaza next door since it was a lovely afternoon.   Be forewarned, if you get a slice... it is a BIG slice!  See the La Jolla slice picture. It's huge!  The kids loved their pizza. Not a surprise there since it was your typical pepperoni.   I had a GF, vegan pizza for the first time and it was pretty good. I'm so glad they had this option on the menu so I didn't have to order a salad.   They had lots of beer options on tap but we didn't partake this time. Next time, we will. Give them a try!

reviews.author: Mallori B.
reviews.description: Seems like a neat place to hang out. Pretty good pizza... which is HUGE by the way. 2 people could definitely eat on one slice! Service was fast and friendly. Pizza could've had more toppings and cheese. Cheese bread was good. Ranch was homemade and very good.

reviews.author: Tracy N.
reviews.description: Awesome place to hang out and enjoy delicious pizza! The slices are HUGE! We had a great experience and our server was awesome!

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Great place for a quick lunch and beer. Good selection of brews, and some tasty pizza choices. Extra credit to our server, Valaree, knew her beers, spot on advice on their IPAs on tap. Excellent service, will be back!

reviews.author: Evan B.
reviews.description: 1. Let me just start off by saying, I grew up in a small town in Chicago Illinois so you could say pizza is my thing, and quite frankly slapbox pizzacheria or whatever the pronoun for this place is today has just that(pizza) 2. My experience at the slap was quite literally the reason I am willing to go back. Although it is clear to me that they are fairly understaffed the staff that work there currently are quite a joy. When you walk in you are greeted by a very interesting fellow that has the likes of Wednesday Adams from the Adams family, aswell as the door swinging wide open. Luckily for me I really enjoyed Wednesday Adams in the movie as she was my favorite character. Also I think people should be less hard on her at the slap because she seems to be doing good at her job as a greeter. 3. Our order taker person or whatever was also a very pleasant person. When we were seated by the greeter our order taker person named I believe adam was extremely nice and energetic,it was a damn shame my friends and I did not grab his number because he was looking extra fine the day we came in. Other than that he was still very nice and made sure our food was out on time. 4. To wrap up my essay on the slap I think it would be nice for me to talk about our experience with the food. Putting my Chicago ego aside my friends and I decided to order pizza here. I ordered the El Camino and let me tell you it might have been a fan favorite of mine, heck I could go for a slice right now while writing this review. 5. In conclusion I think slapbox pizzacheria is a great place to hangout and eat some pizza with friends and family. I also think that other reviewers shouldn't set a 4 star restaurant at such a high standard the place is ran aswell as it can be with the amount of staff they are given. My friends and I will most definitely be coming back to the slap as we enjoyed our stay

reviews.author: Misty D.
reviews.description: We visited on a Tuesday for dinner. There was no wait and the place is clean. The host and server were very nice. We got the Pirate pizza, and it was bomb. The garlic knots were fresh, but not extremely exciting. They did have a wide selection of beer. Hubby got the True Vine Daddy's Juice Box DIPA and loved it. Needless to say, we will be back.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: One of the best pizza restaurants around. I've been to Slapbox a number of times and it never disappoints. The menu is basically the same as 600 degrees in Georgetown. HUGE slices! Lots of variety and interesting toppings. AND this is a pizza restaurant but do not overlook the wings. They are sooo good. I love the dry rub ranch and recently tried the bourbon glaze which was super tasty. They have a great variety of beers on tap and attentive service. Also, a great place for take away. Slapbox is a fantastic addition to downtown Round Rock.

reviews.author: Peggie E.
reviews.description: I'm shocked this is a sister restaurant to the excellent 600 Degrees in Georgetown. I love 600 Degrees pizza! Slap Box has mediocre pizza, at best, IMO. Slap Box has a lot to learn from 600 Degrees. I wish it success.

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: Good spot for a slice of pizza, drinks, watch a game, with a cool sports bar atmosphere. This joint is family friendly too. I ordered a slice of Canadian bacon and pineapple. This slice was huge!!! Good chew and flavor in the crust. The toppings, cheese, and sauce were good. I like a little more sauce but it is good pizza. I recommend stopping by this joint for some good pizza.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Same menu/food as 600 degrees in Georgetown. This is some of the best pizza in the area. The wings are also legit and there's an extensive beer selection. What's not to like?

reviews.author: Cassandra P.
reviews.description: First time in * grabbed some takeout. In DT RR for work and ordered the 600 grinder to go with salt pepper fries. Sandwich was phenomenal. So tasty and full of flavor and the bread was money. Love the little bit of kick in it. Got mine minus onions and oregano and it was perfect. Will def be back! Only negative is that they had just run out of the most amazing looking cheesecake. Next time.

reviews.author: Ray M.
reviews.description: Great beer and pizza. Its too bad their pork shanks are off the menu. Round rock location always had a great atmosphere and the staff is amazing!

reviews.author: A M.
reviews.description: Staff is always great- its a bar with munchies NOT a restaurant- pretty drinks exceptional service - clean, nice, comfy - whats not to love - just don't go expecting to eat a meal :-)

reviews.author: Cameron D.
reviews.description: Found this bar via reviews when doing an online search. Don't let the fact that it is a hotel bar fool you. Tony is an expert in making drinks. He is super cool and really everyone here is at the hotel as well. We live in the area and will come back for the famous brown sugar old fashioned and margaritas!

reviews.author: Jonathan B.
reviews.description: Come see Tony - had the brown sugar Old Fashioned. Yum!  Cool little place. Have some sweet and savory bites.

reviews.author: Joe R.
reviews.description: Was welcomed immediately. Friendly, attractive bartender. And most importantly, a good drink!

reviews.author: Edward C.
reviews.description: This is a hidden gem in Cedar Park. Tony the bartender is great. A real mixologist.  You MUST try this out.

name: Alamo Drafthouse Cinema Lakeline
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Douglas W.
reviews.description: Movie theatre are banning large bags to stop people from being in their own food...  Good thing I have a few Twix up my sleeve!  I had a pretty eventful day but I knew that I wanted to still go catch a movie. I came to a pretty late showing and yet the service was great. Of course you always expect that the end of someone's shift that they would be low on energy but the service was fast friendly. The movie theater was clean the bathrooms are clean and there was plenty of parking.

reviews.author: Amber W.
reviews.description: My husband and I were looking forward to our first movie date in two years due to the pandemic. We went to see Ghostbusters Afterlife the Friday night after the premiere. Everything started out fine: we placed our drink and appetizer order before the show started. Got our mozzarella sticks and they were slightly underdone. Eh whatever, not a huge deal. Our beer and Bavarian Pretzel pizza were good, no complaints. However, the service not so much. On top of the fact our waitress took forever, she accused us of smoking in the theatre. I told her there was a vape cloud that came up on the row in front of us and I never saw anyone go talk to them. So maybe make sure you're accusing the right person next time. THEN our popcorn was burnt and we still got charged for it after letting them know. We'll keep going to Moviehouse in the future.

reviews.author: Jamie B.
reviews.description: Went and saw Free Guy tonight. Great movie. My 9year old puked all over the lobby as we left  The employees were so nice about it! They didn't make me feel bad or guilty or make me clean it up. I am so very grateful for tonights Lakeline employees  At least it wasn't poop?

reviews.author: Elissa S.
reviews.description: My husband and I rented a theater for a special occasion during covid. It wasn't exactly cheap ($150 for the rental, plus tickets and food/drink separately) but we missed movie theaters so much that we sprung for it. It was definitely worth it. The Alamo crew took so many precautions before and during our stay that although I was very anxious about the rental at first, I was able to relax and enjoy the show. Like others have said, all movie theaters are surely suffering right now and we need to support Alamo so that they're here when the pandemic is over. I love this theater chain so much, it'd be devastating for me personally if they were to close.

reviews.author: Daniel W.
reviews.description: Minus one star for every dollar y'all charge for the "convenience fee"   Before paying online make sure you know about this charge!

reviews.author: Sarah K.
reviews.description: The Alamo is awesome, and we've missed it a ton during the pandemic. But now that we have our vax, we decided to risk a super special outing -- we did a Your Own Private Alamo rental to celebrate a milestone birthday in the family. Just our inner circle, all by ourselves ... with a movie! And popcorn! And freakin' amazing buffalo cauliflower! In public, having our first normal-ish outing in over a year! Seriously, it was fun, and the Alamo took good care of us.

reviews.author: Mahlet A.
reviews.description: This spot was super cute and a great date night choice. The staff was super friendly and efficient while moving around throughout the movie. The drinks were tasty and strong enough. I wish I had known that the seats were so tight together, I would have left some space between myself and the occupants next to me. Other than that it was a nice experience!

reviews.author: Joel T.
reviews.description: I'm torn between nostalgia and the elevated level of service (and price) other theatres are offering.  This is classic Alamo.  It's like rediscovering your first car.  Fixed bar-style eating surface in front of the fixed seats, no leg rests or fully reclining seats.  The service was GREAT, albeit we were intentionally at a TERRIBLE horror movie (The Turning) that had maybe 10 people in the cinema with us.  Still, an employee could slack in that situation and they did not.    The screen and sound were good.    There was no lounge in the theater that I saw to relax and have drinks before or after the movie.    And, after many visits to other theatres, it was unusual not to have a button to press for service.  Rather, you physically put your order card up on the table for a server to see when they come by.  I was really concerned about this because I knew how bad the movie was going to be early on and drinks were part of the plan!! lol  But in retrospect, maybe having to physically check on the patrons is what made the service so attentive (I got the drinks I needed to get through the picture -- thank you, Jesus).  So, obviously I'm torn.  It is a retro experience for me having experienced my first dine-in theater at an Alamo. I would go back here again in a heartbeat.  But it is like getting in a classic car and then realizing you actually like modern bucket seats and power steering.  At the same time that classic car was less expensive and still brings a smile to your face.  I'm going to rank based on the model Alamo built and on fulfilling my memories of great service...and I'm looking forward to going back again! :)

reviews.author: Amanda N.
reviews.description: Firstly, we've been coming to this location since it opened, and before that to their old spot off of Lake Creek Pkwy. Secondly, they have the nicest staff, and their food is always delicious! If there's any issue, they handle it quickly and efficiently. They're also super clean, and have been really amazing with COVID protocols. I feel comfortable going back to the movies because of Alamo Drafthouse. Thanks for always going above and beyond!

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: This is a review for the family party movies that Alamo does.   We went to a Family Party on Sunday. This is our second time for a family party and they rock! 45 minutes before the movie they have crafts for the kids (seems like usually 3-4 stations) and then they have an interactive dance or activity at the front of the theater immediately before the movie. It makes the movie an event for the kids.   Now if I could somehow watch a movie I want to see while the kids watched their cartoon!

reviews.author: Matthew C.
reviews.description: My wife and I attended the Lord of the Rings: Fellowship of the Ring 3:00 p.m. showing at Lakeline Alamo on Saturday, March 27. It was our first public outing since last year before Covid-19 struck. We were excited and nervous to venture out, but trusted Alamo's protocols.  We walk into the theater and there is just one guy there, sitting a couple rows from the projector, American flag bandana for a mask sitting around his neck not covering his face, scrolling on his phone. He makes a couple calls and talks loudly, checking on his insurance apparently. He continues to do it halfway through the movie previews. My wife and I are already annoyed. Not a good start.  The movie begins and the guy behind us has been quiet for 10 minutes. Things seem to be turning for the better. That is, until a short while into the movie when he starts making comments aloud. "No!" to Gandalf leaving Frodo. "Asshole!" to Saruman betraying Gandalf. I grit my teeth and exchange glances with my wife as it continues, both of us hoping it subsides.  Nope. The loud asshole decides to keep making his commentary like it's his own personal screening. I finally have had enough of it about an hour into the film and place an order card that read "Please tell the guy behind us to stop talking! He keeps doing it!" The server comes five minutes later, takes it and nods. She does nothing.  Another 30 minutes goes by. This guy's behavior continues. He even plays a video on his phone for all to hear at one point. He's all I can focus on now, my enjoyment of the movie totally ruined. I storm out of the theater determined to get someone to kick him out.  I find a young guy with a pony tail who is clearly a server. I plea my case that this guy needs to go. He seems to take my request seriously and I return, hoping the Alamo's well-known policy of kicking out disruptors will finally be used on this guy ruining our movie.  Well, that wasn't the case. 10, then 20 minutes go by. I didn't see anyone come into the theater to handle it. The pest behind us makes comments aloud less frequently, probably because my wife yelled at him to shut up at one point. While I couldn't blame her for taking it into her own hands, I wanted the Alamo staff to do something about it like I know they should.  In retrospect, maybe it wasn't a bad idea because nothing was done to kick him out as I requested. The movie nears its end and the guy shouts again. Finally, we hear someone behind us address him, apparently letting him off with a warning. After all he had done throughout the course of the film to ruin the movie for us, it was far too little, far too late.  Amazingly, it actually worked that someone talked to him. He shut up for the 10 minutes left in the movie and didn't say anything during the cast reunion piece that followed the credits. So had the staff addressed this nuisance earlier like I wanted, perhaps this outing would have been salvagable. Mind you, I first brought it to the attention of the staff an hour into a THREE HOUR MOVIE. They finally say something to him with only 10-15 minutes left. Completely unacceptable, if you ask me.  Our server tells us shortly after one of her staff finally talked to the guy that she told a manager and that she was sorry the loud patron was like this. He seems "a little 'special,' you know what I mean?" is what she says. Whether that's true or not is frankly irrelevant. You have a policy in place that you remind patrons every single time they visit your theaters. No talking, no texting. Problem with a loud table? Raise an order card and a staff member will address it, eventually asking them to leave without a refund. Had this policy been followed as outlined, he should have been given a warning an hour into the movie and then instructed to leave without a refund 30 minutes later when I pleaded to the staff to take care of it. Case closed. The way it was handled in reality was an absolute joke and insult.  We were happy to attend this screening as our first outing. Now, after this incident, we will no longer give Alamo our business.

reviews.author: beep b.
reviews.description: i placed an order for food delivery, put instructions on how i wanted it, and when my food got here all of my instructions were ignored and in my opinion purposefully made wrong. i think if you're not even going to try to make something the way the person wants it, it becomes aggressive and personal. like what is the problem

reviews.author: Jed B.
reviews.description: This location has stadium seating and comfortable chairs with a smart table design. The Alamo Drafthouse has an excellent beer selection and some tasty food options.. Even for a  vegetarian.  The best part of the experience for me is that people are told to turn off phones and be quiet. No one else is doing this and it is a thoughtful reminder.  Although some people don't quite get it and continue to talk, there was enough attention to keep the majority of chatter box's quite:-)

reviews.author: Tamie F.
reviews.description: I love the Alamo Drafthouse. My go to place to catch a movie. I enjoy the avocado toast and French press coffee when I come to an early movie. Later movies it's the bacon and goat cheese pizza. I appreciate the fact they have beers from local breweries available as well! Of course, who doesn't love the no talking and no texting rule!

reviews.author: Rolando N.
reviews.description: Love coming to this location in the midweek afternoons. It's usually not crowded.   Alamo does cinema the right way. Love to get there a half hour early and watch the pre-show entertainment. It's unique, nostalgic, and always funny. None of the advertisement bombardment you get at other theaters.   The food is always excellent   The 2x2 burger is my favorite and I've never been disappointed. It's a 5 star version of the Big Mac. The Colorado steak salad is also a regular favorite.   Drinks are always cold and the buttered popcorn with real butter is ridiculously delicious.   Awesome selection of adult beverages.   Love this place.

reviews.author: Anna C.
reviews.description: My husband and I love coming to Alamo Drafthouse! A couple months ago, my husband and I had a bad experience, to which management was quick to reach out to us to resolve. They went above and beyond to make sure that experience was made up for. My husband and I were so happy and will continue coming to our favorite movie theater here at Lakeline.  Staff really do go beyond expectations and are always making sure you are having a good time.

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Went for Dinner and a movie 1/9/19. We were the first in line to get to our seats. It was my first time and my Wife and Sons second time. We were served pretty quickly. We loved the Pizza which was the Meat Pizza. It was hot and fresh. My wife was not a fan of the Chardonnay. My son thought his Pepperoni pizza was great and liked the Milkshake as well. We enjoyed the reserve seating. Just before the movie started we ordered some popcorn and a beer to split.   What cost them a star in my opinion was the Popcorn. It was really cold and without Salt or much Butter and taste like it was made at home. The main thing I like about the Movies is the Popcorn is always unbelievable. This was the opposite and was memorable for the worst reason. The other annoyance was the lack of under the table lighting when the bill arrived during the movie. I tried and quickly gave up so my wife finally figured out what we owed and paid in the dark. Not sure I have a fix just saying this is not good for older people with less then perfect night vision.  Definitely more to like than dislike here. We will be back.

reviews.author: Johnny B.
reviews.description: I've been wanting to come see a movie at the Alamo Drafthouse for almost a decade. Lo and behold, I am on production and me and my crew had a private screening. It was kind of a dream come true.  But I must say, the staff absolutely exceeded my expectations. Mainly Laura and Josiah, not only were they both very accommodating, but there are also very genuine.

reviews.author: Sean C.
reviews.description: This is our default date night spot for the wife and I. We recently purchased the season pass and love it. Their popcorn is seriously the best we have ever had. It's covered in ghee and we never get an un-popped kernel. It's something we crave and will forever compare every other one to.

reviews.author: Cindy M.
reviews.description: I used to love coming here, but have realized that it's just overpriced and uncomfortable all around. The food is not that great, the seats are definitely not comfortable and just too close to other people.   While they have a tempting kids menu, the booster seats make for an uncomfortable experience for the littles too.  The tables are not lit underneath like other locations and the theater is just too small, feeling like we are in a living room minus the comfort.   I just can't warrant a minimum $60 experience here..

name: Twin Peaks Round Rock
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Best nights on Wednesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: Casual atmosphere makes this place welcoming. The food and customer service keeps us coming back.   We have tried:  Triple Play - Served with guacamole, queso and salsa.  All three was great. The queso super creamy, the guacamole perfectly seasoned and the salsa was warm and not too spicy  Steak Salad - A large amount of steak lay on top of a freshly made salad - soo yummy  Beer Battered Fish and Chips - perfectly fried fish along side some seasoned French fries, cannot go wrong with this dish  Turkey Avocado Smash sandwich - Amazing sandwich and a must try  Blacked Fish tacos - There was pineapple in it which threw me off but otherwise, good tacos.  The fish was plentiful and you are served 3 large tacos with this dish along side some chips and that delicious salsa.

reviews.author: Hvnter B.
reviews.description: Been here 3 times and it's a fucking nightmare every time I come. Takes 10 minutes for a server to acknowledge you and then after she takes your order, you don't see her for 20 minutes.  I like Twin Peaks, especially the one in Odessa, but the service at this one just sucks ass.  3rd times the charm, probably won't be coming back to this one  Edit: only reason I'm giving it one extra star is because the jalapeño vinaigrette is fucking good

reviews.author: Matt W.
reviews.description: Food generally decent but unless you are a regular, staff seems to ignore customers.  Recent server  took our order then closed us out as we were getting food ( she was changing sections) and told us someone else would take care of future drink orders which I was clear I would need.  No one ever came back so we left and watched  remainder of playoff football game down the street at a restaurant that wanted our business. Young lady at front desk seemed to think it was no big deal and dismissed it at common practice.  I'm pretty sure this happened to several others in our section as well.

reviews.author: Yusmine V.
reviews.description: Best service!!! I lost my phone the night before. Which one of the servers found it in the toilet. She was kind enough to pull it out of the toilet! where I accidentally dropped it!

reviews.author: R R.
reviews.description: Great chicken wings!!! Great service....most of the gals are very sweet. (The girl at the front door (hostess) is crabby but no biggy.) the bartender is very good with staying on top of her customers needs. I do think there should be an employee bathroom because the gals have to hang out there and are in and out to maintenance their appearance, And as a customer it's not professional to go into a bathroom full of employees, whom are talking about customers, their hair and make up, their boyfriends etc. it makes me think that twin peaks doesn't value their employees enough to even provide them with a break/powder room.

reviews.author: MR M.
reviews.description: Went there last night and ordered the Texas style Philly cheesesteak it was god awful filled with peppers I picked out what little meat was in there and ask for my check and I was out of there

reviews.author: Ashley R.
reviews.description: Jordan was our server, she was great! I don't feel like the servers are usually that attentive or sweet but we still go because we love the beer and nachos!

reviews.author: Adam B.
reviews.description: I ordered pickup and was incredibly disappointed with the portion of soup they provided (this is the Bowl, not the cup!)

reviews.author: M P.
reviews.description: Placed an order online and called the restaurant after 15min to check if it's ready. The lady over the phone said it'll be ready in 8min. I walked in after 10min only to find out they are out of all chicken wings and they are going to refund my order. Funny story is I only placed the order for 12pc of chicken wings and she failed to inform me right when I called to check in on my order. It would have been nice to give a customer call if you're out of something rather than giving false information and making me come all the way there.

reviews.author: Emily K.
reviews.description: Armani was a phenomenal server. She is lively and beautiful and has great table etiquette. I cannot get over warming smile and kind words.  Alycia is such a rockstar. She's quick with her service and is so fun to make jokes with and loves to have fun while keeping it totally professional.  Christlynne and Kaylee are the BEST bartenders i've ever had. Their service is fast and quality. I don't recommend anyone else to make your drinks. Their chemistry behind the bar is unbeatable.

reviews.author: Ronny T.
reviews.description: Took forever to be seated and then seated at a table that had to be wiped down for food residue on tabletop.   Server was helpful but overall experience could have been better.  Not sure why it is so difficult for these restaurants (includes Hooters) to keep the place somewhat clean.  Food was okay but not something i long to reorder again.

reviews.author: Shayer S.
reviews.description: Good service. Like the lodge vibe. Lots of TV's around with various sports playing. The nachos are enormous - good enough for 4 people and pretty tasty too! They have a lot of specials during the weekdays, not too much during the weekend when we went though.  Clientele is varied...ranging from dudes by themselves to buddies watching the game to confederate flag t-shirt/jacket wearing fellas.   All in all, not as trashy as I was expecting and it was an interesting experience. The food was actually pretty decent so I may take out in the future but I don't think I'll be back to eat-in anytime soon.

reviews.author: Rueben A.
reviews.description: Twin Peaks Round Rock are thieves. Look out for waitress Rebecca and manager Justin will over charge your debit card extra $100.00. Beware of these employees and make sure you check your receipt.  If you are over charge file a complaint with Federal Trade Commission for fraud. BEWARE of these thieves.

reviews.author: Diego C.
reviews.description: So I'm leaving a second review after coming here fairly regularly over a year or so period.  Im also upgrading my review to 5 stars.  This location provides consistently high quality from the food to the service, and now the environment has been upgraded!  I really enjoy the new look.  The restaurant is more open and some of the tables are cafeteria style which promotes a social atmosphere.  There are still individual tables though.  Hell I usually sit alone.  I just like seeing people having a good time.   There are some stunning as well as super nice servers here but it has pretty much always been that way since I've been coming here.    They offer a variety of food on the menu including healthy choices and a veggie burger that is just fantastic.  Best of all it won't break the bank...unless you go stupid on the tip.  P10 is down the street haha.  But the servers do seem to build rapport with repeat customers.  Overall if you haven't been here in awhile, it's worth another visit.  I suggest Friday during happy hour.  You're welcome!

reviews.author: Sade H.
reviews.description: I came into Twin peaks, my first time since covid and when I say I had a fantastic time that's an understatement! My server Armani was lovely, energetic and very beautiful! Can't wait to come again

reviews.author: Nicki C.
reviews.description: I sure do hope they do reopen instead of deciding to stay closed!  My family and I recently ate here a few Saturdays ago for UFC, and it was awesome! We arrived early to get good seating. We were informed upon arrival (PRIOR TO BEING SEATED) if we stayed past 8PM that we would be charged $5 for the fights. This is nice because we've been places where they try to up charge customers unexpectedly long after the fights have been on.   From the Hostess to our server (Jax) we were given excellent customer service. Watching the fights there was good and the food was even better! You can't go wrong with those burgers!!!   We had our child with us, and it was still a good experience, all the girls were soo sweet and kind to her and she loves the attention! We love coming here with our daughter because they always treat us kindly!  Still recommend!

reviews.author: James L.
reviews.description: Amazing service, cold beer and great food!  Manager should know that Kaylee and Valencia are amazing. Such amazing service!

reviews.author: Connor K.
reviews.description: I know what you're thinking but the waitress Provided better service then any other restaurant I've been to in a long time the level of customer service that was provided was Impeccable I didn't have to get frustrated over waiting for something like the drinks or the appetizer or anything like that and when it came to a question on how something actually good on the menu I got a good straight honest answer so I was more than impressed.  Plus the baby back ribs that I had were probably the best barbecue I've ever had and that's saying something because I am a native Texan.

reviews.author: Elizabeth S.
reviews.description: If I could give 0 stars I would. I always praise this place just to have the worst service. Had the waitress stop by 2 tables and just walk past us like we were not anyone to wait on. I can't believe I wasted the last of my available time trying to eat at a place I enjoyed just to be disappointed.

reviews.author: LaRon E.
reviews.description: came into this establishment on a work visit with a colleague for a nice lunch break...  The waitresses were very friendly and attentive and the restaurant was clean..  Now as for the food thats a different story..I ordered the 10 oz sirloin steak and requested it to be medium rare... Well this steak must've just made parole because it was tougher than a convict who just serve 20 years... The asparagus was not fresh .. So the food gets 2 thumbs down..  This was my first time here.

reviews.author: Martina M.
reviews.description: New place in August 2020, Staff was super friendly and knowledgeable.  Table of 7 and not a morsel left on any plate!!  And we tried lots of items and not a bad one in the house!  Drinks are unique and taste yummy. Lots of variety for any tastebud. Everything was SO good!!!  Definitely a return trip in our future.

reviews.author: R C.
reviews.description: MY FAVORITE restaurant in Georgetown! If you come to Georgetown please make it a point to stop in you won't be disappointed! Cocktails are amazing and they're always coming up with some new tasty concoctions!  During the holidays they had eggnog to go, and it was hands down the best eggnog I have ever had!   Everything I have eaten here is a 10 out of 10! We have tried almost everything on the menu and I've enjoyed every dish!  Our favorite appetizer is the brussel sprouts and if you want to splurge get the steak dinner.....WOW!  It could be the best steak I have ever had!  The servers go above and beyond and are always cheerful and accommodating.  The ambiance is super cool and hip from the lounge chairs, to the wall accents, they did a great job designing it! The owners of this restaurant really put in the time and dedication to come up with such a great concept and a great addition to the downtown square. I just can't say enough good things about this place!

reviews.author: Christy V C.
reviews.description: I came here with our bridesmaid party for a lunch break during dress shopping and we had the best time! We ordered a few shareables for the table, including the Cantonese Riblets, Salt and Pepper Calamari and Carne Asada Fries. All three were delicious, but my favorite was hands down the riblets. They slid right off the bone and tasted a lot more authentic than I was initially expecting. The fries were the next runner up because you can never go wrong with fries covered in queso. For lunch, I ordered the Italian Sausage Burger. I really enjoyed it and it came with more waffle fries! I thought I'd love the sausage patty, however, I think I would have enjoyed a different protein to fill it out a little more. It was worth a try though!  The service was great here and everyone was super friendly. Parking can get a little tricky, but there's plenty of spots if you're not going at peak hours. I'm excited to stop by for dinner, when they have a lot more choices! I don't mind shareables, but I felt like the lunch menu was a little limited and nothing really stuck out to me.

reviews.author: Lindsay L.
reviews.description: Really, really disappointing.  My husband and I have two kids 2 and under, so date night isn't the most common thing.  We were excited to get out of the house and try this place!  My husband ordered the fried chicken and it was fine.  I ordered the steak frite and it was somewhere between luke-warm and cold.  Waffle fries are NOT good cold!  I told the waiter and he said he would "warm it up."  ...But he left it at the table!
