Then he proceeded to go help like 6 other tables and finally got back to me 15 min later (by now my husband was done with his chicken), and take my steak frite.  It was so confusing.  He said "sorry, I had to go check on other tables - I'll go heat it up now."  He came back with it literally 2 min later and it was EXACTLY the same - I swear, he didn't actually do anything.  I said "ummm...it's still cold." And he said "okay, I'll ask the manager if we can comp it."  WHAT?!?  Then he came back with a check and we paid and left.  I literally never ate!!!  I was so hungry!  I kept expecting him to bring something hot and it just never came!  He completely blew me off and didn't even try to make it right.  I don't care about something being comped or getting a free dessert or whatever, I just want to have dinner with my husband and actually eat (ha!)  when we arrange a babysitter and make it out!!!  We both commented we would have been better off at home cooking ourselves.  It was so bizarre!    Don't bother with this place!  The decor is super contrived - definitely trying to be something it's not.  The wine list is also very short and unimpressive - just a side note if you're looking for a nice glass.  So bummed.

reviews.author: Jason C.
reviews.description: I've been at this place before and I have to say that their whiskey drinks are above and beyond!  I personally prefer the good old fashion but there is a drink there for everybody's taste and if you're into spicy alcoholic drinks they do some of those just right as well!  While drinking we tried out some of their deviled eggs and I was happily impressed each one of them is for a flavor and unique although the Sriracha was my favorite!  I've had dinner here before and I can say it's worth it but for our trip we just had a couple drinks and sat on the patio which if that's all you're looking to do is completely OK this is a great place to go!!

reviews.author: Tracy N.
reviews.description: Awesome place to grab some delicious drinks and food! They have both indoor and outdoor patio. Our food came out in a reasonable time and the food was delicious! Really great atmosphere!  Finding parking wasn't hard, but if it's a busy night I can see how parking might be hard to find. We parked on the side street.

reviews.author: Christopher D.
reviews.description: Wow, I want to give this place 5 stars, and I hope they trend up but the food is a 3 star experience - at best.  Ambiance is perfect! Less than a block off the square in downtown Georgetown with plenty of free street parking [when Georgetown starts going to valets, I'm moving.] Lots of people walking around: this is a walking little town.  The place itself has a very expansive outside deck with even a few more street side tables - with the fans and heaters I'm betting you get 9-10 months of outside seating here.  Inside the bar is not large but it is gorgeous and there are some table tops as well as lounge seating - comfy old chairs, some Victorian love seats - its really charming and inviting. You will love the ambiance.  Service was fast, friendly and professional - I dealt with three different mixologists and not a surly one in the bunch [try finding that percentage of happy people in Austin...] and the make a wonderful drink. PS: wines on tap (they're not bad) and you have GOT to try a smoked Old Fashion (try the alder wood - its delicious smokiness in a perfect drink.]  PS: At least two rooms for private parties too if you need that holiday gathering!  Why no five stars then? Sounds great! It is great if you go for friends, drinks and good times. But unless we picked the worst entries - chicken and a burger - the food is underwhelming. My neighbor to one side also said her deviled eggs were just average. To be fair, the food was not bad, but it was not good and does not compare with other places around the square.  So; for drinks and maybe an appetizer and ambiance this has got to be on your short list. Think twice about this as a dining destination though - that may not be your best option.

reviews.author: JP N.
reviews.description: I'll start with what The Golden Rule (TGR) got right.  The service was awesome.  Our server was very efficient and personable with great attention to detail.    The food arrived quickly and was good.    The seasoning on the waffle fries was something new.  It reminded me of Old Bay, but with a hint of brown sugar?  It actually worked well.  What needs to improve - I'm glad the window looking out onto the street is gilded with the phrase "Always a Work in Progress.." (or words to this effect) since I have some suggestions/observations.  There are three areas to improve - Seating, Selection, and Atmosphere.  First, Seating - why am I sitting on a couch using a coffee table to eat?  I'm dropping nearly two bills on a meal for three people and I'm sitting on a couch using a coffee table?  Maybe if I was just there for a drink, it would be ok.  But not to actually eat a meal.  (I'm sorry about the queso which dripped on the floor. But again - it is tough to eat queso at a coffee table.)  Also, sitting by the huge glass window feels like being in a fish bowl.. People walking down the sidewalk can stop and watch you eat.  Actually, they DO stop and watch.  It happened at least twice while we were there.   It reminded me of an old "Twilight Zone" episode. In the episode, an astronaut crashes on Mars and ends up on display in a Martian zoo.  (After he crashes, the astronaut is scared at first, but the Martians are very kind to him and give him a house to stay in.  The Martians show the astronaut the house has all the conveniences and plenty of food.  When the Martians leave, the astronaut discovers the front door is locked and the window won't open.  Later, the astronaut wakes up to find the window open, with dozens of Martians staring inside the house.  The astronaut realizes he is actually the newest exhibit in a Martian zoo, not in a real house.)  There was a sign out front, "Earthling in his native habitat"  That's what this seating felt like.   Next, Selection - the beer selection is very slim.  The beer portion on the menu was (verbatim) as follows:     "Beers on Tap         Hazy IPA        Amber        Hefe        Lager  Ask your server for featured breweries..."  I asked the server about the vague beer list:  SERVER:  "And for you, sir?" ME:          "Yes, ma'am - Do y'all have Shiner?" SERVER:  "No, sir, we just have local beers." ME:          "Awesome.  What do you have from Barking Armadillo?"   SERVER:  "Nothing.  What kind of beer are you looking for?" ME:          "Something like a Shiner?" SERVER:   "We have Brooklyn Lager." ME:          "I'll just stick with water, ma'am..."  Brooklyn? Local? Similar to Shiner?  You say you have "local" beers but yet you have nothing from the local brewery just on the other side of I-35?  As far as Brooklyn - Every so often, I find a restaurant (usually around Dallas) which lists Shiner on the "Imported Beer" portion.  I guess geography - specifically Texas geography - is not their strong point.  TGR has the opposite perspective, since apparently Brooklyn is now local to Georgetown.  Finally - Atmosphere.  It is very loud.  It wants to be trendy.  I'm not sure how to fix that.   Maybe this is why I had to sit on a couch.

reviews.author: Tamie F.
reviews.description: Love this place! It's got a speakeasy feel right off the square in Georgetown! They have exclusive membership options that provide you with a locker for your special stash, so you always have your favorite spirit on hand. I know this because my little bro is a member. He's got a cool locker with some great whiskey in there, and they have a great selection as well.   There is limited seating inside so all of the seating feels exclusive! It's also just a fantastic feel inside and out. The patio is big and adorable, complete with a picture wall the screams social media opp! If I lived in Georgetown, this is where I would hang out. I will definitely make it my spot when I make it over to Gtown!   All of the food we had was interesting and tasty! The pimento app was not your grandma's pimento. It was creamy and not abrasive at all. The Brussels sprouts were so good I could have eaten a couple helpings myself! The sauce is the same for the shrimp, so I was in sweet and spicy heaven! I want more right now just writing this review. The fam enjoyed the chorizo app.   I had moved on to the smoked old fashioned by then and was completely captivated! I added a video that you should check out or just go and order one. The smoke adds to the experience AND taste! Yum. They have a small, but very good, draft selection, creative cocktail menu, and the option to drink your own spirits if you're a member. I can't say enough that I love this place!  Hunter did an amazing job as our server. He was friendly, attentive, and showed his fantastic personality.

reviews.author: Ramimi T.
reviews.description: I went here for the first time last week. The host asked me if I had a reservation, I did not, but they were still able to quickly get me a table. The atmosphere is very elegant, yet chill. The low light in the building added to the overall relaxed vibe. I ordered from the morning menu; there weren't as much options as I would have liked for there to be, so I just settled for the Calamari and Waffle Fries. The food came out much faster than I expected, so I am not surprised that it was a little cold. The food was delicious though... especially the sauce that came with the Calamari! The Ranch was very good and paired well with the food! The sweet tea was average, yet still good. The price is a little much for the quality/amount of the food. I plan on going back in the evening and ordering off of the evening menu.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: I was impressed with the entire evening. It's been a while since I've been to a restaurant where I loved everything I tried and had great service! It seemed like most people visiting sat out on the patio or at the bar. We were celebrating our anniversary so we made a reservation on a weeknight, but unless you want to secure a spot outside, I don't think you'd need one.   We ordered the glazed brussel sprouts app, the carne asada fries app, and the sea bass to split. Each dish was delicious for different reasons. The glaze on the brussels was addicting, the queso on the fries was delish, and the sea bass came out piping hot with a tasty chimichurri and sautéed vegetables. I would recommend every dish we tried, but my favorite was by far the brussels. We topped dinner off with the blonde brownie w/ ice cream - yyyuuummmm.   For cocktails: Our waiter suggested the Love is Blind with a spash of pineapple - tricky little drink. It tasted like candy but found out halfway in that there was definitely a good amount of liquor in it! The G'old fashioned was classic and strong.   Service was top notch. I wish I remembered his name, but he was super friendly and had great recommendations.

reviews.author: Rebecca L.
reviews.description: Only place in Georgetown that is a bit more like a lounge. Something different, more city like and either you'll love it or you'll wish it stays more country. Well I like it for it's modern atmosphere. We got drunken fried and all the cocktails seems good mixes just a bit more alcohol would be nice. One star knocked off because of that and the waitresses seems slightly uppity. No one extra welcoming and excited to converse with us aside from the smiling hostess.   Will still come back since I like the environment.

reviews.author: Nikkita F.
reviews.description: Very cool vibe and spot in the middle of downtown Georgetown! They have a great covered patio and the whole restaurant is very cute.   We got the following: -  Brussel sprouts - soo good, would get again! - shisito - pretty average tasting - pecan crusted chicken - very good  - steak frites - the steak was pretty bland for me but fries were delish  - my family loved the deviled eggs

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Date night for the wife and me. Stating off, the drinks were really good. Only downside was that we were looking forward to the cocktail flight but they don't allow on Saturday night (it's a major item on the menu - should be noted if it's only during the day).   For food, everything we had was really good. The Brussels sprouts and the fries (yes fries - you could actually taste the potato) were standouts. Lost of sauces to pair with things too. The only downer was the queso - good taste but the tostadas were a bit stale and the queso itself was a bit congealed by the time it reached the table.   Will be happy to come back - a great option for something a bit more upscale in Georgetown.

reviews.author: Morgan M.
reviews.description: Really cute little spot! Loved our drinks and the food was delicious as well. Hope to return soon!

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: I was so impressed by The Golden Rule. From the decor to the atmosphere to the menu and creative bar offerings - this spot definitely takes it to the next level as far as dining in Georgetown goes. Everything on the appetizer menu was delicious - loved the deviled eggs and the steak against the grain. I really wish they offered the craft cocktail flight during dinner service as it looked really fun to try. I would absolutely recommend making a reservation to make sure you get a table. The only downside was the service could have been a little better. Several items that we ordered were forgotten and our waitress was not very friendly. However, overall I really enjoyed coming here and would love to come back to try brunch. Definitely a great option if you're looking to eat somewhere on the square.

reviews.author: Delia S.
reviews.description: I've been to The Golden Rule a couple of times and it is becoming one of my favorite Gtown spots for drinks and nosh. The drinks are largely bourbon based, which I love, but they have standard bar fare and beer as well.   The food is delicious and I think it's a testament to say that even the fried bologna sandwich is a winner!  The patio is lovely for this time of year and fairly generous in size. I really hope they can survive the upheaval of the dining industry during these crazy times.

reviews.author: Jacki B.
reviews.description: We came here because Monument cafe had a long wait. The menu seemed fine. The wait staff was super friendly and helpful. (Apparently COVID isn't here, no one wears masks!!)  We had the chorizo (not) hummus and the bluther. The hummus was good but the pita was fried and stale, pretty much inedible. The bluther should have been way  better but was premade, dry biscuits, mediocre chicken strips and water thin gravy. Cocktails were just ok. Cool place but sadly  the food is just not good.

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: We really wanted to like it. The vibe is good.  The hostess/waitress was nice, but the food: Waffle fries were old/not fresh.  Roast beef au jus was skimpy on meat and quality. Spouse compared it to Arby's.  Sausage burger was the only thing that was interesting. Although spouse didn't like it, I thought the flavors went well together.

reviews.author: Sky N.
reviews.description: My fiancé and I came here tonight for the first time and enjoyed our experience. Staff was good and we both got the chicken fried steak.  The fact that I was still thinking about it after I left proves to me that it was one of the best Chicken Fried Steaks I've ever had. We'll be back!

reviews.author: Evan L.
reviews.description: Went here with my family for dinner for the Thursday $15 special (Half-rack ribs or tri-tip steak + 2 sides + pizookie) around 7. It took around 30 minutes to get seated which was understandable since they were pretty understaffed. I got the house salad with blue cheese dressing and tomato bisque soup as my sides. Both were pretty tasty although nothing super special. Portion sizes were really great though and could've been enough for dinner for me without the steak. I would definitely recommend coming for the Thursday special if you're looking for a good deal!   My family only ate one of the pizookies and got the other three to go. Our server Elias was very thoughtful and packed the ice cream and the mousse in separate containers from the pizookies to prevent them from getting soggy. I appreciated Elias providing great service despite the restaurant being understaffed.

reviews.author: Josie J.
reviews.description: Ordered BJ's today through grub hub. My husband got deep dish ziti and at first glance it looked fine. Then he went in and there was a puddle of grease at the bottom. The pasta was so oily and tasted terrible. This is ridiculous considering the price of the dish was $16+.  I got a Buffalo pizza and it was okay.

reviews.author: Paco P.
reviews.description: Great place to hang with your media naranja or fam. Good choice of beer and great food, cant go wrong with BJ's specially with a Stone IPA on you lol

reviews.author: Ed L.
reviews.description: If you are going to eat at a chain restaurant in Austin, BJ's is a good choice. Food is good, sriracha Brussels sprouts are a fave. Great in house beers, especially the red.

reviews.author: Steve W.
reviews.description: I wanted to go tonight and have a drink and some appetizers. I wanted to call and make a reservation the recording directed me to an app. I installed the app and it tells me there are no restaurants near me when I live 2 1/2 miles from the nearest BJ's. I called the store to see if they would put me on the waitlist and they patently refused despite their app not working. Sorry BJ's, you don't get my money tonight!  That is shitty service!!

reviews.author: JoAnna F.
reviews.description: Our waitress Nicole was very friendly and although she was busy, she made sure to come and check on us frequently. She has a beautiful personality and great customer service skills. The food was all good (like usual). We ordered some pizza, wings, and fish n chips. Oh yeah and cannot forget about the chocolate chip cookie and ice cream (yum).

reviews.author: Joel T.
reviews.description: Ive dropped in a here a few times for brew and a bite. The last time I went (July 2021) they had indoor seating on a limited scale. The tables in the bat area were closed to open seating. Though I was able to sit at the bar proper and received very quick, courteous service from the bartender and food runners. The queso is pretty good and comes in a generous portion. They have good, in house beers, the Kolch style and Red are good. They also have a good domestic and international beer selection too. You might have a little more than usual delay being seated but thats the COVID after effects...

reviews.author: Nika L.
reviews.description: We like go to BJ's and love the one in Cedar park, when I saw low reviews for this one I was thinking, how this can be? Well, it was two times when we tried, and both times we had to leave because we were treated so bad, we could not beleive, starting from hostess (very rude). Horrible place.

reviews.author: Phuong C.
reviews.description: Food was good. Service could have been better.  No straws, no checking up or refilling liquids.

reviews.author: Brooke H.
reviews.description: The calamari was amazing! Cooked perfectly! French fries were hot and crispy! Coleslaw was not good very bland. The Philly would of been better if the meat was seasoned! Lighting was very dark to read the menu. Will go back!

reviews.author: Lou Lou O.
reviews.description: So underwhelming. First the waitress had a "smart ass" attitude when asked about the size of portions. I did not appreciate this. The entrees were all barely warm and cool to the touch. Within a few minutes we were eating cold food. The $17 Alfredo bowl was dry and cold. The garlic knot was cold. The hamburger was tasteless despite having fried jalapeños and chipotle Mayo. The meat needed seasoning. The fries, although tasty, were cold. The tea had a strange bitterness to it. They probably need to clean out their machine. The only thing palatable were the avocado egg rolls as I love the tamarind sauce. They were piping hot. We got 2 orders for a total of 12 costing $26. We should've stopped there. In the end the manager did comp the Alfredo but for high prices and below par food and service I'd say go elsewhere. BTW we loved BJ's when we lived in McAllen (this location was epic!) so this experience was very disappointing.

reviews.author: Beverly S.
reviews.description: Never again! It's been years since I last ate at BJs and now I remember why smh. This meal was horrible, if negative stars were possible that would be my rating. Ordered the "slow roasted" tri-tip and it was the toughest cut of meat I've ever encountered so this piece must have been "rush roasted". The overall flavor of the meat would have been pretty decent if the meat were actually edible. Also ordered the fettuccine alfredo, comes with chicken and broccoli. Not bad but oddly tastes exactly like a Marie Callendar's TV dinner so at this point I'm convinced they purchased a family size dinner, warmed it, placed in their own packaging then sprinkled some Parmesan on top. Normally, I'd just take the loss but in this case I want my money back, this is just unacceptable.

reviews.author: Victoria B.
reviews.description: My first experience; ordered delivery through LunchDrop. Outstanding! I'm gobbling before my next class. Wonderful!

reviews.author: Matty L.
reviews.description: Amazing experience! The take out hostess was incredibly helpful with my order. I thought I placed an online order but mistakenly forgot to hit "submit" ; she helped me though the process without making me feel like i made a dumb mistake, and offered to place my order on the grill immediately! I only waited about 10 minutes and my food was ready. Also picked up a to-go 6 pack and the night we saved! Shout out to the other order runner for keeping me posted with updates on my order. A* customer service, I'll be back for sure! Thank you -Matty

reviews.author: Jessica B.
reviews.description: I've always enjoyed BJ's until this past Christmas Eve. My mom and I decided to use BJs curbside for our Christmas Eve dinner, just some burgers and fries. Well, when we brought home our order we were without fries. Bad on us for not checking the order when it was delivered to our vehicle before we drove home. I called BJs to explain what happened. I fully realize that they were busy due to the Holiday. I understand the pressures restaurants face during these times. But, I was told to come back to get the fries, which by then our burgers would be cold. The gentleman on the phone, who I'm sure was just having a bad day because he wasn't to friendly or apologetic, then offered a refund. He took down my information but I've yet to be refunded. I basically spent $33 on two hamburgers from BJs. Very disappointing as this was our Christmas Eve dinner and I'm on such a tight budget as it is. Needless to say, I won't be dining or doing curbside with BJs any longer.

reviews.author: Perry T.
reviews.description: I used to love eating here. But now, since the pandemic has lifted, the wait time is 40 minutes to an hour! Why? The place is half full and they don't have the help to serve a whole restaurant. Some of y'all need to get off your lazy duffs and go back to work! Your year of socialism is NOT sustainable.. BJs is also still enforcing social distancing through table restrictions. In their bar the two end tables were restricted but all the ones in-between were occupied (go figure).

reviews.author: C M.
reviews.description: I'm already having a good time... Layne... took care of my family and myself. Service was on point all the while things picked up at the restaurant. But more importantly, Layne made me feel like I was Batman and he was Alfred... how did I come to this kind of service? It's one thing to have a million dollars but Layne made me feel like a million bucks. Layne... I hope you get a raise, hell, I hope you run a BJ's yourself. You know how to make people feel like they are the only ones in the restaurant where they feel like they are getting the best service. Again thank you for a wonderful experience my dear Alfred. Cheers to you and all your endeavors.

reviews.author: Jacqueline E.
reviews.description: We had a terrible and extremely frustrating experience here one day, and when I emailed them about the issues (because I didn't want anyone else to go through what we went through) I got a very kind response from the AGM apologizing and assuring us that she'd look into it.   Other than this one very weird time, we've had good experiences here :) love the avocado rolls and Brussel sprouts and beer!

reviews.author: Fatima A.
reviews.description: i come to bjs every tuesday for $3 pizookies. This week i decided to branch out and go to the round rock location opposed to the cedar park location...that was my first mistake. There was a long wait, no problem i understand and didn't mind. As soon as me and my acquaintance sat down, our waitress haley was there to serve us. My friend asked for a children's menu which the cedar park location always allows. Haley said no until we begged and told her the other location gives it to us no problem. She hesitantly gave in. i felt as though she did not respect my friend and i at all because of our age. Later at the time of payment my friend asked if they offer a military discount, normal question right? My friends father was in the navy, serving our country, fighting for our freedom, for 22 years. My friend has a valid military ID with her picture on it that she was ready to present. Instead our server haley, when presented with the question of weather or not they offer a military discount said in a very belittling tone "your not in the military" instead of saying that they don't offer the discount for family members. When i go out to eat anywhere i always leave a very large tip, well over 20% because i work in a restaurant and i know the servers depend on these tips for their livelihood. I feel as though haley was rude and didn't deserve a tip that was anymore than 20% though. The way she spoke to us was belittling and there was so much better ways she could have said these things to us.

reviews.author: Amy S.
reviews.description: Service has really taken a dive.  I am not talking about speed of food.  The last couple of times I have been there the dinner has been "off ".  We went on Saturday and the waiter took our order (family of four).  The kids food came out first and my husband's and mine came out about five min later.   My husband's stake was rare.  The waiter had walked away right after dropping off food.  He didn't come back for several minutes.  When he did he took the stake.  He didn't come back w it for about ten min.  Our family had finished eating before the stake ever came back.   When it came back it was over done  They didn't take it off the bill.  No apologies.  We understand staffing may be an issue with all that is going on.  Until staffing is fixed?  I would avoid here.   This used to be one of my favorite places

name: Shooters Billiards and Sports Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Wednesday, Saturday

reviews.author: Jip Z.
reviews.description: Came in on a Thursday, some aggressive lady with glasses and bun, answers the door with "Do y'all have ID's?" We said yea and showed ours, then she says "So then talk to this dude at the door"... I walk in and there's a table with some merchandise on it and this little man, asked if we were there for the event? I said "we didn't know there was an event" and then he said it was $25 per person... well we didn't know, we just came for a drink and some parents night out. So I said sorry and we excused ourselves and then this same lady at the front was smoking outside so I said "Sorry, we didn't know it was an event" and she snarkily says "Yeah! it's dwarf wrestling!" Like I should be ashamed of not knowing this. I feel stupid, my bad.... But maybe next time have a sign on the door! We read the entire door and no sign about this, a cover of $10-15 we would pay but we didn't want to do $25 per person, since we had not  arrived for the event. I think if you have an event, try being a bit nicer. Some people are not regulars and just want to come over and you could sell it a bit, instead of making us feel bad for not know about your poorly advertised event.  I still like this bar and I like that people can smoke in doors (although I'm not a smoker) we have enough bars we can go too and this one is for smokers, so I don't have an issue and I know what I'll smell like when I leave.

reviews.author: Connor A.
reviews.description: Don't expect covid protections here. It's a no frills pool hall in Texas. Nobody in the establishment is wearing a mask, including the bartenders and waiters. If that's not a problem for you, then you're in for a good time.   We came in on a Tuesday night and easily found a pool table to ourselves. We opened a tab and had no trouble getting drinks without having to leave our games. The mixed drinks are nothing to write home about, but we had an excellent time drinking and playing pool. We also easily played some table shuffle board. They have computer slots/keno games to gamble with in a shady corner is that's something you're into.   The place was acceptably clean and the staff were all very friendly. Just make sure you have a VALID drivers license regardless of your age! This was place was a good time and I'll definitely be back again in the future.

reviews.author: Kris R.
reviews.description: The music was great, the service was pretty good, I was kind of a put off and that's the reason I wrote this two star review is because of the BS of smoking indoors at this place. When I got home everything smelled like cigarettes. This is completely illegal and just downright nasty. Everybody knows secondhand cigarette smoke is really bad for you so open up a flipping window if you're gonna let people smoke. If you're too lazy to go outdoors to smoke then this place should be regulated by the health department better, this isn't your house, and no one saying you can't do something but it's just nasty and it's really bad for your health right now my throat is on fire because I've been breathing secondhand smoke I don't wanna sound like a whiner or entitled millennial but it secondhand smoke dude and it's nasty.

reviews.author: Jason L.
reviews.description: Shooters been a great home for me for 14 years, it has been like my Cheers bar, after a stressful day of work, on my way home I stop in, staff is always friendly, I love the entertainment offered, Golden Tee, pool, sweepstakes, karaoke, bands on weekends. Staff has always been good to me over the years, and have been like family, met many current friends because of Shooters. Never a cover, and probably the best drink prices of any bar.  This place has great potential, but they need to make the best of some of its best assets, especially the use that beautiful patio more for events, music, etc. You should have a solo acoustic artist out there in spring/summer/fall and promote some games on the patio, it just seems as it's used as wasted space currently, and that's a shame.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Stopped by with others for a quick pop as we were beered out from Whitestone's delicious Oktoberfest beer. Bartender was patient with us as we pondered our last cocktail of the day. Notice I said day not evening. We settled on shots (why not??!!). We all received generous pours at a reasonable price.   Shooters is a great sports bar with multiple TVS (they do have the NFL ticket). There are plenty of pool tables and games to keep you occupied. I would definitely come here to watch games but the cigarette smoke stench is too much for me, and I'm a cigar smoker. We visited for about 10 minutes and my clothes stunk of smoke. I wish they would go smokeless like their other venue on 620 or at least add some additional smoke eaters. If you are a smoker it is a 5 star joint... for others 3 makes it AOK and a fair rating.

reviews.author: Jeff D.
reviews.description: Love this bar. Great atmosphere, friendly bar tenders,  and good drink selections. Monika, Shelby, and the entire staff are the best

reviews.author: Paul L.
reviews.description: Shooters is the worst bar I've ever been to. Service sucks and the staff was extremely rude and all their glasses were dirty.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: Sunday pro football here is the best! $2 zeigenbach and $1.50 cheeseburgers and hotdogs off the grill. Can't beat it! Outdoor seating and smoking inside. Great place to watch football    * they don't have the cheeseburgers and hotdogs outside any longer but still a great place to watch any game you want. Please read reviews and understand it is a smoking bar and if that will make you mad don't come

reviews.author: Toni G.
reviews.description: Two things about this bar. They allow smoking. Which I could have left, I know. Second, if you keep a tab open they automatically add 20% gratuity to your bill! There was only 2 of us. There's nothing posted about this. We were tipping the bartenders as we ordered. So on top of the $32 in tips we gave, we were forced to pay another $23 on our bill. They should have a notice if you plan on keeping your tab open, a gratuity is automatically added. Even for a party of 2. Ridiculous

reviews.author: Sean G.
reviews.description: Unable to show the Texas longhorn game in the ATX is sad.  Drinks where really good and the pool tables where nice.

reviews.author: John T.
reviews.description: Good pool hall in a good location. It's a bit divey, but the prices make it worth it. If you like to hook up with ugly fat chicks or wrinkly smokers, then this is the spot. The Best Western is walking distance, just in case you drank too much.  I don't know if they still do free pool on Monday nights. That's a good chance to work on your game and save a few bucks. But watch out for scumbags. The meth-heads tend to pour in on this night.  Every now and then there's a few tough guys, but every town has 'em.

reviews.author: Jason D.
reviews.description: Really disappointed at how this place has changed. New GM or manager or whatever has no clue on customer service and taking care of people that come in more times than others. And the waitress was rude to a friend after closing out and said "Have fun with your Slut Pants".... Whatever that means..... Really..... Keep it classy CP!!  Fast Eddie's is the place to go if you don't won't the Jerry Springer drama!!

reviews.author: Steven S.
reviews.description: It's a smelly filthy place.   Ridiculous low end pool tables I wouldn't think about playing on.  Go back in the kitchen and look for yourself how filthy it is.   The entire place smells like a wet old homeless person.

reviews.author: Young K.
reviews.description: This is nice and cool place to hang out with friends and family.. dates..cause live music and play pools..also friendly great services from bars and wait staff..i am enjoying and have a great time on my each visit...thanks for all great services to management!!!

reviews.author: Jason L.
reviews.description: We went on a friday night and the place was relatively busy. Drinks were good, but the way under staffed for a friday night. The only reason I'm giving it a 4 star is for the fact that our waitress was trying soooo hard. She was running drinks, bar backing, cooking food and bartending. Also not to mention she was the only waitress there. But all in all we had a great time!

reviews.author: Jennifer Y.
reviews.description: Great place to hang out but they have smoking and for me that is a HUGE minus because I believe that such places should keep the environment clean and focused on the pool players.

reviews.author: Manda L.
reviews.description: The bartender, an older gentleman, has been extremely rude on the 3 occasions we have visited this bar.  The bar set up is great, but with rude staff like this why would I want to come back.  Bad service lost you 4 ladies who spend a good amount and tip well....and earned you a bad review.  If your staff is so miserable they cannot give good service, maybe it's time to clean house.

reviews.author: Nickie B.
reviews.description: A-OK place, but be warned you WILL smell like smoke if you come here.  They offer a bar with ample seating, plenty of individual tables for seating, several pool tables, have a stage (that was empty when we visited), have an outdoor patio and an add collection of gambling machines in the back corner.  I am sure it is not real gambling, but the game players certainly looked like they were in Vegas.  Prices are reasonable.  Would not come out of my way to come here, but it is a decent dive bar.

reviews.author: Danny M.
reviews.description: Let me just place some facts here as a ex customer!!   1. Chris is the rudest person there!! He treats everyone really bad and makes you feel like crap! So you go pay to get horrible service from him.   2. If you go gamble be prepared to share the machines with the workers as they are on their shift and serving you drinks as they have their machine on auto play and by that I've only seen one person dong this by the name of Desiree or Mrs Des for short.  Last time I saw her was a few weeks ago when I went after work to enjoy myself for a few drinks and even tho I go alone I do have friends there and she was so occupied playing and asking around if her machine was paying her a lady was complaining about how she hadn't give her her change back. It took her a long time to pay that lady back. It's not the first time I've seen her playing specially when it's slow but busy days won't stop her. Chris and her make a fabulous team as far as proving the worst service!!   3. Misty and the rest of the girls are the best workers there.   Too bad they lost me as a customer and will never spend one cent on that place ever again. Seeing employees playing as they work while others risk their hard worked money was the end of that. I already had enough with Chris being rude when you bother him because it seems that way. Good luck Shooters! This place has gone down hill since the past 6 months or so!!

reviews.author: Amgad E.
reviews.description: this place is terrible. They are racist and horrible. I came here to have a beer and for no reason the bar tender decided I was to leave. I had no problem with leaving as long as he refunded the beer I didn't even take a sip off - except he wouldn't. In fact he called d the cops and lied to them that I was disturbing the peace. I never  been more humiliated and disappointed before... this place is a total trash can for trashy racists

reviews.author: Jeff U.
reviews.description: Called in order While I was 30 mins away   Said he needed 15   Cool no prob   Arrived and waited 20   Ok ok I'm alright   Double pepperoni was so good. I do prefer more sauce but, still good.   The pepperoni had the crunchy edges I like   Took home a piece of red velvet and Italian cream for my last    We both loved it all   Only one register so slow going but I recommend you try this out if the was gas station pub.   Serve alcohol on site and sell NUMEROUS types of beers microbrew stuff-more than I've seen most places.

reviews.author: Josh N.
reviews.description: I ordered the mushroom and sausage pizza for my wife and I. I ordered like thirty minutes before it told me to pick up.  When I got there, I waited an extra 15 minutes for the pizza. So 45 minutes after I ordered.  Normally that's not that bad but there was literally 5 people in the whole restaurant. 2 of them were working. That's pretty slow.    Brought it home and honestly I've had better frozen pizza.  It was real doughy and lacked a lot of flavor. Minimal sausage and the mushrooms. I bit off a piece and the cheese completely came off the pizza and there was barely any sauce holding the cheese on.  It was heavy on the dough and nothing else.   Unless they change the recipes and use more fresh ingredients, I won't be back.

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: The fries are fantastic. Worth the up charge from the chips. Unfortunately the burgers always have the potential to be amazing and are at times but more than not, they're over cooked and dry. I just picked up 3 burgers and spent $43 and they were all over cooked - again. The fries were great though.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: High Country Market and GastroPub was a great local place and my first time visiting, not my last that's for sure. There is a wide selection of beers and wines and saw people coming here just for the 6-packs of craft beers. I got the Philly cheesesteak and really enjoyed it and the fries. Go check this place out off Gattis in Round Rock.

reviews.author: Adam T.
reviews.description: Great pizza, fantastic beer selection.  Slow, rude, snarky service from the aged bar tender.    Brought in a group of four, and bar tender insulted me and my beer choice after I sampled a hazy ale, asked if he had a pale ale, and settled on a Yuengling.   He then ignored my wife when she tried to place order. The place was dead slow on a Monday night. I used to come more often, probably won't be back. There are plenty of places to grab a beer.

reviews.author: Alexis B.
reviews.description: Wow pleasantly surprised by this recommendation and now I tell everyone who lives nearby about this.   High Country is a gas station..... with a bar in it, food, oh and casually 100s of different kinds of craft beer. Need I say more?   We stopped in on a Sunday to check out the selection and ended up staying for a beer and a burger.   The food: amazing and fresh. We did the $5 Sunday burger special, and might I mention the KETCHUP. I believe it's truffle ketchup, has me drooling about when I get to try it again.   The bar: great selection of beers on tap, they also have a whole selection of wine. In addition to the tap they have a variety of bottles in the fridge you can also pick from. They do Monday ALL DAY pint happy hour for $3.50, which is as cheap as they come by and local brewery tap takeovers on Thursday. Speaking my language.   The beer Togo: gosh almighty this is the place to get craft beer, but careful they aren't all cheap! They also have Pacifico in a can and a fabulous selection of commercial and domestic beer. They have fridges full of cans from breweries EVERYWHERE, not just Texas beer. They then have a whole large bottle section and more. If you like to try new brews - get here now!   If this didn't sell you ^ the people were also tremendously helpful and personable. Stop in if you are nearby and be ready to turn from skeptical to a regular. Shout out to the owners of Southern Heights (my fave brewery if you read that review) for introducing us to this place.

reviews.author: Gregg M.
reviews.description: We continue to enjoy High Country Market and Gastropub for it's wonderful pizzas, craft beers on tap and casual ambiance. Our go-to pizzas are the pepperoni and the Hawaiian with pineapple and ham. We always ask for extra crispy crust and it never disappoints.  This time I got a great local craft growler that we enjoyed when we got home with the pizza.  Really hate to see our local neighborhood places struggling to stay afloat with just take out. Glad the stay at home orders are easing up.  I still ask fellow Yelpers to tip extra these days.  We'll continue to be regulars here.  Cheers!

reviews.author: Matthew M.
reviews.description: I cannot rate the food, and still may give it a shot in the future since it really does seem like my kind of place, but they wouldn't serve me.  Yelp says it closes at 10pm and the actual website seems to be hacked or given up on.   I showed up at 7:30pm they says kitchens closed, as the guy just finished putting down food in front of another customer.  I've worked food service back end. I didn't in any way want them to cook for me after closing the kitchen. It's not the cooks fault, but the front end had no explanation other than tough luck.  For a word of mouth, I'd expect a little more attention to those details and

reviews.author: Allyson L.
reviews.description: Visited for lunch today. The food was incredible, wagyu burger was delicious. The truffle rosemary ketchup is a must!  Visited during COVID and the place was clean, they're following all recommended precautions and I felt completely safe eating inside.   Will be back ASAP!

reviews.author: Cliff E.
reviews.description: This bar/gastro pub,always keeps great beer on tap, and the food is amazing,  I love the patty melt add bacon, on toasted rye bread.

reviews.author: Keith M.
reviews.description: Food is great, but they need to update their information. Phone number rings off the hook without an answer, and kitchen times are WAY OFF. Menu shows breakfast available at 630am, but when I went in to get food...they said their kitchen doesn't open until 11am...seems pretty counter intuitive when serving breakfast items...

reviews.author: Tim C.
reviews.description: My wife loved her taco and I enjoyed my broken yolk BLT with unlimited Katz coffee from Houston.  They have an amazing selection of beers and wine.  The Katz coffee was superb and they have a selection of three different roasts to choose from, me likey!

reviews.author: Joseph S.
reviews.description: The "pancakes" that come with the pancake breakfast are actually closer to silver dollar pancakes, and they don't have ANYTHING to put on the toast   I asked for butter for the SINGLE thinnest piece of Texas toast I've ever seen, and they didn't have that or any jelly or cream cheese or ANY topping to put on this.  3 eggs, half a potato, two strips of bacon and a single slice of dried toast are not worth $8. Save your money and

reviews.author: Jaclyn V.
reviews.description: This is food in a gas station and it taste like it. The food is not worth even a drive around the corner.  There are too many great places around to waste your time or money.  Staff is not friendly.

reviews.author: Brett J.
reviews.description: What a great place for a beer and good food!!  If you haven't come here yet I highly recommend it for, if nothing else, their beer selection! They have the coolest draft beers on tap of just about any place I have been! And they do not cost a ton either!  I got the temptress mole and at 13% alcohol it was only 6$!!!! WOWZERS!  They constantly roll in and out different beers on tap and have a large cooler filled with other interesting types too... just can't go wrong!  Their wine selection is something to be cherished too... seriously... you have got to try this place!  Since the last time I was here it does seem to have slipped a bit in maintenance... light in hall way not working, icee machines down... cooler for sodas really low... and the extra TVs in eating area are off... I think we need to rally for this establishment!  For a gas station restaurant it is really so very very cool! You can't beat the selection! I don't want to see this place fold up... it truly is a coo cool coo place!

reviews.author: Terry K.
reviews.description: This is a great local gem but everyone in the Austin area should know about it and stop by for their amazing wine selection!!! amazing pizza (crazy incredible ingredients) and great service to boot. Join their wine club, pick up a pizza pack to make at home and stop by to say hi to the owner Zahir. You will make this a great destination to meet friend, take you family and just have fun.

reviews.author: Jay N.
reviews.description: hey my first time,here very impressive little store. It has,wine,beer and other knickknacks. It's also part diner, friendly courteous service and pretty good coffee. A new stop on my morning walk,when in Round Rock.I deafly will stop again and enjoy some of the other offerings of this store

reviews.author: Gabrielle F.
reviews.description: The food was amazing! That rosemary truffle ketchup is what's up. Only thing I'd say is for to go orders maybe use better packaging cause all the juices from burger kiiiinda spilled lol but It wasn't crazy..definitely going again

reviews.author: Sarah N.
reviews.description: I absolutely love this place. It's a hidden gem with great food, great beer, and great service!  Definitely opt for the rosemary ketchup. It's legit.  Their pizza is bomb. Their fries are great. Burgers are just okay, but I guess you can't have it all, right?  Go there - you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Penny J.
reviews.description: I'm puzzled after my last visit.  My Son ordered a glass of Cabernet Sauvignon and they said they didn't have any.  So we ordered a glass of Sauvignon Blanc and they said they didn't have that either.  My Son came and asked me what else I wanted since they didn't have either so I walked up and asked what they had.  The guy brings a bottle of Cabernet Sauvignon and said I have this. I laughed and said ok let me get a glass please. So if you specialize in wine, why not educate your bartenders on wine. There seemed to be only 3 bottles out of wine they were pouring.  Pizza was good. It was a busy Friday and everyone just seemed too busy and not customer friendly at all. I guess you have to be a regular and sit at the bar to get smiles.

reviews.author: Char S.
reviews.description: This is my playground. My Disney Land. My basketball court. My football field... my... my.... home away from home. Idk why but this liquor store is just much more exciting than others lol. When you can't find what you want else where this place has it. So just come here first. Their options are fun to me.

reviews.author: Zachary M.
reviews.description: This posted elsewhere but I bought the final bottle of a new tequila held by the store clerk who was very friendly and I needed up paying cash for a bottle of scotch too. In all Paige was very helpful, thanks. "I'll be back"

reviews.author: Brad S.
reviews.description: I've lived in the area since 2001 and have been going to Moon Dance for my adult beverages for years. If you're looking for hard liquor, take a look a their selections. If you are looking for beer or wine, go somewhere else. They used to have a good stock of specialty, quality beer and wine. For example, they used to have a good selection of micro-brewery beers, but now storied brands like Pabst Blue Ribbon seem to be the taking up most of the shelf space. The quality of wines have slid as well. My last visit there a couple days ago for Rieslings resulted in looking through a selection of less than 10 choices, all of which I was unfamiliar. The recommendations by staff resulted in two bottles ... one of which had lovely hints of chemicals and gasoline (lots of TDN; obviously a late harvest grape that had decomposition of the veins within the grape) ... and the other bottle offered notes of cat pee ... absolutely disgusting cheap, creamy crap. MD 20/20 would be a step up. I'd like to support my local business, but I'm quite done ... no more ... I'll make the trip across town to Total Wine from now on.

reviews.author: teresa t.
reviews.description: 1st I don't drink, but other members of the house do. Very clean, super nice, and always really helpful.   The only bad thing is trying to find a parking spot. They have 1 spot reserve, otherwise your on your own. With a busy heb and restaurant near it, it can be hard to find some place to park

reviews.author: Thomas M.
reviews.description: I usually shop at Spec's. I realize small liquor stores' prices are going to be higher than Spec's, but this is a little ridiculous. The exact same bottle that always costs me $17.29 at Spec's cost me $25.97 here. That's $8.68 more...over 50% higher! How much are you willing to pay for convenience? Since my office is right near a Spec's, I will continue to plan ahead and enjoy the 33% savings. If you are willing to pay the "convenience fee," I will say this store was nice inside (like a Twin Liquors) and the guy at the counter was very friendly. My only complaint is the prices, but that determines where I shop. I'm a frugal person.

reviews.author: Mindy C.
reviews.description: Excellent selection of wine and beer. This isn't a huge chain so while it may be slightly higher in price on some things, the convenience, friendly staff and knowing I'm supporting a local make it totally worth it! If they don't have it, they'll get it for you. Highly recommend

reviews.author: JJ J.
reviews.description: Overpriced. One guy who didn't know what he was doing working by himself on a busy Saturday. Said my card wouldn't go through because it didn't have a chip in it. I took my business to Twin Liquors where my card worked just fine and saved myself some money! I will never shop here again.

reviews.author: Lyra C.
reviews.description: This local wine shop offers a very nice selection of wines, including my favorite Texas wine, and Argentinian Malbecs.  Many Liquors as well. They have a nice array of special gifts, or put together your own.  Linda is there to help with your questions and she's an awesome lady to know.  Always a pleasant experience, they really get to know their clients tastes and preferences.

reviews.author: Charlie M.
reviews.description: Visited this store on Christmas eve to pick up a few drinks.  I have never in my 20 years of living in the RR area been treated so poorly.  I went in, picked up what I wanted and headed to the counter.  Once there I was questioned about a bottle of peach ciroc.  I told the guy I never touch any ciroc, but he insisted I did over and over again.  A few minutes later a few other fellas walked up to the counter and he realized he had made a mistake.  I would have been ok with this if it were not for the way the clerk presented himself and kepting insisting it was me who picked up the bottle.  I was being accused of stealing a bottle of liquor wearing shorts and a pull over sweat shirt.  Where I could of concealed the bottle is a mystery to me.  Once he realized he was wrong he made a weak apology and continued on.  I will never visit this store again!  Just unacceptable...

reviews.author: Lacey B.
reviews.description: I'm a fan of this liquor store. The staff is helpful, I can find what I'm looking for and if I can't the staff can order it special for me. The prices aren't too bad and it is conveniently located near my home and near my neighborhood HEB.

reviews.author: Mike V.
reviews.description: Super nice, and friendly staff. Conveniently located super close to home. (Almost too close) This store has a nice selection of liquor, and a decent beer selection as well. If they don't have it, they'll order it for you. They are a few bucks higher, but worth it.

reviews.author: Jamie I.
reviews.description: This place rocks! Linda and Dave are so helpful and the manager Jake, is the best. So friendly and great advice!

reviews.author: Amanda C.
reviews.description: I walked in about a minute to close. The register shuts down after 9pm so it can't sell illegally. This wonderful cashier not only helped me find exactly what I was looking for, but also ran it to the register for me so I could buy it! This place was amazing!!! I strongly recommend this to everyone!

reviews.author: Matt G.
reviews.description: Always very helpful staff.  Tasting every Friday.  Ask for any type you want and they will try to get it for you.  The one problem is they are EXTREMELY over priced compare to other business in the Round Rock area.

reviews.author: Staci S.
reviews.description: This place has the nicest people and great selections at good prices!  The made some great suggestions and have never been wrong. They make buying booze fun!

reviews.author: Meday P.
reviews.description: I wish the Asian lady who works here quit, only her that makes me don't want to go back especially for pickup. She mostly at the pickup counter. She's not friendly, never smile and short in words, never say nice things like thank you, have a nice day .....after we made the payment/pickup. She's cold and means! She will ask you to show your order on the phone if match with the bag that you are grabbing but the way she did not so friendly.   Others staff is perfect, they're professional and friendly.   Food is good especially the fish dish. Fries as well. Love the new drinks that they are selling on the fridge. But if you use delivery service it won't taste the same.   3 stars because of that Asian waitress, otherwise 5. If manager or owner read this, please consider this waitress. She doesn't have a service mind!! She should find a new job that fit her style. I used to come here at least once every two weeks also order through DoorDash for pickup and sometime delivery, but I hate to see that waitress, so I might stop all.

reviews.author: Nicole B.
reviews.description: Hadn't been to a BJ's in forever, but it was one of the few sit down spots open after 9pm in the area and we were hungry after a long day of work and travel. We had to wait just a couple of minutes because they were getting a big influx of guest - seems like some sort of dance show had just let out. Gary was our server and even though my favorite pasta has been discontinued (RIP blackened chicken pasta) and they were out of my second choice item (turkey burger) Gary had a great attitude and solid recommendations and solutions to keep the night on track. I ended up getting the half rack rib special with a beer that he recommended to pair and of course everyone was more than happy to share my pizooki. Give it a try, nice staff, quick service, solid food and open late.

reviews.author: Chris Lee O.
reviews.description: Keely is the best! I have been doing curbside service for years and she always gets my order right, calls me by my first name --and is super sweet! Thx you Keely for always taking care of my order. She is definitely detail oriented and customer service friendly!

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: My son and had dinner here and we were both first timers at this location. We both ordered the Nashville Hot Chicken Sandwich with extra pickles. I got mine with mustard, his was plain. I had a side of fries which were delicious and he had a side of the grilled honey sriracha brussel sprouts, which are awesome. Service was fair, and our server, Kelly, didn't split the check correctly, minus one star, and more than half the tables were closed despite having shields between them, minus one star. They have a great food and beer menu and we will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Nika L.
reviews.description: Great customer service, they even sold us for $5 set of glasses with BJ's logo.

reviews.author: Tina A.
reviews.description: Had us wait on a table in a nearly empty restaurant.... But the bar was packed...  It's not about social distancing

reviews.author: Kelsea K.
reviews.description: Wow I see a lot of politically motivated ratings here... how sad!  I like this chain and this was my 1st visit to this location.  We were seated after only a few minutes and I appreciated that they had half of the 2-top center section closed to reduce germ-spread!  Server was new but did a pretty great job getting food and drinks out. Bar was a little slow for how many tables were filled... but food was great and dessert was devoured!   I'll definitely be back!  I really wish the yelp app would stop truncating my photo gallery... I can't even get to my photos from this experience to post them!

reviews.author: Royal B.
reviews.description: Atmosphere 4 Cleanliness 4 Service 5 Food Quality 4 Likelihood to return 5 1-5 (5 Best!) 4.4  My first visit to a BJ's Restaurant.  My first restaurant meal since covid-19, in a dining room.  The service was incredible!  Some of the best I have had in ages.  The food quality was fresh, tasty, good portions.  I don't like the fries they use (good quality and hot, I just don't like "that" french fry.)  We may be moving close to this area, so it may be part of our routine out now and then.  Good job!

reviews.author: Bret B.
reviews.description: I've eaten here before and really enjoyed the product (all the BJs are really good really) but this location has turned into a joke honestly. We've tried to eat here on three occasions in the past month, every time we walk in, maybe 1 in 4 tables is seated. Then they tell us it's going to be a 1-2 hour wait. I'm all about social distancing and being safe during these times but that's ridiculous. It's either bad management unable to staff the location or just an EXTREME overabundance of social distancing. We gave them two chances and the third time we're done. We'll just go ahead and drive to the next nearest one and get seated sooner. Every single couple/group that came in during the 5 minutes we spent there had the same appalled look on their face when they saw the place practically empty and an hour wait.

reviews.author: Sean L.
reviews.description: BJ's was always one of my favorite restaurants, but not this location.  I ordered a family bundle meal directly from their website.  I got a call from the door dash driver a bit later and he said they had no record of my order.  I texted him a photo of my e-receipt and he showed the manager.  Apparently they didn't have the Shrimp Scampi -Tri-Tip Bundle I ordered at this particular restaurant so the order cancelled automatically and I got no notification from the restaurant.  The Door Dash driver had to cancel my order and he said someone from BJ's would be calling me.  They called and said they could have another bundle with a different item ready and cooked in about 15 minutes.  I said ok. that works.    30 minutes later I get a phone call asking when I was coming to pick up the order? I said I ordered delivery, not pick-up. He said, "you have to order on our website to get delivery."  I told him I did the first time.  He just, "Oh".  So I said, "So you are not going to deliver this?" he said he couldn't.  So I just said refund my money and this is the last time I will be going to this store.    You would think that maybe a manager would have called back to apologize or something, but nothing.  I just hope I get my refund.    Good luck with this store!

reviews.author: Lori H.
reviews.description: We have been here numerous times and have not had any problems.  Our arrival started with their webpage no longer accepting the online waitlist, wish I knew before?!  We arrived and then, found out that they had not taken that down reserve ahead of time option, so I reserved a seat for nothing, still waited about 40 minutes.  By the way, you have to be present to get on the waitlist like any other restaurant in town.  When it was time to be seated there probably 5 empty 2 top tables, and they were seating us next to a large party of 10!  Hello, can we move a few tables down?  So we picked another table and sat.  The host came and asked if we would like to move to a booth once it's cleaned as he pointed to the table, never were moved, and the original hostess that sat us brought our silverware and we assumed we were no longer moving.  Waited 15 minutes for our beer after waiting for our server.  Placed our order at 8:25 and got our food within 15-20 minutes, luckily!  By then, we were starving.  Be patient since all dining is lacking employees.  No pics to show since we woofed down our food!

reviews.author: Fatima A.
reviews.description: My favorite day of the week is tuesday. You may be thinking to yourself, "tuesday?? are you serious?? what could be so great about tuesdays and what does that have to do with Bj's?". Well tuesdays are the best day of the week because pizookies are only $3! The only thing that can make $3 pizookie tuesday better is our wonderful waitress Kyla! Kyla was kind, attentive, and accommodating. You can tell she is an extremely hard worker and earns every cent she makes. If you want to spice up your tuesdays, come to bjs and request kyla as your server.

reviews.author: Stephanie C.
reviews.description: Got a delivery via Uber eat. The pizza was smaller than a baby bite of pizza. Charged over $45 for  horrible hot Cesar salad and baby bite pizza. Beware.

reviews.author: Rashaka B.
reviews.description: COVID Superspreaders Restaurant  Stopped by to try $10 burger night.  They do NOT adhere to COVID19 guidelines  Waitresses walking around with masks covering their mouths only or only covering their faces when they approach a table.  They were sitting people at tables without being social distance (6 feet apart).  They had to be above the state limit for in-person dining inside.  As I was leaving, there were 30 people in the waiting area with ZERO social distancing.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: I have always had consistently good food and service here. We have eaten here many times, and although I didn't order it tonight, one of my favorites here is the Jambalaya. It is a little hot for my wimpy tastebuds, so I order it with light cayenne. And it comes out just right. We've always had consistently good food and service.  I suspect some of the more negative reviews may be from those who come during peak hours (which we always avoid).

reviews.author: Jeremy R.
reviews.description: 2pm on a Sunday, and they don't have enough staff to seat people.  Literally half the restaurant is empty, all the tables in the bar are empty, and the hosts are telling the lobby full of people waiting that it's a 45min wait because they don't have waiters for the open areas of the restaurant.  Who ever created a schedule for a weekend afternoon to have this few people working is stupid as hell.

reviews.author: Rachel R.
reviews.description: Can you do less than one star?  We walked in on my BIRTHDAY,  we had a horrible day in Austin with trailer trouble.  Finally got our trailer fixed .  Found the nearest restaurant, BJ's Brewhouse.  The manager refused to serve us because of our appearance.  We are normal people who have been to the lake and had our trailer break down.  Not perfect,  not horrible.  She said we were drunk and would not serve us.?  How does a disheveled appearance equal "drunk"?  There were 5 people in our party.  We left went to Longhorn Steakhouse and had a lovely dinner.  Thank you Trevor.  I will never walk into another BJ's Butthouse EVER!

reviews.author: Christine H.
reviews.description: Very very bad service, I'm so sad as my family is from Vegas and we spend a pretty penny at BJ's every week in Las Vegas unfortunately we stopped at this BJ's here in Cedar Park Texas and are very unhappy. The service was horrible and the hostess and waitress were very rude and the manager completely ignored everything.

reviews.author: Sarah V.
reviews.description: Just ate here tonight and I am so disappointed. It was just plain bad and there were multiple things incorrect on our meal. Kids pasta came out with no sauce at all. They brought out the alfredo sauce separately when I asked and it was awful, probably straight out of a jar. The croutons in the salad were all burned. Both of the steaks we got were very tough and chewy, although the flavor was not bad on this. The chicken Parmesan had no seasoning. I'm not even exaggerating, I don't think there was anything on it, same with the broccoli that came with it, but the white cheddar mashed potatoes were good. They also brought out another incorrect item, which I wouldn't normally mention because when I pointed it out they did correct it, but I mention it because it just shows more how much of a mess the kitchen is. My server was very friendly and attentive, did not have an issue with service, just quality of food. This meal cost $100 and I'm cringing over it. I wouldn't recommend going and I don't see myself coming back, personally. Which is a bummer because I liked this place! Definitely should have just gone to Longhorn!

reviews.author: Elizabeth B.
reviews.description: Called to see what the wait time was on a Friday night and the woman on the line said there's no wait time but it was subject to change. Okay, understandable. My boyfriend (who has a darker skin tone and has dreads as well might I add) and I go in and still, there's no wait time and it was not busy.  The woman at the front says we can sit anywhere near the bar and a server will be right with us. We sit anywhere as she said we could and about 3 servers walk pass by us and we make eye contact with all of them, multiple times, and they still don't serve us and I feel it had to do with our skin tone. Again, it was NOT busy and the servers were tending to all of the other tables but ours. We just got up and left after about 10 minutes of not being acknowledged. Writing this review to give others a heads up that if you have a different skin complexion you may not get served either :) There are much better businesses to support and this establishment is not recommended.

reviews.author: JoAnn M.
reviews.description: Best place in Round Rock to get your pizza and/or wings. The food was awesome and customer service was incredible.

reviews.author: William D.
reviews.description: This place is hands down the best pizza spot in Austin I've been to thus far. The staff is knowledgeable, friendly, and quick/attentive. I've even had the pleasure of being served by the owners themselves. I always LOVE a good NY style pizza spot, and this is that and beyond. They have Gyros, calzones, wings, and an impressive line of draft beer.  P.S-- try the cannolis, they're bombski.  Thank you guys for being awesome!!!!! See yah soon.

reviews.author: T G.
reviews.description: I ordered two pizzas one being a taco the other being a combination. I was utterly amazed at the quality and taste and overall satisfaction of the service here.  It took 14 minutes from the time I ordered till the time it is ready even though they were very busy!  The quality of this pizza is amazing I was very very surprised they also have other items such as wings and whatnot.  I suggest if you're in the area it's a must have if you're in the mood for pizza.

reviews.author: Mandy W.
reviews.description: I have ordered food a few times from here, alfredo, Caesar salad, cannolis, gyro and my husband wings and a calzone... EVERYTHING is delicious you can't go wrong with anything! I have ordered delivery through Yelp! and never had an issue when I ordered to go for curbside it had an option to text when you are there and it never came out I had to go in to grab it that has been the only issue the few times I had ordered.

reviews.author: Lauren T.
reviews.description: Pretty good pizza!!  I just got a couple of slices and would definitely go back. The mozzarella sticks are realllly good too!   The sauce has good flavor and it was delivered really fast. Very close to New York pizza but the crust is a little thicker! When it arrived, I was pleasantly surprised to see that it looked 10x better than the pizza in some of the other pictures. I think because my slices were jumbo, that they are a bit thinner than their other pizza (which I love)

reviews.author: Joe I.
reviews.description: We ordered pizza and mozzarella sticks from Pizza delight this is a New York-style pizza place. I ordered the Italian Pizza, mozzarella cheese sticks, and the Cherry Cheese Cake. The delivery was very fast and the Pizza was still hot. The Mozzarella cheese sticks were awesome, and of course, we love the cheesecake.

reviews.author: Stephanie Y.
reviews.description: I consider myself sort of a pizza connoisseur and could eat it several times a week. I like to make homemade pizza from time to time as well and always like trying new places. I told my husband I was tired of getting pizza from the same places and wanted something new. This restaurant has almost all good reviews and they tout being voted best pizza in Round Rock. I really don't understand why. We got two kinds of pizza and two appetizers. The pizza was undercooked and you could still see the shredded cheese which was not fully melted. Flavor and quality was not great either. Definitely not legit NY style pizza. The garlic knots have no noticeable taste of garlic due to all the other herbs they put on them. Service was fine, but disappointed based on how many people think this is the best pizza. Based on reading other reviews, I am Expecting a rebuttal from the owner in 3, 2, 1....

reviews.author: joshua r.
reviews.description: The (old) owner Eddie doesn't pay his test shifts  All the food is comes frozen (except the pizza dough)  Food safety is a joke and cross contamination is a huge issue with raw chicken wings all over a small kitchen near prep areas  The wait times are 100% guesswork from the Eddie's wife running the register  But by all means, overpay for mediocre pizza

reviews.author: Nellie J.
reviews.description: Meh.  I guess I need to give them another chance.  Went on a Monday for the first time and was hoping for a beer and some Monday special I'd heard about.  I guess they were busy and their air conditioning was out so I guess Monday specials and beer were out too.  The pizza was good, but I felt it was overpriced.  The wings were okay (not as crispy as I'd like), didn't care for the blue cheese much or warm celery/carrots.

reviews.author: Bijal P.
reviews.description: I wanted to order pizza from a different place and decided to give this place a try.  I ordered on a Friday and they were def busy cause my pizza arrived late.  Once the pizza arrived it was piping hot so hot that when we took one slice of pizza all the toppings started coming off.  So we let it cool down I love the crust I have to say it was very crunchy my kids enjoyed their pizza. The other thing I loved was the sauce yummy very fresh almost like home made.  The only thing I did not like about the philly cheese steak pizza was that it fell apart.  The pizza in general has a good amount of topping and ratio for each slice.  Overall not bad I may try something else next time but my kids pizza was good

reviews.author: Chanel M.
reviews.description: Ordered Pizza Delight via Door Dash last night. It was one of the more lengthier wait times, however, I decided to go with them to try out something new but it was delivered as estimated. I ordered a medium pizza with pepperoni and extra cheese which was great. It was delicious. The marinara, pepperoni and cheese were all fresh and tasty.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Pizza Delight is as the name describes- delightful! I love the crust of the New York-style pizza. It is just the right amount of sauce and the lunch pizza and salad is great. I'd highly recommend this place in Round Rock right by HEB Plus. The owner and team are friendly. I'll be back for this affordable and delicious pizza!!

reviews.author: Michaela M.
reviews.description: Had a major craving for some good pasta so I Ordered spaghetti with meatballs and instead of receiving actual spaghetti noodles, I received penne pasta.  the pasta had barely enough sauce to have flavor and meatballs seemed to be frozen but heated up. I do not think this dish was actually prepared fresh so that stinks.   They had a great deal for $5 off on DoorDash but most likely will not be ordering from here again unless it's pizza.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: I was looking for quick pizza takeout and this place did just that. I ordered a $20 specialty bundle that included one large pizza, one large salad, and 6 wings. For $20, I felt that was a great deal. I did feel it was a little pricey to add extra toppings on the pizza. I ordered it from my house which was about 15 minutes away and when I arrived everything was ready to go and bagged up waiting for me. A guy brought it out to my car curbside and made sure I had a mask on, which I appreciated for his health and mine. Everything was still hot when I got home and the pizza and wings were devoured quickly. I ate the chicken caesar salad the next day and it was tasty and fresh as well. Would recommend trying this local pizza shop!

reviews.author: Arlene M.
reviews.description: Food is good here. We've really  enjoyed the lemon pepper wings! Well, service here isn't consistent. One day my spouse and I walked in to dine in there and service was awesome. The polite, welcoming male told us to have a seat and they'd take our order. We came back days later(to dine in)  and the tables were dirty, it wasn't very busy btw. We sat down looked at the menu. 10 minutes pass and no one helped us AT ALL. they didn't talk to us, acknowledge us. So I went up to just order while everyone stood around. I'm not sure what the process is here ?? But they sure as heck weren't going to come to us.  Well, as I ordered I felt so uncomfortable and as if our presence was an inconvience. 2 other times during this SAME week ( separate days) i walked in to order pretty large orders for my kids final days of school. Similar service was given. No one bothers to greet you and one of the workers said he'd help us when he had a chance. Ok sure, yeah we waited. Lol no biggie I guess?   Long story short we enjoyed the food and spent a lot of money here in just one week but eh the service here convinced me not to come back. Good food, inconsistent rude staff simple as that.

reviews.author: Jill P.
reviews.description: I placed a catering order for my son's first birthday. I called and was told I'd be contacted by the owner. Samantha called me back the same day and I was able to place the order with her. My order was finalized with her via email.  I ordered a tray of salad, a tray of ziti, pizzas, wings and fries. On the day of the party, pick up went smoothly. Food was ready on time and they helped my husband bring the food out to the car. Of course the food was delicious and all the hot items were still hot. They even gifted my son a present for his birthday. A very thoughtful touch. Overall a great experience! Pizza Delight will continue to have my business.

reviews.author: Jacque S.
reviews.description: Delish. Our go to pizza place when we don't want to go out. Love the phill steak Meat on the pizza!

reviews.author: Stephen W.
reviews.description: Ordered a pizza from them today and they either dropped it or tossed it at my door like a newspaper. Then when contacted they said they were too busy to replace it and refused to refund me. Well this place has lost all future business from me. Try to help the local pizza place and they obviously don't care about their customers.  Goodbye pizza delight, never again!   Update: I find it amusing that this establishment tries to blame their own internal issues on others instead of taking responsibility for bad customer service (see Pizza  delight comment below) We had no problem contacting the vendor. Let me be clear. It was Pizza Delight that delivered the pizza, not a 3rd party. It was Pizza Delight that refused to replace the Pizza(within a 50.00 order) because they said they were too busy and it was Pizza Delight that refused to provide a refund for the broken Pizza. Any local business that cannot take responsibility for poor customer service, is not the local business I choose to help in these current times. As for 3rd party vendors, it was that vendor that stepped up with a credit to my account since the local establishment refused.

reviews.author: Rick V.
reviews.description: Great pizza place. We've done pick up and dine in. The staff, including the owner were friendly and attentive. The owner was taking pictures of a new pizza developed by a staff member and offered a couple of big pieces while we waited for our dinner. Very good!

reviews.author: Jeff C.
reviews.description: I wanted to try a local pizza spot and I really was feeling the pizza. Im glad I did a small pizza it wasn't bad and just right for me. It was pretty tasty and I will recommend it to anybody.. The wings wasn't fried enough for me but the pizza is clearly on point..
